loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Clarita requested her twentieth third loan from NWTF for 26,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a hardworking farmer and mother of three children: two daughters and a son. The family's only business activity is farming. They keep livestock and cultivate a large variety of vegetables and fruits. 

Susanna and her children are doing their best to gather each harvest and have a profitable farm.

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is what Susanna asks for enlarging her farm. The loan will help her to purchase four oxen, plus seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. Susanna will be very glad to receive lenders' support and that will be a big support for her family's farm.

As this is Susanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen, plus seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad,  es una persona casada que estudio hasta noveno vive junto a su esposa e hijo
José se levanta a las 5:30 a.m., él junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a al terreno camina 2 kilómetros y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales.

José planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche, de la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca podrá comprar más animales.
texts.en: José, 64 years old, is a married man who studied until the 9th grade, and he lives with his wife and child. He gets up at 5:30 A.M. and together with his wife works in the profession of agriculture that he learned from his parents. In order to get to his land he walks 2 kilometers and works during the morning, and his wife does the domestic tasks. The loan that he is requesting is to buy a cow that will help him in the future to increase the production of milk to sell and gain additional income. José plans to buy more animals with the income from the sale of milk, from planting, and from the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rene Maria

texts.en:
Rene Maria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Rene Maria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rene Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta es separada y tiene 4 hijos, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo que es de su propiedad Antonieta es vendedora de comida, ella trabaja ofreciendo platillos a los albañiles de diversas construcciones, lo cual es un trabajo bastante pesado puesto que debe ir de un lado a otro con ollas, platillos y cubiertos Antonieta pide un prestamo para comprar quintales de arroz y fideo puesto que le sale muy caro comprar estos insumos al raleo Antonieta es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar  y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Antonieta is separated. She has four children and lives in La Paz in a brick house that is her own. Antonieta sells food. She works selling dishes to masons and other construction workers. It's pretty heavy duty work because she must go out with pots, dishes, and cutlery. Antonieta is asking for a loan to buy sacks of rice and noodles since these ingredients are very expensive to buy. Antonieta is the only source of income in her home and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles for her food stall

loans.name: Hubaldo

texts.es: Hubaldo es soltero pero tiene dos hijos aunque vive solo  y en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo Hubaldo trabaja como chofer y necesita credito para comprar una laptop para uno de sus hijos (aunque el equipo va a ser usado por los dos a final de cuentas)Hubaldo es el único sustento para sus hijos, la madre hace mucho se distanció de la familia, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Hubaldo is a single father of two children and lives in the city of La Paz in a brick house. Hubaldo works as a chauffeur and needs the loan to buy a laptop for one of his children (even though it will be used by both after all). Hubaldo is the only support for his children, the mother distanced herself from the family a long time ago, and because of that he needs help.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his son

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.  

Arlene requested her twenty fourth loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items, such as canned goods, eggs, soap,  sugar, coffee, etc., to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Beverly has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending.

Beverly has sustained her business through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She sells clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income from electronic mobile prepaid services. Liza is borrowing PHP 3500 through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to resell.

Liza has sustained her business through her past two loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is 54-years-old and married with seven children.

Ma. Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Ana aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem is a 53-year-old married woman. For about 10 years she has been working in machine embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy another machine with spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Kareem dreams for her children's bright future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy another machine with spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es:
José de 60 años de edad, esta acompañada, estudio hasta sexto grado y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m.

 José se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres, para llegar al terreno en donde cultiva camina 2 kilómetros y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja como vigilante en una gasolinera.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita para arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 60, is married. He studied through the sixth grade and wakes up every morning at 5 am. 
José earns his living in the trade of agriculture. He learned it from his parents. To reach the land where he grows requires a walk of 2 kilometers in the morning. His wife is devoted to domestic chores. Every evening, he works as a watchman at a gas station.
The loan he is requesting is to buy a team of oxen to plow. His land needs it and he can earn additional income by plowing other fields which will help support his family.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen for plowing fields

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en: Akbari is a 52-year-old married woman. She has six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing agriculture work for many years. She crops different vegetables and fruits and sells them out in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Akbari applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her grow more crops, which ultimately helps generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 40 años de edad, es una persona acompañada que estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su esposa y se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposa  que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana.

 Miguel junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre para llegar al terreno camina 2  kilómetros y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche en los alrededores.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca para la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

 Miguel planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, de la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca; podrá comprar comprar un terreno donde tener sus animales
texts.en:
Miguel is 40 years old and is a family man who studied through the sixth grade.  He lives with his wife and gets up every morning at 4:30am along with his wife who helps him with agricultural work in the morning.  

Miguel and his wife work together in agriculture, a job that Miguel learned from his father.  They walk 2 kilometers to get to their plot of land and work in the morning. His wife also works at home and milks the cows that they posses in order to sell milk in the area.  

Miguel is asking for a loan in order to buy a cow for milking. They will sell the milk and thus obtain additional family income.  

Miguel plans to buy a milking cow with the income that he obtains from his current milk, from his harvest, and from the loan.  He will also be able to buy a bit of land where he can keep his animals.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small pharmacy in the center of the town of Stepanavan. She is a pharmacist by profession and provides high quality service to locals who come to her pharmacy.

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is for Anna who needs to purchase medical supplies needed for the pharmacy. She will be very thankful to lenders for their support. 

As this is Anna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for medical supplies for the pharmacy

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38-years-old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, chips, etc. to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling young coconuts.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, chips, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Aida is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of recycled materials to resell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Raffia

texts.en:
Raffia is a 55year-old married woman. She runs a small business manufacturing hair bands. She offers various types of hair bands in different colors.  She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list.  

She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family.  

As Raffia wants to grow her business, she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of elastic, thread of different colors and packs of beads for embellishment. 

She will be able to meet the increasing demand for her hair bands more consistently. 

Raffia is in her eight loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.  She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy elastic, thread of different colors and packs of beads.

loans.name: Fatmira

texts.en:
This is the 40 year-old Fatmira and her family; 12-year-old daughter, nine year old son and husband, Alfred. 

Fatmira has recently opened a little village store and she wants to put the final touches to it, including shelves and stock to sell. 

Kindly note that her store is the only one in the village for the moment and it is located in a touristic area, thus, she is confident that she will do well. 

Fatmira and Alfred have also engaged in agricultural activity for the past few years.  They have been planting and harvesting beans and fodder and they have two dairy cows and three mules that they use for transportation to pull their plow during preparation of the land for plantations. 

(Traditional in their region is the delicious alcohol drink ‘raki’ made from wild plum fruit.)

loans.use: to buy shelves and inventory for her store.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). They have been running this business for the past six years and earn a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, juices, milk, biscuits and grains. It will allow them to meet the increasing demands of their customers consistently.  She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, juices, milk, biscuits and grains.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia es casada tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Celia se gana la vida como repostera su especialidad son las masas y las tortas Celia necesita un prestamo para refaccion de vivienda Aunque Celia es apoyada por su marido, lo que ambos ganan no alcanza por eso ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Celia is married, has two kids, and lives in La Paz. She lives in a brick and cement house which is her property. Celia earns her living as a pastry cook, her specialties are dough and cakes. Celia needs the loan to repair her house. Although Celia is supported by her husband what both earn is not enough so she needs help.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 56 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Josefa has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by buying and selling ready to wear clothing. 

Rosario is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosario has sustained her business with the help of nine previous loans from NWTF. 

Rosario hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 46 years old married woman. She has sold scrap for the past 10 years.  

Rani buys bottles that once contained drinks from companies like Pepsi and Coke.  After crushing and recycling the bottles she sells them to people in her community. 

Through her business Rani makes enough income to help meet her family's needs.  Rani has three school-age children.  She is responsible for providing them food, good health and an education. 

Rani is in sixth loan cycle with Kashf foundation, and she requests a loan of Rs.45, 000/- to buy bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bottles to recycle.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 21 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buying and selling of bamboo business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of bamboo to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Lakhimoni

texts.en:
Lakhimoni, age 25 years, is an energetic housewife from the village Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her two small school-going daughters and husband in their small kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw). Her daughters are in grades 4 and 1.

Lakhimoni’s husband is a farmer. He has been involved in this agricultural activity for 10 years. He mainly cultivates rice in his own farmland. He has good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation. He wants to boost his agricultural business to strengthen his family's financial situation.

Lakhimoni heard that Kiva’s partner BJS gives business loans to rural women, and she has taken a loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.

Her ambition is to enlarge her business for which she is struggling a lot. She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of paddy rice.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is 33 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Rasheedan’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children; all are school-going. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Menoka

texts.en:
Menoka is a 34-year-old woman, married to Jagabondhu. They live with their three children (two sons and one daughter) in a remote village Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri. Though both Menoka and her husband are illiterate and only can sign their names, two of their children are in school, in grades 5 and 3. (One is too young to attend school.)

Menoka's husband owns a cycle-van (a kind of transport used in rural areas for carrying goods and people). He earns money by driving the cycle-van. He is the only earning member for the family, but the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses. So they thought of purchasing a new van, and they are planning to give the old one on hire for carrying people and goods, which will give them additional income.

Menoka has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van for her husband who is a young, enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to provide his family members with a normal standard of living.

She hopes this will give her family financial stability. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her a loan to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for business.

loans.name: Borimang Noo Kumya - Tampion Group

texts.en:
Gurimpaga is an active woman from Tampion, a city situated in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has five children. 

Gurimpaga is a member of a shea butter processing group called Borimang Noo Kumya.  She has been in business for over five years and she makes a good profits from her work.  She was trained by Grameen Ghana how to process high quality, premium shea butter for European and local markets.

Gurimpaga has asked for a loan of 6,500.00 GHS to buy 60 bags of shea nuts and a tool to extract the butter from the shea nuts. 

The loan will help Gurimpaga increase her income, profits and enable her to repay her loan and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts and a butter extraction tool.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 23-year-old woman with three children (one daughter and two sons). She lives with her children and her husband, Bhisma, in Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw). She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer, engaged in land cultivation. They are uneducated and can sign their names only. But they are providing education to their children, two of whom are in school in grades 1 and 2. The third one is too young to go to school. They dream that their children get higher education.

They have chosen agribusiness because they have their own farmland. They grow various vegetables there such as eggplant, potatoes, bitter gourd, chilli, etc. They sell their produce in the local market. This business is the only source of income for the family, so they try their hardest to grow quality products in more quantity. 

Now they want to cultivate jute, which is a very profitable crop. They believe that farming in one's own land is more profitable than harvesting crops in someone else's land. The only hindrance is the lack of capital.

Kalpana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs. She hopes with the profit from selling jute, they will be able to build a concrete house. She wants her children to lead a better and smoother life than they have now. She also hopes that her hard work will help her to make her dreams come true.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping her financially.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en:
Manzoora  is a 26-year-old married woman. She has five children. She strives hard to meet their needs, which include food, clothing and health. She deals in a business of manufacturing clay pots. She is very experienced and makes various types and styles of clay pots. 

She generally uses a hand spinning tool to prepare her pots, which is a very time-consuming process. Now she has decided to use an electric machine to increase productivity and quality. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to purchase an electric machine and some packs of good quality clay. 

She is a very good client and pays back on time; it will be her third loan cycle. She wants to introduce her products to nearby cities, which will ultimately help in generating more profits.

loans.use: to purchase an electric machine and some packs of good quality clay.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past four years.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She has five children; one of her daughters is also shown in the photo. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits, juices and milk to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of providing a better standard of living to their children.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, juices and milk.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia lives in the town of Dansoman in the greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past 11 years, Felicia has been working hard to manage her retail fresh fish business. 

To help expand her business, Felicia has requested a loan of 1,500 GHS (Ghana cedis) from ID-Ghana. The loan will be used to buy two cartons of fresh fish and maize, and will help Felicia to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Felicia hopes that in the future she will be able to have more business outlets.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fresh fish and maize.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is from Nyandarua South. He is 39 years old and is married; he and his wife have two children, aged 14 and 10.

Stephen is a farmer, an occupation he has been in for two years now. He has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a cow. He plans to use the expected profits to buy sheep.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power solar lighting.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 31 years old married woman. She sells milk with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  

Shamim looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk while her husband sells the milk to different places on his bicycle on a daily basis. 

They are happily working together to support their family. They have three children. 

They need to earn much more money to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. 

In order to make huge profits, Shamim requested for a loan of 45,000/- PKR to buy a buffalo. She hopes to increase in her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez has successfully built her business stitching clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She earns sufficient income to contribute to the family expenses. Previously, with the help of Kiva loans, she purchased the required raw material for meeting the demands of her customers. Kaneez is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She will use this loan to purchase more spools of thread, cloth, ribbons, and packs of needles and buttons. This will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, cloth, ribbons, and packs of needles and buttons.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a young married housewife and a mother of two loving daughters. She lives with her husband and daughters in the small village Kholaigram in the district Jalpaiguri. Her husband, Asit, is engaged in agribusiness. Their children are continuing schooling and are in grades 6 and 1.

Farming is the only source of income for the family.  So, Rita's husband gives his hard labour from dawn to dusk, planting different vegetables. He works very hard to improve his family's living conditions and takes any opportunity he has to do so. Rita is also very active and hardworking. She helps her husband in his work. They together carry the produce to the markets to sell. 

Now they want to cultivate pan (betel leaves), which is a leaf used as a mouth freshener in rural regions of India. They think this will be a profitable business.

A loan for this purpose would help her to cultivate this crop, so Rita has taken a loan from BJS to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides to start pan cultivation. She hopes this will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and standard of living.

She is very grateful for the help from the lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for cultivation of pan (betel leaves).

loans.name: G.s. Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Medalla Milagrosa está conformado por cinco integrantes, madres solteras con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor  a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  la coordinadora es  Rosa y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa en su casa de habitación y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, short, camisas, ropa de niño, piyamas, toallas, ropa de cama, vestidos, ropa interior. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Medalla Milagrosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Medalla Milagrosa is made up of five members, single mothers with ten children under their responsibility. They are native to Nagarota, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. They characterize themselves as hard-working and responsible, with the desire for personal improvement. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources, they were unable to study.

Currently, they strive to come out ahead. The coordinator is Rosa, and her economic activity is the sale of clothing from her home and by request. She dedicates some ten hours a day to her business offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in work capital and supply her merchandise, such as: pants, skirts, shorts, shirts, children’s clothing, pajamas, towels, bed clothing, dresses, and underwear, so that in the not-too-distant future she is able to have a higher income. 

The solidarity group Medalla Milagrosa is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to the people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and supply her business purchasing and selling clothing, such as: pants, skirts, shorts, shirts, children's clothing, pajamas, towels, bed clothes, dresses, and underwear.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 25 years old and married with nine children; six of her children are in school.

Mila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from making and selling bags.

Mila aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 44-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been in the business of selling milk for many years. She sells milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Ruvimbo Group

texts.en:
Loveness is the leader of Ruvimbo group. She is forty years old, divorced and has two children. They are aged eighteen and twelve years and are both attending school. 

Loveness has a retail shop under Chipinge branch in the south eastern part of Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for ten years and sells her products to the local market. She has no other source of income. She says that the main challenge to her business is not having enough groceries to resell. Loveness requested this loan of $200 over 6 months through MicroKIng to purchase additional stock. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the stock in the shop. In future she would like to be a leader in grocery distribution in her area.

loans.use: to pay for groceries for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a thirty-three year old married woman. She runs a business selling milk. She has two calves and one cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to cover a decent life. She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is Shamim's seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with the Foundation's support. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the production capacity of her milk business, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Mithaq's Group

texts.en:
Mithaq is a member of this group from Iraq. Mithaq is a forty-four-year-old widowed woman. She has two children. After her husband's death, she had a difficult time supporting her family. Mithaq has a beauty salon that provides hair styling, cuts and coloring, face massages, make-up and beauty care. The income from the salon is used to support her family.
 
When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widowed women, Mithaq took a loan to buy an air conditioner and chair. She is aiming to increase business and change her salon to a beauty center.

The story of Mithaq  and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development's clients.

The women in the photograph have chosen to blur their faces for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and chair

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a fifty-six-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Hanifan has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of their house. They have fifteen years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains and beverages to meet the increasing demand at their store. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, iron and fabric

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 73 años y 3 hijos, ella esta viviendo con su marido y su hijo menor  en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino donde paga un alquiler Nancy necesita un credito para pagar el tratamiento medico del hijo menor que se fracturó el pie y necesita que le saquen los tornillos que le pusieron, el hijo no tiene seguro médico. Nancy y su marido reciben jubilacion pero esta es insuficiente, por eso necesitan su ayuda
texts.en:
Nancy is 73 years old and has 3 children. She is living with her husband and youngest son in La Paz in a house with fine details where she pays rent. 

Nancy needs a loan to pay for the medical treatment of her youngest son who broke his foot and needs the bolts that were put in taken out. The son does not have medical insurance. Nancy and her husband receive retirement payments but they are not enough. That is why they need your help.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical treatment.

loans.name: Dúo Misericordia Group

texts.es:
DUO MISERICORDIA
Doña Sandra Patricia es originaria de la giralda, del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 27 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre los dos están trabajando arduamente para salir adelante con sus hijos.
El sueños de ella es ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con mas variedades para poder vender mas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Duo Misericordia

Sandra Patricia is native to La Giralda, in the municipality of Tecpan. She is 27 years old. Under her care are her two youngest children. She makes a living from the production of traditional cloth by hand and raising chickens.

Her husband works as a day laborer, and thanks to his support she is continuing forward with her business since the two are working arduously to come out ahead with their children.

Her dream is to increase her business, supply it with a greater variety to be able to sell more, and so obtain better profits to be able to send her two children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials for the production and sales of traditional cloth.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 24-year-old married woman. 

She has been successfully running her business manufacturing artificial flowers. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband works as a laborer but earns insufficient income to support her family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy raw material such as fabric, glace paper, and tissue paper, along with the packs of paints in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace paper, and tissue paper, along with the packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema is a 42-year-old married woman. She runs a beauty parlor with her daughter (also shown in the photo). She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her high-quality services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a broader variety of products for the beauty parlor.  She applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more regular customers, and to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 Years old, married and has two children. She sells potatoes, which she has been doing for three years.

Grace requested a loan, which she will use to buy more potatoes to sell. She will use the profits to buy food for the family and a vehicle for transportation. In the future, she hopes to be a wholesaler and live a prosperous life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Badeya ont en moyenne 47 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), habits et charbon du bois. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Sokona (femme  debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 corbeilles de tomates en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sokona  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en: The four members of the Badeya group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 47 years old, with seven children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the community of Mandé, the circle of Kati, and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members work as vendors selling condiments (tomatoes), clothing and charcoal. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. Mrs. Sokona (the second one standing from left to right in the photo) is a well-known vendor of condiments (tomatoes). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes wholesale in Bamako. She sells retail, at the market and as a street vendor, to a customer base consisting mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Sokona plans to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some minor household expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Brnakot village which is in Syunik region.

She lives there with her husband and two children. Her daughter is a university student and her son attends school.

Laura and her husband work hard to sustain their family's living and it is very difficult for them to cover their daughter's university tuition. 

The requested loan will be a very big support for Laura and her family to cover university costs and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Liana's university tuition

loans.name: Lumturije

texts.en:
Lumturije wants to buy a small agricultural truck to use for transportation of her products. 

Lumturije is married and has three children; with her husband and her oldest son who is 27 years old she does agriculture and raises livestock. They plant  large quantities oats, onions, beans and red onions. They also have cows and they sell raw milk and baby calves to the villages around. Not only that, but they buy other baby animals such as sheep and goats and sell them to others. This is why they really need a little truck.

Their village has a very cold climate in the winter, and in the summer is very cool. A common traditional food that is cooked here and is common in the Balkans and Eastern Europe as well is tripe soup or just tripe used in other dishes or just baked in the oven with fresh or dried herbs or stew.

loans.use: to buy a little agricultural truck to transport his products and baby animals.

loans.name: Sabeeha

texts.en: Sabeeha is a 45-year-old lady. She deals in selling cloth. She buys a variety of cloth from the main city market and then sells it to the people of her local community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Sabeeha is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to increase her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Valientes  se llama este grupo que está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  También están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa.
Luisa se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender, y hoy quiere poder emprender un nuevo trabajo que es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que está luchando y esforzándose por poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Luisa es también la tesorera del grupo  y pide su préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos y materia prima  para la elaboración de productos de limpieza,  etc.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Valientes” (Courageous Women) is the name of this group that is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to move forward. They are also taking the poverty elimination survey. One of the members is Sra. Luisa.

Luisa sells cleaning products that she makes herself. Today she wants to be more enterprising by starting a new venture of selling cosmetics. She is a very hardworking woman who is striving and pushing to get ahead.

Sra. Luisa also serves as the group treasurer. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, supplies for making cleaning products, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, supplies for making cleaning products, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Doralicia

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y juntos mantienen la economía de su hogar. María tiene 4 años de contar con una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su hogar de habitación. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan a muy buenos precios. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención y para la conexión de tuberías para aguas grises. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, tubos y pagará la mano de obra  para la realización de las mejoras.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. Together they pay for the household expenses. 

Maria has had a small store for four years, which with a great deal of effort she has managed to set up in her home. Many people prefer it, as she always has what the customers are looking for, at good prices. Maria is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can pay for the construction of a retaining wall and the connection of wastewater piping. 

With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, brick, rebar and pipes, and will pay for labor to carry out the improvements.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, brick, rebar and pipes, and pay for labor to build a wall and connect wastewater piping.

loans.name: Isacar

texts.es:
Isacar tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos con alimentos balanceados que le permitirán un rápido desarrollo para ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Isacar is 27 years old and lives in Cayaltí district, located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Isacar raises and sells animals like pigs. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 PEN to buy young pigs to fatten them with balanced feeds. This will allow for a rapid growth and he will then offer them to his clients at a higher price, generating more revenue for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Yenira Esperanza

texts.es:
Yenira Esperanza tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma humitas, papa rellena, “champu” una bebida hecha a base de maíz, pina y otros ingredientes, sus clientes son estudiantes y sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 700 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción adobe y cemento para el arreglo de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yenira Esperanza is 37 years old and lives with her son in Oyotún district, a community where people engage in agriculture, commerce and livestock-raising. It is located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

She sells prepared foods that she prepares herself, such as humitas (corn tamales)  stuffed potatoes, and champu (a drink made from corn, pineapple and other ingredients). Her customers are students and her neighbors. 

She has a requested a loan of 3,700 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy construction materials such as adobe and cement. This is so that she can do repairs to her home and this way have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as adobe and cement, for repairing her home.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo Buena Vista de San Martin,Este Dúo esa Esta integrado por la señora Ana Luisa de 23 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: The group "Dúo Buena Vista de San Martin,Este Dúo" includes Ana Luisa, who is 23. She has worked in the weaving and sale of "tejidos" [traditional Guatemalan garments] for some years. She wants the opportunity to take out a loan to buy primary material for the weaving and sale of these traditional garments.

loans.use: to buy primary material for the weaving and sale of traditional garments

loans.name: Lucha Lorena

texts.es:
Lucha Lorena tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío El Ingenio, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, también se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería como ropa de variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucha Lorena is 35 years old. She lives with her parents in El Ingenio village, a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires, located in Morropon Province, Piura Region on the North Coast of Peru. This community has basic water and electricity and it's people work in agriculture, commerce and raise cattle.

Lucha sells school supplies and she also sells clothing for women, men and children. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy merchandise like a variety of clothing to offer to her clients and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married, runs a food-vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as cooking oil, spices and meat. She has been in this business for the last five years and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, spices, and meat.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a recycled materials business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Miguel Alexander

texts.es:
Miguel de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no lo pusieron y lo poquito que él aprendió fue con sus hermanos que fueron a la escuela, él solo vive con la madre, su hijo, y un sobrino por lo tanto 3 dependen de él.


Miguel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos 15  años, su padre le enseño cómo ganarse la vida y fue entonces cuando dice que lo llevaba cada vez que él iba a chapodar para preparar la tierra donde sembraría,   se fijaba bien y su padre le decía que en un futuro tenía que trabajar para ganarse la comida por sí mismo. Esta es la única fuente de ingresos que él tiene su sobrino le ayuda aunque sea a halar agua para cuando lo necesita en la siembra del maíz, el lugar donde siembra le queda a unos 10 minutos de su casa y viaja caminando.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes que necesitara para lo producción de su maíz, esta con la esperanza que le dará un poquito de abono y con el préstamo terminara de completar los fertilizantes que le hacen falta para la siembra. Si el crédito le es otorgado él estará feliz porque dice que podrá cosechar y con las ganas seguir adelante para lograr su objetivo.

  
Sus metas y propósitos son poder este año con la ayuda de Dios tener una buena producción, porque dice que la casa donde vive es bien pequeña y quiere ir ahorrando con las cosechas para alcanzar de mejorar su casita y así tener en un mejor techo a su madre, su hijo y su sobrino que esta también a cargo de él y él se siente mal porque no puede darles lo necesario a ellos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old. He did not have the opportunity to study, as his parents could not afford it, and the little he learned was with his brothers who did go to school. He lives with his mother, his son, and his nephew, who are all dependent on him.

Miguel has worked in agriculture for about 15 years. His father taught him how to make a living. Miguel says his father would take him each time he did the the clearing of the land to prepare it for planting. This stuck with him, and his father told him in the future he would have to work to get his own food. This is the only income Miguel has. His nephew even helps to pull water when it's needed for planting corn, as he does the planting about 10 minutes walking distance from their home.

Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers he'll need in maize production. He hopes that, with a little compost and this loan, he'll have finished with all the fertilizers he'll need for the planting. He says getting this loan will make him happy, as he'll be able to harvest, and he wants to move forward to achieve his goals. 
 
His goals and objectives are to have a good production this year, God willing, because he says that the house he lives in is very small and he wants to go continue saving with each harvest to achieve his end goal, to improve his house and thus have a better roof for his mother, son and nephew. Miguel is in charge of them and says he feels bad because he can not give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer needed for maize production

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Faustina belongs to Unity Group and lives in Dansoman. She is 35 years old, married and has four children. 

Faustina has been in the grocery business for a year now.

She is on her second loan with ID-Ghana. With the Kiva loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase groceries to resell.
Together with her colleague, Faustina will need a total amount of GHS 2,500 to increase their stock.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, boissons, du bois de chauffage, et d’huiles d’arachide. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme debout  au milieu sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Faïda group is comprised of married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families. On average, they are 48 years old and have eight children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the town of Mandé (Kati Cercle), and know one other through relatives, neighbors, and friends. 

The group members have small businesses selling high-quality clothing (pagnes wax - i.e. traditional wrap arounds), beverages, firewood, and peanut oil. With the goal of growing their businesses, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan. 

Madame Mariam (the woman standing in the middle of the photo) is known for selling high-quality clothing (pagnes wax). She plans on using her loan to buy 20 pagnes wax at wholesale prices in the main market. She will resell these on foot at retail prices to a clientele comprised primarily of women. 

With this loan, Madame Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35, 000 FCFA that she'll put back into the business and use to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Irene Roxana

texts.es: Irene tiene 44 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 17 y 16 años de edad y su pequeño hijo de un años de edad. Irene trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a sus hijas e hijo lo necesario. Irene desea terminar de construir una pila para almacenar el agua, además desea construir una galera para protegerla del sol. Por lo anterior  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, azulejos, etc.
texts.en:
Irene is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters, aged 17 and 16 years old, and her little son, who is 1 year old. 

Irene is employed at an institution close to her town, and thus earns her livelihood and is able to provide her daughters and son with what they need. 

Irene wants to finish building a "pila" [pictured, a typical cement water storage container] to store water, and wants to build a roof to protect it from the sun. Therefore she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized steel, wood, cement, tiles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel, wood, cement, and tiles to finish building a water storage container

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nely ella es casada y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia realiza tejidos como chompas y guantes y los vende en los diferentes tiendas donde venden artesanía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas de colares y palitos de tejer.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Maki.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Sumac Maki community bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Nely is a member of the group.  She is 52 years old and has three children.  She works at her business selling crafts.  She makes knitted items such as sweaters and gloves and sells them to different stores where they sell crafts.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  She has done this work for many years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her business selling crafts.  She is requesting this loan to purchase bleached wool and knitting needles.

The members attached to the group photo took their photo after the meeting because they requested permission for work reasons.  The person who has their face blanked out does not belong to the Sumac Maki community bank.

The other group members work selling clothing, selling crafts, and have a grocery store and a restaurant.  They are grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promise to make their payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase bleached wool and knitting needles.

loans.name: Richard Ernesto

texts.en:
Richard belongs to the communal bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray”. He continues to work in taxi services. Richard has been doing this work for a long time, and it is going well, thanks to his commitment every day to his work. He wants to continue working in this way to move forward. 

Richard is requesting a loan for maintenance of his car. 

Richard is grateful for his loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila, con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región, Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de construcción civil, desempeñándose como maestro constructor, tiene en experiencia en este rubro, elabora de manera artesanal Laboratorios, ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como yeso y cemento en mayor cantidad para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 58 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of La Matanza, a quiet community. La Matanza has a warm climate, and its population is engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. It is located in the Morropon Province in the region of Piura in northern Peru. 

Aurelio provides the service of civil construction, serving as master builder. He has experience in this area, specifically in the handmade building of laboratories. He has requested a loan of 600 soles for the purchase of a greater supply of materials such as plaster and cement to continue with his business and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of materials like plaster and cement for his business

loans.name: Marrita

texts.en:
Marrita is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marrita is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marrita has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Marrita requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell.

Marrita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marrita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Tolors village with her husband and two little sons (her elder son is in the photo). 
Hermine's husband is an army officer and Hermine herself is a farmer. She keeps livestock, cultivates barley, emmer wheat and potatoes, and grows some fruit trees. 
Hermine has requested this loan of USD 1,500 to invest on her farm. The loan will help her to purchase seeds and fuel for land cultivation and she will be able to have a rich harvest during the season. 
Hermine has taken a loan from a local financial institution, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Hermine has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, toothpaste, soap, candy, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is married and has four children. She is from Sis village. Her family is involved in farming. Zhanna and her husband keep livestock and cultivate some forage for feeding animals. They took a piece of land last year where they make the cultivation work. 

Zhanna requested her first loan from SEF for $700, which she will use to enlarge their livestock with more goats. As this is Zhanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre casado de 47 años de edad, actualmente tiene ocho hijos ambos estudian y trabajan, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Desde hace 10 años don Miguel  inicio la labor de la producción de mil de abeja, eligió esta actividad porque anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa que se dedicaba a lo mismo, es como de esta manera decidió empezar un negocio con este producto, que hasta la fecha ha sido bastante rentable y productivo, en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
A través de lo que realiza puede contribuir a  los gastos de su familia, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de materiales, que servirá para la producción de miel de abeja.
Uno de los sueños de don Miguel es producir 100 cajas de mil de abeja al año, para obtener mejores ganancias, y con ello poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 47 year old married man. He has 8 children who work and study. They live in the Department of Sololá.

Ten years ago Miguel started his work producing honey. He decided on this work since he had worked in a company that does the same thing. So he decided to start a business in this field. Up to now it has been fairly productive and profitable as far as revenues and profits are concerned. He can contribute to the family's expenses with what he earns.

He is requesting a loan of 5,500 GTQ to buy materials which will be used in the production of honey. One of Miguel's dreams is to produce 100 cases of honey per year to generate more profit. With that he could improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of honey.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 47 years old, married, and has four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales, which she has been doing for many years. Zahida has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Zahida has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more metal, gasoline, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a face massage machine, chair, generator, and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Siguidia sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes), sucre, habits et échalotes. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou (femme  assise à l’extrême  droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 700 paires de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges  au grand marché  en gros. La revente se fait à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Siguidia group are married in monogamous relationships. On average, they are 42 and have five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the town of Mandé (Kati Cercle). They know one another through neighbors and their revenue generating activities in the Kanadjiguila market. 

The group members sell plastic shoes (for men and women), sugar, clothing, and shallots. With the goal of growing their cash supply, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third group loan. 

Madame Bintou (the woman seated at right in the photo) is very well known for selling plastic shoes (for men and women). She would like to use her loan to buy 700 pairs of plastic shoes (for people of all ages) at wholesale prices in the main market. She will resell them in Kanadjiguila to a clientele comprised primarily of women. 

With her loan, Madame Bintou would like to earn an average monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA that she will reinvest in her business and spend on her children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado de nivel académico,  es acompañada el esposo se dedica a la agricultura los hijos de María ya están en hogares apartes solamente vive ella y su esposo en casa.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  pero también se dedica a la agricultura con el esposo y cuando regresa del campo ella cuida unos pollos que tiene ella,  desde muy pequeña el papá le enseño la agricultura ya que en la familia solo eran mujeres  y ellas apoyaban al papá al trabajo;  pero eso le sirvió de mucho ya que hoy en el nuevo hogar que tiene con su esposo también le ayuda porque se han quedado solos,  los hijos ya se le casaron pero ellos felizmente trabajan en la agricultura. 

María se quiere dedicar muy de lleno a la compra de pollos y cuidarlos ya que es una fuente de ingresos que puede obtener cuando estos pollos crezcan y así ayudarle al esposo a llevar el sostén de la casa. 

Con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien y hoy quiere cultivar más también ya hiso la casita para los pollos y eso lo logro con el préstamo;  con el préstamo solicitado hoy comprara  abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, para cultivar.

En el futuro María tiene los sueños de seguir trabajando en la agricultura y si Dios le permite tener una vejez muy alentada para que Dios le de fortaleza de seguir trabajando y en un futuro poder tener una granja y ver muchos pollos y cuidarlos.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old, she studied until fourth grade, and she lives with her spouse who makes a living in agriculture. María's children now live in their own homes, and she and her husband live alone in their home. María is a homemaker, but she also works in agriculture with her husband, and when she comes back from the fields, she takes care of her chickens. Her father taught her about agriculture when she was very young because in her family, there were only women and they supported their father in his work. This has helped her a lot because now in her new home with her husband, she is able to help him now that they are alone. Their children are now married, but happily they work in agriculture too. 

María wants to fully dedicate herself to purchasing chickens and taking care of them, because that is a source of income that she will receive when the chickens grow, and she will be able to help her husband to support their household.

She was successful in her previous loan, and now she wants to farm more. She has already made a coop for the chickens, and she achieved this with her loan. With the loan that she is requesting now, she will purchase compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to farm. In the future, María dreams of continuing to work in agriculture and God willing, she hopes to have a healthy old age so that God may give her the strength to continue working, and to be able to have a farm with many chickens to look after.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to farm.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margarita de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera se separó de su esposo por problemas personales.


Margarita se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también se dedica a la agricultura al  regresa del campo ella cuida unas sus gallinitas  que tiene. Desde muy pequeña el papá le enseño la agricultura ya que en la familia tenían que trabajar mucho para lograr el pan de cada día y ellos apoyaban al papá al trabajo; pero eso le sirvió de mucho ya que hoy en día ella se dedica a la agricultura de lleno. También hace tamales de elote y sale por las tardes a vender, ya tiene casi catorce años de dedicarse a vender tamales.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, pesticidas y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara para este año, espera que le vaya muy bien en el cultivo para que le de muchos ingresos a la hora de la cosecha.

Margarita espera en Dios que le de vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y poder seguir dando el estudio a los hijos y que se preparen ya que es la única herencia que ella les dejara y el oficio que les enseñe también en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Margarita is 44 years old. She studied up to Grade 9. She is a single mother separated from her husband for personal reasons. Margarita does domestic work but also is a farmer. And coming back from the fields she also cares for the chickens she has. Her father taught her farming when she was quite young. In her family they had to work a lot to gain their daily bread and they all helped their father with his work. She also makes corn tamales and goes out in the afternoon to sell them. She has been making tamales for 14 years.

The loan Margarita is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and pay the rent on the land she is going to work this year. She hopes things go well this growing season so she receives lots of revenue at harvest time. Margarita prays to God that he gives her time to continue cultivating the land and be able to provide schooling for her children who are studying now. This is the only inheritance she can leave them. She is also teaching them to farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pesticides and pay for the rent on the land.

loans.name: Serepio
