texts.en:
Serepio is 35 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. 

For the past five years, Serepio has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand his business, Serepio has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Serepio to generate greater profits and improve daily sales.

Serepio hopes that in the future he will be able to transform into a sub pharmacy. 

Serepio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Serepio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs

loans.name: Hamuza

texts.en:
Hamuza is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. 

For the past three years, Hamuza has been working hard to manage his motor spare parts store, which sells motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Hamuza has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods like tires, oil, filters, and diesel filters, and will help Hamuza to generate greater profits and acquire more goods. 

Hamuza hopes that in the future he will be able to produce quality services. 

Hamuza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamuza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods like tires, oil, filters, and diesel filters

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 43 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her clothing and textile business, which sells clothes and fabrics. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothing, and will help Eva to generate more income and earn more profits. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a training school. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children; none of them are currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells sugar, salt, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beer, exercise books, and pens. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  sugar, salt, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beer, exercise books and pens in larger quantities. It will also help Emmanuel to generate greater profits, and increase his capital. 

Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to boost his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, detergent, soap, soft drink,  beer, exercise books, and pens in larger quantities

loans.name: Lovinsa

texts.en:
Lovinsa is 34 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lovinsa has been working hard to manage her restaurant, selling cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Lovinsa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge, chairs and tables, and will help Lovinsa to generate greater profits and to cover medical expenses. Lovinsa hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to a lodge. 

Lovinsa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lovinsa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Nuestros socios vives en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis

La socia es la Sra. Augusta ella es casada y tiene 47 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.


Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Villa Quiquijana.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Villa Quiquijana. They live in the district of Quiquijana, which is in the province of Quispicanchis.

Member Augusta is 47 years old and married. She works running her business, which is a grocery store. She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in business for one year and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

She is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream by making these resources available, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

The rest of the members do business selling animals, selling grains, running another grocery store, and running a restaurant. 

The members attached to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting. They were absent because they had to work. The person whose face is covered does not belong to Villa Quiquijana communal bank.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Zonia is still working in her business selling clothing. She has had the business for a good while and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.

She wants to continue working in this way so she can continue to support her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy jackets for her business. She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to pay her agreed instalments.

loans.use: to buy jackets for her business

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from fishing. 

Connie requested another loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy another sewing machine and materials for her tailoring business. With the loan, she will be able to further build her business. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with eight children. Gemma is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gemma has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for seven years.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 31-year-old engaged man living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He graduated from the college of pharmacy and now works as a pharmacist. At first he was working as a pharmacist in one of the pharmacies in the capital, Sana'a city, to look after his family. He couldn't accumulate enough money from his salary to start his own business, so he decided to sell his mother's jewelry in order to begin his own business, and after a time to open his own pharmacy. He started his own business two years ago.

Bashir earns good profits, but he faces the hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demands of the patients. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders who helped him with his first loan. That loan helped him very much in developing his business and purchasing more medical requirements. His profits also increased since he become able to meet the demands of different types of customers. 

After he successfully repaid all the installments on his first loan, he is now requesting another loan to expand his business more by purchasing more medical requirements. His dreams are to diversify his business and start up a big pharmacy. For this business, Bashir applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. He will use this loan to buy more medical requirements and medicines.

Bashir looks forward to improving his business and expanding it more, as well as opening a branch in the capital city. He hopes to get married soon.

loans.use: To buy more of medical requirements and medicines for his business.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor de 42 años de edad, su estudio fue hasta sexto grado, actualmente está casado, su esposa se dedica a la sastrería, dos hijos de ellos ya están acompañados viven en el mismo terreno, pero en casitas separadas  y con Héctor solo vive uno de sus hijos y su esposa.

El cliente se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero por las tardes se dedica a la sastrería igual que su esposa, ya tiene casi 12 años de dedicarse a la sastrería ya que ese es un trabajo que tal vez no genera los mejores ingresos pero son ingresos que constantemente ahí están aunque no sean muchos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla maíz, herbicidas, abono y pago de alquiler de 10,500 metros cuadrados de terreno.

Los sueños de Héctor son seguir cultivando la tierra y también poder tener una sastrería que las personas le busquen el trabajo; pero esto lo lograra con mucho sacrificio departe de él y la esposa.
texts.en:
Héctor, 42, studied until 6th grade. Now he's married. His wife earns her living as a tailor. Two of their children are already married and live on their land but in separate houses. In Héctor's house, he lives with his wife and only one of this children.

He has earned his living in agriculture but in the afternoons he works on tailoring with his wife. They have done this work for 12 years because it is a job that does not generate the best income but there is constant income, if not much. 

They are requesting a loan from CrediCampo to by maize seed, herbicides, fertilizer, and rental fees on 10,500 sq. meters of land.

Héctor's dreams are to continue farming and also a tailor shop where people will seek out his work. This is achieved with much sacrifice from Héctor and his wife.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizer, and pay rent on farmland in order to grow corn

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 45 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells cosmetic items. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy items like Vaseline, lotions and perfumes, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and add more stock to the shop. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy items like Vaseline, lotions and perfumes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Florence to generate greater profits and increase on capital. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with neither of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her beer business, which sells stocks of beer. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beers and will help Grace to generate greater profits and increase on borrower capital. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire enough capital. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. 

For the past eight years, Charles has been working hard to manage his lodge /hotel, which offers accommodations and food. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items and bedding for the lodge, and will help him to generate greater profits and provide better services. 

Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to have a first class lodge in the area. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food items and bedding for the lodge

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. 

For the past six years, Micheal has been working hard to manage his shoe shop, which sells shoes. 

To help expand his business, Micheal has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help him to generate greater profits and increase his stock.

He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

Micheal is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Micheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with none of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, George has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells shirts and coats. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more coats and shirts and will help George to generate greater profits and increase on capital. George hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more coats and shirts.

loans.name: Kijubi

texts.en:
Kijubi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Kijubi has been working hard to manage his clothing shop. 

To help expand his business, Kijubi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bed skirts, bed covers, skirts and shirts, and will help Kijubi to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Kijubi hopes that in the future he will be able to expand into a boutique. 

Kijubi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kijubi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase bed skirts, bed covers, skirts and shirts.

loans.name: Basco

texts.en:
Bosco is 36 years old and lives in the town of Ojwina in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Bosco has been working hard to manage his hardware business, which sells hardware items like cement. 

To help expand his business, Bosco has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add cement to his stock and will help Bosco to generate greater profits and increase business capital. Bosco hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Bosco is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bosco who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add cement to his stock.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ojwina in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jenet has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells beans, maize, and peas. 

To help expand her business, Jenet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, maize, and peas and will help Jenet to generate greater profits and increase on the business. Jenet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big enterprenuer. 

Jenet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jenet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize, and peas.

loans.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY,el banco esta ubicad en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir y trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Las Mercedes de Katañiray" communal bank, whose members live in Cusco District, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is 53 years old, lives with her partner and has a son. 

She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells various kinds of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy and other items. She wishes to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. The member is requesting a loan so that she can buy sugar for her business. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy sugar for her business.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Stellah has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells cooking oil, mineral water, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items. 

To help expand her business, Stellah has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, mineral water, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items and will help Stellah to generate greater profits and stock the shop. Stellah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Stellah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stellah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, mineral water, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items.

loans.name: Gregoria Escarly

texts.es:
Gregoria es una joven de 27 años, la cual trabaja como secretaria en la municipalidad de su distrito, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos de estudios ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de ciencias contables y administrativas en la universidad de su ciudad.

Gregoria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá solventar los tramites de su bachiller y de esta manera poder obtener un mejor empleo y mejorar sus ingresos, para así poder luchar pro hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un mejor puesto de trabajo y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 27-year-old woman who works as a secretary in the municipality of her district. She is a young women with a great desire to get ahead in life, which is why she is using her earnings to pay for the cost of her studies. She is currently studying Accounting and Administrative Sciences at her city's university. 

Gregoria is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to pay for the costs of her bachelor's degree so that she can get a better job and earn more to make her great dream a reality: "to have a better job and to have a business of my own."

loans.use: to pay for costs associated with her bachelor's degree

loans.name: Sedress

texts.en:
Sedress is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sedress has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells cooking oil, basins, jerricans, cups and plates, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items. 

To help expand her business, Sedress has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil, basins, jerricans, cups and plates, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items, and will help Sedress to generate greater profits and increase on stock. Sedress hopes that in the future she will be able to become a supplier. 

Sedress is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sedress who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, basins, jerricans, cups and plates, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angelle is 28 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past three years, Angelle has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

Angelle requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more clothes. The loan will help Angelle to generate greater profits and have a variety of stock. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. 

Angelle is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Angelle who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Edith Roxana

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer muy trabajadora,  ella labora en su pequeño negocio de panadería desde hace 7 años y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para salir adelante. 

Edith esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos para su negocio como harina, mantequilla, levadura, herramientas, entre otros; lo que le va permitir mejorar la atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas; asi ella podra seguir esforzándose por hacer crecer su negocio y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño; Tener una panadería mas grande”.
texts.en:
Edith is a very hard-working woman. She has worked in her small bakery business for 7 years and this is how she makes an income to make progress in life. 

Edith is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy supplies for her business such as flour, butter, yeast, tools and other items. This will enable her to improve the service to her customers and improve her sales. In this way she will be able to continue working hard to grow her business and make her big dream of having a larger bakery come true.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools for the bakery.

loans.name: Dúo La Finquita Group

texts.es:
Dúo la finquita  
Integrado por la señora victoria Judith de 36 años de edad, madre de 4 niños,  tres de ellos  estudian y uno cuenta don 3 años.  Ella hace algunos años estudio un curso de pastelería pero durante el tiempo se fue actualizando con respecto a decoraciones y estilos de pasteles hoy en día es muy conocida por la exquisitez de sus pasteles pero considera ella que aun le falta equipo para la elaboración de sus pasteles y es por ello que toca las puertas de FAPE  para que se le pueda otorgar un nuevo crédito para comprar el materia que necesita y con ello poder brindar un mejor servicio y calidad a las personas que le solicitan sus servicios como repostera
texts.en: The Duo La Finquita [Little Farm Duo] includes Victoria Judith, 36, the mother of 4 children. Three of them are in school and one is only 3 years old. Some years ago, she took a course of study to learn how to make pastries. During this time, she has been doing cake decorations and styles. Today, she is well-known for exquisite cakes. She does lack the equipment to prepare her cakes and is, therefore, seeking a loan from FAPE to buy the equipment she needs to provide better service and quality to people who request her services as a pastry chef.

loans.use: to purchase bakery equipment

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 39 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lenie has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 7 years and also earns additional income from a buy and sell crabs business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lenie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jacinta works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming vegetables. Jacinta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruit, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending business.

Jacinta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fruit, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 64 años de edad, es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero actualmente está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen tres hijos todos son ya mayores de edad, y están acompañados. Con Jaime solo vive la esposa y una nieta que le dejo uno de sus hijos.

Jaime tiene ya 20 años de experiencia de dedicarse a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres que ambos iban a trabajar y lo llevaban a él para que les ayudara y con el tiempo fue aprendiendo mucho esto y ahora dice que eso es lo que a él le gusta, sembrar porque sabe que después de un tiempo le dará frutos. 

De vez en cuando alguien lo busca para que vaya a rajar leña, de esta manera también genera ingresos para su hogar, el lugar donde siembra le queda a unos 2 kilómetros de su casa, su esposa cuando puede en algo le ayuda también y su horario suele ser de 6 a 12 del mediodía 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abonos, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago del alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva ya que está un poco atrasado con el pago del alquiler  del terreno  y con el préstamo lograra cubrir parte del alquiler y tendrá seguro el terreno para poder sembrar.

En el futuro tiene pensado sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados más, dice que su deseo es que Dios le de larga vida para criar a su nieta, darle el estudio y que siempre pueda cultivar,  porque de eso saca adelante a su familia y tener cada día una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is 64 years old and is someone who did not have the opportunity to go to school. Currently he is married and his wife looks after the domestic tasks. They have three children who are all adults now and have partners. Jaime just has his wife, and a granddaughter which one of his sons left him, living with him. 

Jaime has 20 years' experience of working in agriculture. He learnt this from his parents who both went to work and took him with them so he could help them. Over time he learnt all about agriculture and now he says this is what he likes, sowing seed, because he knows that after a while it will give him results. 

From time to time people ask him to go and chop wood, and by doing this he also makes some income for the household.

The land where he grows his crops is 2km from his house. When his wife is able to she also helps him and he generally works from 6am until midday. 

He is asking for the loan to buy corn seed, manure, herbicides and pesticides and to pay the rent on the land he cultivates, as he is a bit late with the rent payment for the land. With the loan he will be able to cover part of the rent and secure the land for planting.

In future he plans to sow a further 7,000 square metres. He says he hopes that God will give him a long life to look after his granddaughter and give her an education, and that he will always be able to grow crops, because this is how he supports his family. He hopes to continually improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, manure, herbicides and pesticides and to pay the rent for the land which he cultivates.

loans.name: Dúo Las Valientes Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS VALIENTES
Doña Consuelo es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 47 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de leña y carbón y a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
El esposo de ella se dedica a la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de el y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que con la ayuda de ellos el negocio a crecido bastante.
El sueño de ella es comprar mas mercadería tener lo suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y asi tendrá ella mejores ganancias para poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Consuelo is originally from Tecpan. She is 47 years old. She has two young children in her care. She sells wood and coal for a living and also makes traditional fabric by hand.
Her husband is in agriculture for a living and thanks to his support and that of her children, she continues moving forward with her business. With their support the business has grown sufficiently.
Her dream is to buy more merchandise to have enough to satisfy her customers. She would then have better income to be able to send her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to sell coal and traditional fabric.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Frank has been working hard to manage his spare parts business, selling auto spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  auto spare parts, and will help Frank to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to have a variety of parts in stock. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more  auto spare parts

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is 30 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children, who are all currently in school.  For the past 8 years Benedicto has been working hard to manage his retail shop selling sugar, soap, salt,cooking oil, and beans. 

To help expand his business, Benedicto has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy cartons of soap, cooking oil, and beans, and will help Benedicto to generate greater profits and boost the business and its income.  Benedicto hopes that in the future he will be able to have a fully stocked business. 

Benedicto is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benedicto who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy cartons of soap,cooking oil, and beans

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, none of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap, rice, flour, posho, detergent, cooking oil, eggs, sodas, and pampers. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  sugar, soap, rice, flour, posho, detergent, cooking oil, eggs, sodas, and pampers and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and increase her income. Harriet hopes that, in the future, she will be able to educate her children. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Harriet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, soap, rice, flour, posho, detergent, cooking oil, eggs, sodas, and pampers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Robert has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells maize. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better life. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Rosalie requested her seventh loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives in Yerevan, Armenia with his parents, wife, and sister.  He is a student at Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture, specializing in Soccer.

The requested loan is very important, and will help him pay for his university tuition and complete his studies there.  Sargis hopes for lender support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,  es madre soltera se separó con el esposo desde ya hace 18 años, en ese matrimonio procreo 4 hijos los cuales uno de ellos vive con ella y un yerno.

María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 20 años de edad,  antes ella trabajaba con el papá, pero luego que se acompañó siguió trabajando ayudandole al esposo, pero luego que se separaron de ahí a seguido trabajando a la agricultura con sus hijos para sacarlos adelante pero María no se queda solo ahí también se dedica a la venta de frutas, ella compra los palos de aguacate por cosecha y luego cuando ya hay fruto sale a vender esto le genera ingresos este trabajo de la agricultura lo hace en un horario de 6:00 am a las 11:00 de la mañana

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, semilla de maíz y para pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva;  ya que hoy ara más terreno que el año pasado porque le fue muy bien en la agricultura y espera que en este año le vaya de igual manera con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a single mother; she separated from her husband 18 years ago. From that marriage, she had four children. One of them lives with her, along with a son-in-law.

María has worked in agriculture since she was 20 years old. At first, she worked with her father. Once she was married, she continued working, helping her husband. After separating, she and her children continued working in agriculture to support themselves, but María didn't stop there; she also earns her living selling fruits. She buys avocado trees to be harvested; when the fruit is ready, she goes out to sell it, generating income. She does her farming work on a schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and corn seed, and to pay rent for the land that she cultivates. She is now plowing more land than she did last year because farming went very well for her; she hopes that with God's help, this year will go equally well for her.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and corn seed, and to pay rent on the land that she cultivates.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa es una persona de 33 años de edad, ella y su familia viven en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos: el primero tiene 11 años de edad, estudia sexto primaria y el segundo tiene 10 años de edad y estudia segundo primaria en la escuela que está ubicado en la comunidad donde viven, Santa obtiene sus ingresos en la venta de ropa típica, ella vende en la comunidad donde vive y en comunidades cercanas, ella solicita un préstamo a ADICLA por un monto de Q. 7,000.00, lo invertirá para comprar más ropa típica, con ello agrandar y surtir mejor su negocio, y con las ganancia que obtenga piensa construir una vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Santa es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Santa is 33 years old. She and her family live in the municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, in the department of Sololá. She has two sons: the first is 11 years old and is in the sixth grade, and the second is 10 years old and is in the second grade in the school which is in the community where they live.

Santa gets her income selling traditional clothing. She sells in the community where she lives and in nearby communities.

She is applying for a loan from ADICLA for Q. 7,000.00, which she will invest in buying more traditional clothing so that she can expand and stock her business better.

With the earnings she will get, she hopes to build a house to improve her family's living conditions. Santa is a person who has a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Dúo Los Eucaliptos Group

texts.es:
Duo Eucaliptos
Claudia, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de producto mexicano (sampoo, jabon, crema, pastas dentales etc.) el cual compra en Tapachula, inicio su negocio hace 3 años realizaba los viajes  una vez cada tres meses actualmente los realiza cada mes y solicita un nuevo crédito porque desea ir a el salvador para comprar ropa nueva y venderla aca en Guatemala, el sueño mas grande es poder comprar un carro y asi ahorrar un poco en los gastos que se generan al ir en microbús a comprar su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Eucalyptus Duo:

Claudia is single. She earns her living selling Mexican products (shampoo, soap, cream, toothpaste, etc.) that she buys in Tapachula [Mexico]. She started this business three years ago, making her trips once every three months. Currently, she makes the trip every month. 

She is requesting a new loan because she wants to go to El Salvador to buy new clothing to sell in Guatemala. Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a car, which would save her a little on the expenses of traveling by bus to buy her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, cream, toothpaste, etc., to sell

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is 33 years old and lives in the town of Iganga B in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Muhammed has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells beer, sodas, Splash juice, milk, and mineral water. 

To help expand his business, Muhammed has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beer, sodas, Splash juice, milk, and mineral water, and will help Muhammed to generate greater profits and increase his business. Muhammed hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Muhammed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhammed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase more beer, sodas, Splash juice, milk, and mineral water

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with none of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, George has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which sells garments. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy material for school uniforms, and will help George to generate greater profits and boost income. George hopes that in the future he will be able to have a fully established business. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy material for school uniforms

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 50 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Ayub has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which sells shirts, dresses, and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Ayub has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase suits and shoes, and will help Ayub to generate greater profits and add quality to the shop. Ayub hopes that in the future he will be able to add ladies' suits and materials. 

Ayub is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ayub who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase suits and shoes

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 47 years old and lives in the town of Lira, in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jacob has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells soap, sugar, posho, and soda. 

To help expand his business, Jacob has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, crates of soda, sugar, and beans and will help Jacob to generate greater profits and stock more goods. Jacob hopes that, in the future, he will be able to meet his customers' needs. 

Jacob is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jacob, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy rice, crates of soda, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sodas, biscuits, cooking oil, pens, pencils and other items. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sodas, biscuits, cooking oil, pens, pencils and other items, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and increase his income. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to have more stock in the shop. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy sodas, biscuits, cooking oil, pens, pencils and other items

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Rita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz es una persona de 29 años de edad, él y su familia viven en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene tres hijos de las siguientes edades: el primero tiene 11 años de edad estudia segundo grado primaria, el segundo tiene 8 años de edad estudia primero primaria y el tercero tiene 6 años de edad aún no asiste a la escuela, Cruz desde hace 5 años instaló una tienda de consumo diario (azúcar, arroz, frijol entre otros) en su casa, debido a que las persona tiene que recorrer una larga distancia para poder obtener lo que necesita, de allí obtiene sus ingresos, él solicita un préstamo por un monto Q. 4,000.00 comprar más productos para la tienda y surtirla mejor, el sueño de Cruz es que su tienda en el futuro este más grande  y obtener más ganancia y con ello ayudar a su familia para superarse.
texts.en:
Cruz is 29 years old. He and his family live in the municipality of Nahualá, in the department of Sololá. He has three children of the following ages: the first is 11 years old and is in the second grade, the second is 8 years old and is in the first grade, and the third is 6 years old and doesn't go to school yet.

Five years ago, Cruz started a daily needs (sugar, rice, beans, among other things) store in his house, since people have to travel a long distance to get what they need. He gets his income from this.

He is applying for a loan of Q. 4,000.00 to buy more products for the store to stock it better. Cruz's dream is for his store to be bigger in the future and to earn more money to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy and sell daily need items.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 28 years old, and despite being so young, is already the father of two children.  Mher lives in the Lusadzor village in the Tavush region of Armenia with his wife (21 years old), two children, and grandmother.  In addition to his day job, (he facilitates private cargo transfers) he is engaged in farming and agriculture.  His primary plan is to develop a swine breeding business.  Currently he has 2 pigs, 5 piglets, and 20 chickens.  He also has a plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes and a great variety of fruits.  His grandmother, who eagerly wants to help her grandson earn good money for his family, organizes the sale of his harvest. 

Mher is really proud of his farm; he started with just two piglets, and with the help of this loan, his successes in farming will increase.  Mher requests a loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams to buy two new types of pigs and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two new types of pigs and animal fodder.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 24 years old and he is a student at the paid division of Vanadzor State Agricultural University. Andranik lives with his parents and grandfather. With his family, Andranik is busy with farming in the village Urut in the Lori region. He perfectly takes care of his farm animals; in his farm he has three cows, three bulls, and four calves. 

Thanks to his mother’s skills of making different dairy products from milk, they sell cheese, butter, curd and macun (an Armenian national dairy product). Andranik plans to make his farm bigger so that he will also start to sell meat. 

He asks a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy bulls and fodder for his farm animals. Andranik hopes that the purchase of bulls and the income from its meat sale will help him to pay for his education as well.

loans.use: to buy bulls and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una persona de 45 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, tiene 6 hijos, 2 de ellos ya están casados con familia ya formada, tres viven aún bajo la tutela de ella, el primero tiene 22 años de edad, trabaja en la elaboración de güipiles, el segundo tiene 20 años de edad trabaja como jornalero en parcelas ajenas, el tercero tiene 18 años de edad también trabaja como jornalero, y la última tiene 14 años de edad trabaja en la elaboración de güipiles, María solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 7,000.00 para compra más ropa, tener más variedad y así atender mejor a su clientes, el sueño de María es que sus hijos tenga sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, she lives in the Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán municipality, in the Sololá department. She has six children, two of which are already married and have their own families, while three children still live under her guardianship. The first is 22 years old and manufactures traditional clothing. The second is 20 years old and works as a laborer on other peoples' land. The third is 18 years old and is also a laborer, while the last is 14 years old and manufactures traditional clothing.

María is seeking a loan in the amount of Q. 7,000.00 to buy more clothes to have a wider variety to better serve her customers. María's dream is that her children will have their own businesses.

loans.use: to sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 44 years old. She lives in Achajur village in Tavush region. Marine likes village life and the occupation that she is engaged in.  She has a beautiful farm where she works at poultry-keeping. She has 25 chickens. She sells both a lot of eggs and poultry for which she already has a lot of loyal customers. 

Marine is married and she has two sons. Her husband and her elder son periodically go to the Russian Federation where they do construction work. So Marine and her smaller son manage all the farm work and also plow their plot of land. The harvest of their vegetables (potatoes, carrots, cabbages, tomatoes, peppers and greens) and fruit (apples, grapes, plums, peaches and such) are sold by Marine herself at the city wholesale market. She also has a hobby of doing different design projects, for example flowers or such for wedding parties, which brings in a little but not extra income to her family.


Marine really wants to make her farm bigger and this loan amount is needed in order to buy several bulls and some animal fodder for them.

loans.use: to make her farm bigger by buying several bulls and some animal fodder for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows and pay off her previous loan. The two cows will replace the two cows that were stolen from her one month ago.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a 35-year-old married man with five children. His oldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest one is 3 years old. Hamid is a talented and responsible professional man. He has a great determination to improve the condition of his family. 

He has a furniture store and runs it very well. He started his business many years ago with a small amount of capital. From one time to another, this business goes high and it still improves more and more. He thinks that his business goes well because he loves what he does. He earns good profits from this business. 

Unfortunately, most of what he earns goes to the expenses of his family and to the cost of renting the store and the renting of his house. For this reason, Hamid applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more furniture and materials for his store in order to resell to his customers.

Hamid looks forward to expanding his business through opening other branches in the city and purchasing a pickup for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and materials for his store in order to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her welding business, which sells metallic suitcases and saucepans. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a welding machine, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and increased income. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand into a big welding shop. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rinku

texts.en:
Rinku is 26 years old.  She is married, a housewife and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  One of the children is a student in grade one and the other one is too young to go to school.  Rinku studied up to grade seven and her husband Jhontu, only 30 years old, attended school up to grade five.  They live in their own house in Malopara in Jalpaiguri district.

Rinku's husband has been working as a tailor for several years.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family.  He stitches frocks, trousers, shirts etc.  He sells these to his neighbors, who are his main clients.  Rinku also helps her husband in his work, after completing his household activities. The income from the business is not sufficient to meet all the household expenses.  They need to expand their business.  Rinku wants to be involved in this business.  She knows stitching, which she learned from her mother.  So she wants to help her husband.  But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a new machine.

She heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a sewing machine, which will be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

She wants to rent a tailoring shop in the local market in the future with the profit.

She is thankful to her lenders (Kiva and BJS).

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business .

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Alice, a hard-working mother of five from Nyamira, a rural village in Kenya. Her self-drive and passion has seen her practice farming for 20 years now. Her primary income sources are tea, vegetables, and other personal business. Alice really likes it when she realizes a profit after selling her eggs. However, limited funds frustrate her determination to progress out of poverty. 

Alice is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. This will help her not only to diversify, but also to increase her base of income-generating assets. Regular income from daily sales of milk will help her meet the high farm-related costs. This loan will help Alice’s family get more income and improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shamsn

texts.en:
Shamsn is 33 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Shamsn has been working hard to manage his store, which sells electronic items. 

To help expand his business, Shamsn has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more DVDs, TVs, and cables, and will help him to generate greater profits and improve his life style. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Shamsn is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shamsn who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more DVDs, TVs, and cables.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives in Yerevan with his family. He is a student at Yerevan State Economic University.

Last year, Sargis took a loan with the help of Kiva and SEF and was able to pay for his educational costs. By making the loan payments very responsibly, Sargis now asks for another loan for this year's tuition. 

He will be very grateful if lenders support him once more and give him an opportunity to complete his education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a thirty-one-year-old fashion designer and a tailor in Miritini, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of five whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last three years and is doing well.

This marks her third loan from Visionfund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase an embroidery machine and thread. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and thread.

loans.name: Yeicy Katherine

texts.es:
Yeicy es una mujer soltera de 27 años de edad, con un hija de 6 años de edad la cual tuvo que criar sola puesto que el padre las abandono dejándolas sin un hogar y sin un medio para generar ingresos. Yeicy para conseguir dinero comenzó a trabajar en tiendas puntualmente papelerías pues tenía la urgencia de conseguir alimento para su hija que en ese entonces apenas estaba por cumplir un año de vida, para Yeicy fue tan gratificante el trabajo en la papelería que se soñó con tener una propia y con la ayuda de unos ahorros y unos prestamos logro tener su papelería que como principal ventaja tiene la ubicación dado que se encuentra cerca al parque principal. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido nuevo y realizar manteamiento a sus equipos para tener en óptimas condiciones y puedan funcionar más rápidamente, esta urgencia le surgió cuando sus clientes le solicitaban un producto y ella no lo tenía, y quiere suplir esta falencia abasteciéndose de todo tipo de mercancía con las que espera generar buenos ingresos y alcanzar su sueño el cual es la construcción de una vivienda propia y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hija
texts.en:
Yeicy is a 27-year-old single woman with a 6-year-old daughter whom she has had to raise alone; her father abandoned them, leaving them without a home or a means of generating income. To earn money, Yeicy started working in shops, specifically stationery shops, as she needed to get food for her daughter, who at that time was about to have her first birthday. For Yeicy, the work in the stationery shop was so gratifying that she dreamed of having her own. With the help of some savings and some loans, she managed to get her own stationery shop whose main advantage is its location, which is close to the main park.

Yeicy is requesting a loan for the purchase of new inventory and to maintain her equipment so that it will be in optimal condition and can function more rapidly. This need came up when her customers were requesting a product and she didn't have it. She wants to remedy this problem by stocking up on all types of merchandise. With this inventory, she hopes to generate good income and reach her dream, which is to build her own house and to have a better quality of life for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods (foam materials, folders, and more) and to maintain her machines.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Protima is 24-year-old woman. She stays with her husband and two little children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of North Boragari in Jalpaiguri district. Their children are too young to go to school.

Protima is a housewife and her husband Subrata is a cycle van puller. The cycle van is rented from a local owner.  He carries goods and people in the van. From the beginning, they have faced many problems while covering all the household expenses.  Her husband's earnings are so little that it is hardly possible for him to meet the basic needs of the family.  So they want to purchase a cycle van, but they do not have enough money.

Then Protima learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan from them. She plans to use the loan to purchase a cycle van.  Like a rickshaw and auto, a cycle van is a kind of puller that carries people and loads from one place to another, especially in remote areas.  They hope it will enable them to strengthen their financial condition. 
  
She is thankful to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle  van for business purposes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her Agro-chemicals business, which sells maize seeds, insecticides and chemicals. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize seeds, insecticides and chemicals and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Fatuma hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct a rental house. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds, insecticides, and chemicals to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Las cajetas de María han tenido una buena aceptación  en su comunidad por su delicioso e inigualable sabor.  El  plátano, azúcar y coco  son los principales ingredientes que contienen los dulces que comercializa diariamente.  Gracias a su  esfuerzo y  entrega total  a  su labor, ha logrado conseguir buenas ganancias  y clientes fijos.
María desea  continuar ese  mismo ritmo de ventas y ganancias. Ella planea  contar con más capital,  con el fin de  disponer  de suficiente materia prima a la hora de preparar  sus cajetas. Por tanto, solicitó otro  financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito que le facilitará la compra de: Coco, Azucar, Leña y Guineo.  Su sueño es establecer su propia tienda de dulces en un futuro, también anhela mejorar  poco a poco la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria's caramels have been very well accepted in her community because of their deliciousness and their unmatched taste.  Plantains, sugar and coconut are the main ingredients in the candy that she sells daily.  Thanks to her effort and complete dedication to her work, she has been able to obtain good earnings and regular customers.  María hopes to continue in the same rhythm of sales and earnings.

She is hoping to have more capital so that she will have sufficient raw material at the time of making her caramels.  For this reason, she is seeking another Kiva loan that will allow her to purchase coconut, sugar, firewood and bananas.  Her dream is to open her own candy store in the future.  She also hopes to improve her home little by little.

loans.use: purchase coconut, sugar, firewood and bananas.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. Vardanush has a higher pedagogical education, and for many years she worked at the school as a teacher of biology and chemistry. Then, for some time Vardanush became unemployed, and now she works at the kindergarten as a cook. 

Vardanush is married, and she has a son and a daughter. Her son is employed, and her daughter is in her last year of school. 

Vardanush’s daughter now has some problems connected with her teeth. The doctor said that she must have a course of treatment.

Vardanush greatly hopes that, thanks to generous Kiva lenders and the received loan amount, she will be able to solve this urgent problem, which is too great a cost for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a course of treatment for her daughter's teeth.

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma is a young, energetic entrepreneur who lives in the small village of Kholaigram in Jalpaiguri district with her husband Subahan and a child.  Both Reshma and her husband received a primary education. They have a small bamboo, straw and mud-made house.

Reshma's husband is a carpenter. He makes small wooden furniture like tables, chairs etc. and sells them in the local market.  His income is not good enough to give a decent lifestyle to his family.  Thus Reshma has been selling milk for the past five years. She has one dairy cow.  She sells milk to many of her neighbors who are her main clients. She is motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life with good food and clothing.

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she needs to expand her business, but she doesn't have enough capital.  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another cow in order to get more milk to sell.  She hopes this will give her additional profit to fulfill her dreams.  She will use the profit for the financial development of her family.  She also plans to set aside some money for her son’s education.

She is much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow  for selling milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: have the working capital to start her new business idea of selling propane gas on credit.

loans.name: Sunflower Lom Group

texts.en: This is the “Sunflower Lom” group, comprised of five hard-working women. Haulunmoi, with her hand raised, is the featured profile member of this group. She is 23 years old and a mother to two beautiful daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Churachandpur, which is about 60 km from the main town of Imphal, in the northeastern state of India. Her husband drives a rented auto rickshaw in and around town. His daily income is 500 INR, approximately. Haulunmoi works as a paid weaver on a hired basis. Haulunmoi says that she doesn't earn much profit being a paid weaver. She wishes to own her own loom in order to get more profit, increase her productivity and generate more income. Therefore, she wanted to take a loan from Kiva to buy a loom to start her own weaving business. With the profit she earns, she wants to rent a shop in the market where she can sell her products. With her little savings, she will invest in her children’s education. In the future, she aspires to buy a plot of land and paddy field and build a house for the family. She says “Thank you so much for the support, Kiva” and wishes good luck. Likewise, the rest of the group members are also engaged in the weaving business.

loans.use: To buy a weaving loom

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora  Ana Mercedes de 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican a la  impresión de dibujos, letras, logotipos en  playeras, gorras, servilletas desde hace dos años, y solicita su crédito para comprar pintura, accesorios,  marcos ya que actualmente posee pocos para la elaboración de logotipos y poseen una gran demanda y no cuentan con material suficiente para elaborarlos   su sueño es poder hacer crecer más su negocio y poder tener una pequeña empresa ya que con el apoyo de su esposo luchan cada día para alcanzar sus metas y a través de su negocio ha sido de gran ayuda para solventar los gastos y poder darles una mejor atención y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes is 38 years old.  She has three children.  Her and her husband have worked printing drawings, letters, and logos on t-shirts, hats, and napkins for the past two years.  She is seeking a loan to purchase paint, accessories, and frames because at the moment she has very little to make logos, and she has a large demand but does not have the necessary materials to make them.  

Her dream is to expand her business and have a small company, as with her husband's help, they fight every day to reach their goals.  Their business has been a huge help in affording their expenses and providing their children with better care and an education.

loans.use: purchase materials to make logos.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother of two girls, one in high school and the other in primary school.  

She is an entrepreneur selling electronics to sustain her family. Being a member of one of our groups, she has been on the forefront of promoting solar energy through educating other women and referring them to the Visionary Empowerment Programme for purchases. To empower, her we have advanced her KES 100,000 to stock her shop with a variety of solar lamps and improved cook stoves that she can sell to make a profit and  grow her business.  This will make the lamps even more accessible to the clients who will no longer need to pay transport to come collect the lamps from our storage. 

From the lamps she will make a profit margin of between KES 200 for lamps and KES 700 for improved cook stoves and this will enable her to repay the loan as well as use some money to grow the business.

Being a very influential person  in the community, she will be able to reach masses as she plans to hold demonstrations  in the evenings when it's dark, which will help create more awareness and sell the products. In addition, it will also help increase the confidence in the solar lamps which have passed the Lighting Africa standards test of quality. Our motive is that by empowering her, we will have reached more people and hence empowered them in energy saving.

loans.use: To buy more stock of lamps and stoves

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a thirty-three-year-old mechanic in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a father who supports four in his family, and his wife provides for additional income.

This marks his third borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase stock of lubricants and spare parts and the anticipated profit to expand his business. He hopes to own a big garage in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of lubricants and spare parts

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Samson, a Kenyan resident based in Nyamira, a village known for its constituents’ staple food, bananas. Samson lives on a small piece of land together with his five children where they grow tea and keep farm animals. They have been making a living as farmers for the past years selling milk, eggs, and tea from their farm. Samson is also involved in other small seasonal businesses to make extra money.
 
He enjoys farming because he was not only born into it but also finds it profitable and self-fulfilling. Like many other farmers, his biggest challenge is limited funds to grow the operations. 

Samson is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The additional high grade cow will produce enough milk to provide Samson with enough income to repay the loan and also settle other farm related costs.

Your loan contribution will go along way to help Samson’s family improve their livelihood

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 28 years old and he lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. He has a vocational education of mechanics. For two years, Karen worked as a furniture maker, and then for several years periodically with his father, he did construction work in the Russian Federation. 

Soon after getting married, he decided to establish a farm in the village of Yenokavan, and with his family, take care and develop it. Now on his farm he has five cows and a large fruit garden, where he has apple, plum, pear and corneal trees. All the harvest from his farm he sells at the city wholesale market. He has a stable income now, and he is happy to provide his family and his parents with good living conditions. Karen has two sons. His wife works at the bakery.

Now Karen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, Nor Horizon, since he decided to start swine breeding. He wants to buy several piglets and also fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also fodder for them.

loans.name: Zuleima

texts.es: Zuleima de 43 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos en las edades de 5 a 20 años; él  vende pescado de mar: mojarras, tilapia roja, chivo,  lisa etc. Ella tiene 24 años de experiencia y conoce bien lo que es el producto fresco, pues sus padres también se dedicaban a este oficio;  hace 3 años. Cuando sus padres fallecieron se dedicó a esa actividad, vendiendo de contado cada década y en horario de 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del área de acción donde se encuentra ubicada y referido por estos. Este negocio le genera ingresos con los que sostiene el bienestar de su familia, porque su meta es que sus hijos se conviertan en unos profesionales para que aumenten su calidad de vida.  Zueleima está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mojarra, bocachico, chivo y otros pescados que presentan una importante demanda en el mercado y ella quiere satisfacer a su clientela.
