Con su credikiva logrará invertir mucho más dinero  y obtener  nuevas  utilidades, lo que hace exitoso el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Zuleima is 43 years old, and is the mother of six children who are between the ages of 5 and 20.  She sells saltwater fish: mojarras, red tilapia, chico, lisa, etc.  She has 24 years of experience, and knows well how to tell if the product is fresh.  Her parents also worked in this field.  Three years ago when her parents passed, she decided to go into this field, selling everyday from 8am to 2pm.  Her primary clients are her neighbors and people that are referred by them.  This business generates an income with which she is able to support her family's wellbeing.  Her goal is for her children to become professionals so that they can improve the quality of their lives.  

Zuleima is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to purchase mojarra, bocachico, chico and other fish that are in high demand in the market, and she wants to satisfy her customers.  With her loan, she will be able to invest a lot more money and generate new earnings.  This is what makes Kiva's support so successful.

loans.use: purchase mojarra, bocachico, chivo and other fish.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Meet Edward, a farmer and a father of two from Nyamira; an area of Kenya, popular for growing banana and commercial tea. Edward has been a farmer for 10 years now. He makes money selling milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables from his farm. He also holds a job and engages in other seasonal businesses to make additional income.

He is very appreciative of the fact that farming business is profitable. His biggest challenge, however, is limited funds. He needs more funds to expand his operations and seize market opportunities around him. Edward owns one cow at the moment named 'Kerore.'

Edward is requesting a loan to construct a cowshed. This will minimize the cows movement looking for pasture, thus channeling more energy to milk production. The cow shed also minimizes the cows exposure to diseases. The additional income Edward will make from introducing a cowshed will go into settling part of the high farming expenses. 
 
Your loan will help Edward’s family to make more income and improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar lives in the village Gandzakar in the Tavush region. Mkhitar has a vocational education and since a very young age, he has been busy with bee keeping and agricultural activities. Now he has great successes in both fields; he has 25 bee families and great land of his own where he cultivates vegetables (potato, greens, and beans) and fruits (apple, plum, and pear), and he also has hayfields from which he has income that is not small. 

Mkhitar also has 50 chickens and he sells not only pure and testy honey, but also a lot of eggs. Mkhitar is the only bread-winner and simultaneously with his work of policeman he works very hard in his farm. He lives with his wife, son, and retired parents. 

He asks for this loan in order to buy frames and wax paper, and the other part of the loan amount he will use to organize spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy frames, wax papers, and pay for spring sowing activities

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Peter. This farmer hails from Nyamira, an area in Kenya popular for growing bananas. For the past 15 years, he has been taking care care of his wife and three children selling milk, eggs, and tea produced in his farm. He also ventures into small seasonal businesses to keep afloat during low seasons.

One activity with no low seasons Peter enjoys is the selling of eggs! He is determined to expand this sector, though his biggest challenge remains the lack of adequate funds. 

Peter is seeking a loan from KIVA through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. People like Peter cannot get formal financing from banks because they are smallholder farmers with irregular income from deep rural areas. But Juhudi Kilimo and KIVA are organizations with a different approach. "They see potential in small farmers that every other organization just can’t see," said Peter.
 
With an additional cow, Peter will generate enough income to repay the loan on time and to meet some of the farming related expenses.  Your loan will help Peter’s family enjoy more income and, in the long run, improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jane, a mother of five, based in Kisii; a rural town in Kenya, popular for it's banana and sugarcane plantations. For the last 10 years, Jane has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, bananas, and other seasonal businesses.

She is appreciative of the fact that agriculture has been a source of income for her for almost a decade and she is never looking back. However, there is a poor road network in Kisii, making it hard for Jane and other farmers to transport their produce to the market. The other challenge Jane goes through is the lack of marketing skills. She is good at farming, but in order to sell, there is a set of skills needed, which she doesn't have.
 
Jane is requesting a loan to construct a dairy unit. From her personal savings, she has enough to purchase a cow and grow various varieties of grass. After attending a training session organized by Juhudi Kilimo, she learned the importance of zero-grazing under dairy farm management. This is why she is seeking financial assistance to construct a cow shed.

The income from the dairy operation will help Jane with the school expenses currently draining her to bits. With your loan, Jane strives to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом 34-летняя продавщица из района Сарбанд Хатлонской области. Она разведена и живет у матери. Гуландом сейчас продвигает семейный бизнес, который существует уже 15 лет. У них в районе имеется магазин продуктовых и хозяйственных товаров, где в данный момент работает Гуландом. Она отзывчивая и доброжелательная женщина, старающаяся обслуживать клиентов на высоком уровне. Сейчас в ее магазине необходимо увеличить ассортимент товара. Гуландом просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США для закупки товара, а именно продуктов питания. Она в основном привозит товар с Кургантюбинского рынка и при выборе товара она отдает предпочтение качеству. Ваша поддержка важна Гуландом для развития бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulandom is a 34-year old vendor from the Sarband district of the Khatlon Region. She is divorced and lives with her mother. At present Gulandom  is growing their family business, which has been in existence for 15 years. Gualdom works in the local grocery and household goods store. She is a thoughtful and kindly person and always tries to provide great customer service. At present she needs to expand the selection of goods in her store. Gulandom is applying for a credit in the amount of 1,000 USD in order to stock up on goods, specifically on grocery products. She mainly brings her goods from the Kurgantybinsk market. When selecting her merchandise, she always prefers quality goods. Your support is important to Gulandom for developing her business.

loans.use: to stock up on grocery products so as to grow her business.

loans.name: Dúo San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señorita Vilma de 38 años de edad quien tiene una estética desde hace 8 años, en la carretera principal de su pueblo.  Tiene varios pedidos de tratamientos para el cabello, como cremas para peinar, champo especial para cabello riso, gotas especiales para el pelo.  También le han hecho varios pedidos de tintes en diferente calidad y precios. El dinero que tiene no le es suficiente para poder comprar lo que le hace falta en la estética, y necesita solicitar un préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes.   Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus padres y le da muchas gracias a Dios por lo que ha logrado,  ya tiene un local donde atiende a las personas pero su mayor  sueño es no tener que pagar alquiler y tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Dúo San Pedro.

Vilma, 38 years old, is in charge of this group.  She has had a cosmetics shop for the past 8 years on the main street of her town.  She has many orders for hair treatments such as styling cream, special shampoo for curly hair, and special drops for hair.  She has also received many orders for hair dyes of varying quality and price.  The money that she has is not enough to purchase what she is missing in her store, and she needs to request a loan so that she does not disappoint her customers.  She has the unconditional support of her parents, and she gives many thanks to God for what she has achieved.  She already has a retail space where she receives customers, but her biggest dream is to no longer have to pay rent, and own her own store.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar lives in Ijevan town with his mother. Edgar studies at a university. His mother is involved in retail business and Edgar himself is a toiler. He works day and night to be able to earn income that is vital for his and his mother's living.
 
The requested loan is important for Edgar to pay for his university tuition and continue his studies there. Edgar and his mother will be very grateful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a  married mother of four children.The family grows tea, does dairy farming, and raises horticulture crops to support their family. With the income they get, they educate their children and pay for electric bills and fuel expenses at home. 

She belongs to Victory Group Kikuyu which is with VEP. She has three dairy cows which give her 35 liters of milk daily. With this, she has a monthly income of about $100.

To reduce her fuel costs at home, Mercy intends to construct a bio-gas plant which will help to reduce electricity bills and the bio-slurry will help with horticulture farming. This will also help her save more and the bio-gas can also be used by her children for lighting as they do late night studying.

To help her achieve this, she has approached VEP to give her a loan and, with the income she gets from tea and horticulture, she will be in a position to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To construct a bio-gas plant

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives in Ijevan town with his mother. His father is a migrant worker who left his family last year with the hope of finding a well paid job and supporting his son and wife financially.
 
Andranik applied for this loan to ask for financial support and pay his university tuition. It is very important for him to receive lenders' support and be able to continue his education at the university.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of goats to raise and sell them, and to make local cheese.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi lives in the village of Vazashen in the Tavush region. She has a specialty in nursing; for several years she worked as a nurse at the school and then at the local polyclinics. Until today, she works at her specialty and at the same time, runs a farming and agriculture business. 

She is married and has two sons; her elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation, and her younger son studies at the Yerevan State University at the paid division of art faculty. 

Taghui takes care of her farm alone, since her husband also does construction work abroad. On her farm, Taghui has 4 cows, 30 chickens and a plot of land, which gives her a harvest of apples, pears and plums. All her farm products’ sales and her salary provide for their living and everyday needs, but Taguhi cannot pay for her son’s education.

She hopes to have this loan to pay her son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is a farmer from Khashtarak village. She lives with her husband and two sons, ages 26 and 30 years old. 

Silva runs a small, but beautiful farm where she keeps a cow, calves, and some chickens. The farm also includes arable land, where Silva cultivates corn and potatoes and grows a large variety of fruit trees. 

Silva has requested this loan of USD 1,100 to purchase a lawnmower needed for her farm. The loan will greatly help her to organize her cultivation work in more effective ways and she will be very grateful to lenders for their support. 

Since this is Silva's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a lawnmower.

loans.name: Dynamic School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Richard. He is the Director at Dynamic Secondary School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo, Wakiso District with 600 students. Dynamic Secondary has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Dynamic Secondary School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Richard ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: White Angels School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is the Head teacher at White Angels Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namasuba, Wakiso District with 1,020 students. White Angels has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

White Angels Primary School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in the village of Akhuryan  with her husband and three children, ages 11, eight and three years. She and her husband rent a small garage where they provide auto repair services. 

The requested loan of USD 1500 will be a big support for this couple in purchasing tools and equipment needed for auto repair. As this is Naira's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

The loan is very important for Naira and her husband to continue their small business, and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment needed for her auto repair service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a cowshed

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Johnstone. He is a father of 4 and a farmer from Litein, Kenya. He has been doing agriculture for 15 years now. He makes money selling produce from his farm which includes milk, eggs, and tea.

He enjoys ploughing his farm to keep the soil aerated. Crop diseases poses a big challenge for many tea farmers in Litein. Johnstone is so close to his animals that he names them 

Johnstone is seeking a loan to construct a dairy unit. He learned how such an establishment can significantly improve his milk production. Construction of the cowshed is the first step he is taking to introduce full zero-grazing model of farming. The increase in income will go towards meeting the high family expenses. The loan will go a long way to helping Johnstone's family to meet its basic needs and live a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cowshed

loans.name: Gulzhahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон замужняя женщина в возрасте 33 года. У ее трое детей, одна дочка и двое сыновей. Гулчахон с семьей живет на районе Гиссар вблизи города Душанбе. Гулчахон 10 лет держит в коровнике скотин. У нее двое скотин. И Гулчахон хочет увеличить количество скотин и серьезным размахом расширить не большой бизнес, принося хороший доход. У Гулчахона не хватает небольшой суммы денег, чтобы приобрести запланированное количество скотин для увеличения поголовья скотов. Поэтому она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Поддержите Гулчахон.
texts.en:
Gulzhahon is a married woman of the age of 33. She has three children; one daughter and two sons. Gulzhahon lives in the Gissar region together with her family, near the city of Dushanbe. 

Gulzhahon has kept cattle in her barn for 10 years. She has two heads of cattle. Gulzhahon would like to increase their number and seriously expand her business to get a good income. Gulzhahon does not have enough money to purchase the planned number of cattle. Therefore she decided to apply for a loan. Please support Gulzhahon.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase the number of livestock and expand her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Grace, a mother of four who farms on a small piece of land in Nyamira, a deep rural town in Kenya. She has four children, whom she sustains through dairy, poultry and crop farming. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years! She also makes ends meet by engaging in various seasonal businesses.  

She finds dairy farming, in particular, enjoyable and profitable. All the animals on the farm have names. The biggest challenge she faces as a farmer is limited funds. 

Grace is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The grade cow will produce enough milk daily to enable Grace to comfortably repay her loan. Any additional income from the cow will go to other farm-related expenses. 

After clearing the loan, Grace plans to spend the income to pay school fees for her four children. Make a difference in Grace’s family by lending her a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats to raise and sell in the local markets

loans.name: Kpangmanga Tampion Group

texts.en:
Maata lives in Ghana and comes from a village called Tampion at the Northern Region of Ghana. She is married and has three children. Maata is an active member of Kpangmanga Tampion Women group. She has been in the business of gathering and processing of shea nuts for the past 3 years. She has been trained by Grameen Ghana to process high premium shea butter to meet European market standards. 

Her 3-year relationship with Grameen Ghana allows her to ask for a loan of 5,700.00 GHS to purchase 50 bags of shea nuts and a roster to increase production in order to meet the demand from her buyers. Maata hopes to grow the business greatly with this capital injection so as to make more profit to repay the loan and also to support the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of shea nuts and a roster to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is engaged in beekeeping. She gets high-quality honey, which she sells in Yerevan town.

Anna herself lives in Kapan, which is located in the Syunik region. Her family consists of her husband and two little children (ages 11 and 5 years old). Beekeeping is the only source of income for this family, so Anna and her husband work hard to gather good honey. 

The requested loan of USD 2,800 will help Anna to purchase supplies needed for renovating the colonies of bees. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her beekeeping is successful and that she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anna has been approved for this loan. 

She has been approved for the loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed for renovating the colonies of bees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high-yielding grafted cacao trees

loans.name: Xiomara Abigahil

texts.es:
Xiomara Abigahil es una joven de 23 años, Sauceña de nacimiento y de corazón, casada, madre de un niño en edad escolar, que le tocó madurar como mujer de hogar a temprana edad por las circunstancias de la vida, pero que hoy se siente muy feliz por tener un hogar estable donde vive en paz al lado de su esposo e hijo.
Uno de sus grandes sueños es terminar su carrera como Farmacéutica para llegar a ganar un mejor salario y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
Actualmente se desempeña como Despachadora de Farmacia en el Hospital de la localidad donde tiene varios años de laborar.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para pagar los aranceles universitarios con el fin de que esto no sea un obstáculo para culminar su carrera profesional.
Por este motivo solicita el apoyo de Kiva como toda Nicaragüense que tiene necesidades en la vida que no puede cubrir con su salario por ser demasiado bajo.
Confía en Dios que su crédito será financiando a través de Ceprodel para poder lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Xiomara Abigahil is a young woman from El Sauce by birth and in her heart. She is married and the mother of a school aged-son. She had to mature as a young woman because of the life circumstances of becoming a mother. She is very happy to have a stable home where she lives with her husband and son.
One of her biggest dreams is to finish her studies in pharmaceuticals to earn better pay and improve her quality of life. 
She currently works as the dispatcher at a hospital pharmacy in the town where she has worked for several years.
She currently has the need to pay university fees so that she does not have an obstacle to finish her studies.
For this reason, she is seeking the support of Kiva like all Nicaraguans who have needs in life that they cannot cover because their income is too low.
She trusts in God that her loan will be financed through CEPRODEL to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима целеустремленная женщина, которая имеет свой бизнес. Она занимается откармливанием скота. Этим бизнесом она уже занимается более 12 лет. Рахима постепенно усовершенствовала свои навыки и имения в сфере бизнеса. Она на сегодняшний день введет свой бизнес успешно. Рахима откармливает коров. Она продает молоко, кефир и сметану местным жителям. Ее соседи и друзья покупают молочные продукты и довольны от этого экологического чистого продукта. Рахима запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 Сомони для покупки коровы для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rahima is a purposeful woman, who has her own business. She works with breeding cattle. She has worked with this business for more than 12 years already. Rahima has gradually improved her business skills and abilities. Currently she manages her business successfully.

Rahima fattens cattle. she sells milk, yoghurt and sour cream to the local residents. Her neighbors and friends purchase dairy products and are satisfied with these ecological products. Rahima requests a loan in the amount of 7,000 somoni to purchase cows to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора жизнерадостная и добрая женщина. Она разведенная женщина. Нигора сама воспитывает 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Нигора более 4 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она предоставляет услугу швеи. Нигора шьёт национальные женские одежды. Она имеет свою мастерскую, где предоставляет услуги своим клиентам. Нигора данное время нуждается новой швейной машинке, так как ее швейная машинка старая. Она запрашивает займ с такой целью на сумму 5000 Сомони. Нигора ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. С полученного дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Nigora is a happy and good woman. She is divorced, and raises three children by herself. Her children are not adults yet. Nigora has had her own business for more than 4 years. She provides a sewing service. Nigora sews women's national dresses. She has a workshop where she provides the service to her customers. 

Nigora currently needs a new sewing machine, as her sewing machine is old. She requests a loan of 5,000 somoni with this aim. Nigora awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity. She has decided to use the income received to increase her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.en: Uguljon is a woman with a heart of gold.  She was born in 1965, and is currently living and working in the north of Tajikistan.  She has one son, Odiljon, who is 25 years old.  She and her husband raise cattle for a living, keeping them in a cow pen at their home and fattening them for later resale.  She wants to add more cattle to her farm and earn more money; to this end, she's requesting a loan of 9,000 somoni to buy cattle, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона заботливая мать 2 детей. Она молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 24 года. Фарзона начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды 3 года назад. Фарзона шьёт национальные и европейские стили одежды. Она постепенно развевает свой бизнес и набирает опыта. Фарзоне как молодой и перспективной бизнес леди хотелось бы увеличить свой оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farzona is a caring mother of 2 children.  She is a young and driven woman.  She is 24 years old.  Farzona started her business of sewing women's clothing 3 years ago.  Farzona sews national and European styles of clothing.  She is gradually developing her business and gaining experience.  As a young and promising business lady, Farzona wants to increase her working capital and grow her business.  With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy fabric.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabric in order to increase her working capital and grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fashion clothes such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peanuts, candy, fish, etc.

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos, los cuales estudian en la escuela del Caserío San Bernardo de Inamiaco, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alindor is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own home made of rustic materials.His children go to school in Caserío San Bernardo  de Inamiaco - a rural zone in the Pucará district which is located in the Jaén province of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Perú. It is a community that works in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

He works in agriculture; specifically in growing catimore coffee. He has applied for a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy various fertilizers to tend to his coffee crops. This way he can maintain enough production to offer his customers and make a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy various fertilizers to tend to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Walter Lenin

texts.es:
Walter Lenin tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace cuatro años, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales (cuyes, patos, gallinas) para ofrecerlo en el mercado de su distrito.
texts.en:
Walter Lenin is 32 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district. The communiety works in agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is located in the Chiclayo province belonging to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. 

For the last four years, he and his wife have worked the business of raising and selling farm animals. They are a close family that works hard in their jobs. He is applying for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy a large quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and hens to sell in the local market.

loans.use: to buy a large quality of animals including guinea pigs, ducks, and hens to offer his customers.

loans.name: Wlliam

texts.en:
William lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. 

Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

William is married and has six children. He is a carpenter while his wife is a farmer. She has been farming for 10 years now, and she is currently growing maize, beans, and oranges on their farm. William is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income.

This is William’s first loan with Honey Care Africa, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. William’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake where many individuals make their living from fishing. A few work in the small, but slowly growing, tourism industry. 

A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Samwel is married and has five children. He runs a motorbike transportation business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for six years now, and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, sunflower, and bananas. Samwel is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Samwel’s first loan with Honey Care Africa, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Samwel’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 44 años de edad, vive en El Caserío Pedregal, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la Agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora, comida en las parcelas tiene un pequeño puesto de comida donde se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para iniciar su negocio de venta de aves de corral ( patos, gallinas y pavos) y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old. She lives in El Caserío Pedregal, a rural zone within the Buenos Aires district. It is a community with a hot climate. The population works in agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú.

She works selling beer, "chicha de jora" [drink made from purple corn], and food. In the fields, she has a small food stall where she has been working for six years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy small animals to start her business of selling farm birds such as ducks, hens, and turkeys. This way she can make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to start her business selling farm birds.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education. As a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

David is married and has seven children. He is a hawker who walks about selling various merchandise. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for seven years now. Currently they are growing maize, sunflowers, and trees on their farm. David is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey. And the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is David’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. David’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped. Inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Daniel is married and has three children. He runs a small kiosk and he also undertakes farming with his wife. They have been farming for 20 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet, sunflower, and oranges. Daniel is excited about beekeeping, as it is an easy project to undertake and it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Daniel’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family’s basic needs and to pay for his children’s school fees. Daniel’s hope for the future is to expand his kiosk business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos que cursan secundaria en Colegio del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, frutales y arroz, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su vehículo, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con una unidad que le ha permitido también realizar el servicio de carga, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas para su unidad que sean adecuadas para la zona donde trabaja y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 41 years old. He lives with his wife, and two children who go to high school in the Pucará district. It is community with a hot climate. The population works in agriculture - specifically in the cultivation of coffee, fruit, and rice. It is located in the Jaén province which belongs to the Cajamarca region on the northern range of Perú.

He provides public transportation service in his vehicle and transports passengers to neighboring zones of his district. He also has a unit that has allowed him to offer cargo service. He has applied for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy wheels that are appropriate for the area where he works. This way he can make a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wheels that are appropriate for the region where he works.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Sagrada Familia es un grupo que viene trabajando hace varios ciclos. El comité tiene 15 mujeres todas con un objetivo en común, ayudar a mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes la señora Nelida, es bastante emprendedora  y muy trabajadora quien lucha día a día con su marido para salir adelante. Su trabajo consiste en atender su casa y trabajar en la cría de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Comenta que esto le ayuda mucho a su familia ya que la producción de los mismos puede venderlos en ferias o en el mercado.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The committee named “Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) is a group that has been working for several loan cycles. This committee consists of 15 women, all of whom have a common goal of helping their families improve their living situations.

One of the members is Sra. Nelida, who is enterprising and hardworking. She and her husband strive each day to get ahead. Her work consists of taking care of her house and raising animals, such as chickens and pigs. She says that her work has been a great help to her family since whatever she produces is sold at the fairs or at the market.

Nelida is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. This will enable her to continue working and striving to improve in the same manner she is currently doing now.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vive con sus padres y hermanos; trabaja en una empresa como repositor de supermercados y estudia por la noche. 
La carrera que está siguiendo es la de análisis de sistemas. Sus metas futuras es la de trabajar de manera independiente  para obtener mejores  ingresos y ayudar a su familia, y de esa forma poder retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por él.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his parents and siblings. He works for a company as a supermarket stocker and studies at night.

The degree he is pursuing is in Systems Analysis. His future goals include working independently so that he can earn more income and help his family. This would enable him to repay them for everything they have done for him.

Julio is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of books. This would enable him to continue striving toward his goal.

loans.use: to buy textbooks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty esta casada tiene una hija y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alguiler Betty es vendedora de articulos varios y necesita credito para abastecerse de mas cosmeticos y frazadas Betty es apoyada por su marido pero lo que ambos ganan no alcanza por eso necesita que la ayuden
texts.en:
Betty is married and has a daughter. She lives in La Paz and resides in a rented house made of brick and cement.

Betty sells various items and needs a loan so that she can restock with more cosmetics and blankets. She is supported by her husband, but the two of them do not earn enough. For this reason, she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and blankets to sell.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
José Luis is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

José is 43 years old, is married and has a 3-years-old daughter. He has had his blacksmith workshop for 20 years now. He has been in this profession since he was 17 years old. He started as a helper and after some years working he decided to become independent and open up his own workshop.

He mainly repairs excavating machines in his workshop, and also has some clients who frequently seek him out to repair refrigerating systems. He asks for this loan to buy tools needed for his repairs.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his machinery repairing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken foot, meat, etc., to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Ena Luz

texts.es: Ena de 40 años habita con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 9 a 18 años. Hace un año emprendió su idea de negocio, después de haber realizado unos cursos  de emprendimiento apoyada por el estado nacional, en su condición de desplazada. En su negocio, ubicado en su propia casa,  vende productos de bisutería, papelería, accesorios  y productos de ferretería, artículos que permanentemente le solicita su clientela. Ena atiende su pequeña miscelanea durante 12 horas diarias, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.  Su meta es generar ingresos crecer como empresaria y aumentar su bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada, productos de ferretería entre otros, para fortalecer su meta de crecimeinto y ganar cada vez mas dinero..
texts.en:
Ena, age 40, lives with her partner and has four children between the ages of 9 and 18.  

Having been laid off, one year ago she undertook an idea for a business after completing some courses on entrepreneurship sponsored by the government.  In her business, which is located in her home, she sells miscellaneous goods, stationery, accessories, and hardware store items—products that her customers are always asking her for.  

Ena works in her small shop twelve hours a day, from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m.  Her goal is to generate income, grow as a business woman, and increase her well being.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has asked for from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this she will buy a variety of merchandise—hardware store products, among others.  This will strengthen her goal of growth and earn her increasingly more money.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as hardware store products, among others.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una señora casada de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos ambos menores de edad, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, comenta que se dedica administrar los ingresos de un mototaxi que tiene, eligió esta actividad porque donde vive no hay muchos mototaxis, es por ello que ahora puede cubrir los gastos de su familia. También comenta que cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el lugar donde vive, estas dos actividades son rentables ya que tienen una fuerte demanda.
Ahora lleva dos años con esta labor, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de otro mototaxi, solo de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes en otros puntos de su comunidad.
Ella sueña con mejorar su economía a través de la labor que realiza, de esta manera podrá asegurar la educación de sus hijos, para que en un futuro ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Micaela is 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her two young children. They currently live in the Sololá department. 

She is an entrepreneurial woman. She says that she manages the profits of her mototaxi [auto rickshaw]. She chose this work because there are few mototaxis where she lives and because of this, she can cover the living expenses of her family. She also says that she has a small grocery store in her home. These two businesses are profitable since they have a strong demand. She has been doing the work for two years and is applying for a loan of Q 10,000.000 to buy another mototaxi. This is the only way that she can increase her income and offer a better service to her customers in other parts of her community. She dreams of improving her finances through her work. This way she can guarantee an education for her children so they can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi [auto rickshaw].

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Eva is 55 years old, is married and has five children: three of them are single and living with her and her husband Nabor, and two are married. She has 5 grandsons.  She enjoys spending time with her family and sharing great moments with her sons.

Her business consists of a stand in her house. There she offers to her clients cleaning products, sweets and frozen products; additionally she visits clients in their house offering these various products.

She has asked for this loan to buy cleaning products: hypochlorite, detergent, insecticide and air freshner.  For Eva her biggest accomplishment has been to keep the business going to date and being able to send her kids to school thanks to her effort. For the near future, her challenge is maintaining her business competitiveness.

loans.use: to supply her business with the cleaning products she sells: hypochlorite, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Viridiana

texts.en:
Victoria is thirty, married and has one son. She describes herself as a responsible, hardworking, kind, respectable and loyal person.

Victoria operates a beauty salon. She attends to her clients in a 5x5-meter space inside her house where she offers beauty treatments and spa services. She loves her job because it means dealing with people and learning new things every day.

Victoria is applying for a 10,000 MXN loan through Kubo Financiero to buy more equipment for her business. In this way she will be able to service more clients and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy equipment necessary to make her workspace more productive

loans.name: Aurelio Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Aurelio Adolfo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, tiene la edad de 59 años, es casado, padre de familia, es un señor bien responsable que a pesar de su pobreza le gusta honrar sus deudas y llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
Labora como Guarda de seguridad para una empresa productora que queda en las afueras del municipio donde a diario tiene que viajar en bicicleta para estar puntual en su centro de labores.
Don Aurelio hace un par de meses tuvo un accidente en su bicicleta yendo para su centro de trabajo donde se fracturó el pie por el cual fue operado e incurrió en una serie de gastos médicos para su recuperación es por este motivo que necesita de la ayuda de los inversionistas de Kiva para que le apoyen a través de Ceprodel con un financiamiento para la compra de medicamentos que tiene que tomar para quedar mejor de salud.
Espera y confía en Dios que le apoyen donde les quedará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en:
Aurelio Adolfo is from the municipality of El Sauce. He is 59 years old, married, and a father. He is very responsible person. Despite his poverty, he likes to honor his debts and bring food to the table each day. 

He works as a security guard for a business that is located in the outskirts of the town, where he has to travel by bicycle each day to be punctual to work.

A couple of months ago, Aurelio had an accident on his bike when he was going to work and he broke his foot. He had an operation and incurred a series of medical expenses for his recuperation. This is why he needs the help of the Kiva lenders, so they can support him through Ceprodel with a loan to buy the medications that he needs to take so he can be in better health.

He hopes and trusts in God that you will support him. He will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a soap retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 3,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of soap to offer for sale.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soap to offer for sale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. 

Antonia is borrowing PHP 4,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Princesita

texts.en:
Princesita works hard to support her family. Princesita is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Princesita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional peanuts, butter, sugar, etc.

Princesita has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanuts, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 58 years old and married, with four children.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling poultry.

Rosalia aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janeth Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La amabilidad que irradia el rostro de 41 años de Janeth, muestra lo orgullosa que se siente de haber tenido la oportunidad de emprender su negocio propio como comerciante de una pulpería desde hace 8 años, sin haber tenido el privilegio de iniciar su secundaria.
La situación económica de Janeth tuvo una crisis hace muchos años, lo que la obligó a buscar una mejor vida en el vecino país, Costa Rica, donde vivió 20 años y donde pudo ahorrar para regresar a Nicaragua, comprar su casa y establecer su negocio en un mercado. Su pulpería es el único ingreso que tiene para proveerle a su hija de 13 años, la educación que ella no tuvo, pues su sueño es verla formada profesionalmente y otorgarle una casa segura. Por esta razón es que Janeth desea el préstamo, para comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar y frijoles, que le permitan aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar su casa, la cual será la segunda herencia, después de la educación, que le dejara a su hija.
texts.en:
The friendliness that lights up the 41-year-old face of Janeth shows the pride that she feels in having had the chance to launch her own business as the shop owner of a small grocery store for the past eight years.  All of this is without having had the privilege of even starting secondary school.

Many years ago, Janeth’s financial situation hit a crisis, which made her look for a better life in the neighboring country of Costa Rica. There she lived for twenty years and managed to save up in order to return to Nicaragua, buy her house, and establish her business in a market.  Her grocery store is the only means of income she has to provide for her daughter, age 13.  With the education that Janeth never had, her dream is to see her daughter trained as a professional and to give her a safe home.  For this reason, Janeth wants a loan to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, and beans.  This allows her to increase her income and thus improve her house.  Her house will be the second legacy, after an education, that she leaves her daughter.

loans.use: to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, charcoal, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Tania Elizabeth

texts.en:
Tania is 23 years old, single and lives with her mother and sister. She owns a local store where she works hard selling backpacks, shoes and beauty supplies. She is applying for a 20,000 MXN loan through Kubo Financiero to buy more backpacks and shoes to sell.

For Tania, her biggest accomplishment has been working and supporting her family. Her goal is to open a shoe store.

loans.use: to buy more backpacks and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 51 years old and has four children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

Marlene is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marlene requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs. Marlene has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 41 years old and all of her children are in school.

Yolanda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy new fishing gear and other equipment.

Yolanda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood to make more products to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Cristina has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Rose Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rose Marie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rose Marie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe works hard to support her family. Phebe is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Phebe has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Phebe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient and cost saving package from Liquefied petroleum Gas

loans.name: Elizabeth Lucia

texts.es: La Señorita Lucia tiene 21 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de contaduría general  en uno de los institutos más reconocidos  de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Lucia trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja de empleada doméstica, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Lucia va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo pagar los seminarios que le faltan  para terminar sus estudios  Superiores y habilitarla para realizar sus trámites  de titulación,  la Señorita Lucia enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Ovejuyo, su deseo es poder titularse lo antes posible para poder trabajar y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 21 years old and single.She lives in the Ovejuyo neighborhood. She is studying in a general Accountant course at one of the most recognized institutes in the city of La Paz. Lucia works as a domestic to pay for her studies.

This is the first loan she has had with the institution. Lucia will use the loan for the various expenses needed in her studies, such as paying for the seminaries she needs to finish her studies and enabling her to fulfill the procedures she needs to graduate.

Lucia has challenges in her studies such as the lack of economic support from her parents and having to work while studying is very hard. But she wants to carry on and finish her studies and be able to exercise her profession. Her wish is to get her degree as soon as she can so she can generate more revenue.

loans.use: to pay for the seminaries she needs to finish her studies and enable her to complete the procedures to graduate.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero y vive junto a su hija de 5 meses en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Tomas comenta que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 5 años, tomo la decisión de optar por esta actividad, porque dispone de su tiempo y además de ello puede trabajar en una constructora. A través de lo que realiza en su trabajo obtiene un ingreso que le sirve para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Ahora él se ha dado cuenta que para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio debe de contar con más herramientas, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de herramientas de construcción, que servirá para ofrecerles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Tomas sueña con tener una constructora para distribuir sus materiales y herramientas a otros puntos de su comunidad, y así incrementar sus ingresos con la finalidad de contribuir al desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 20 year-old man who is single and lives with his 5 month-old daughter in the Department of Suchitepequez.

He comments that he has been working as a bricklayer for 5 years.  He decided on this activity because it allows him sufficient time, and he is also able to work for a construction firm.  Through his work, he obtains an income that allows him to cover the family's expenses.

Now Tomas has realized that in order to offer better service to his customers, he needs more tools.  This is why he is requesting a loan of 8,000 Guatemalan quetzales so that he can purchase more construction tools so that he can provide good service to his customers.  

Tomas dreams of having his own construction company so that he could distribute materials and tools to other locations in his community.  This way, he could increase his income with the goal of contributing to the development of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cost saving fuel from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for modern and efficient cooking fuel from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 61 years old and married.  

Simplicia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Simplicia has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2012.

With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
On November 8, 2013, Jennifer's business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a 5,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house.

With your help, Jennifer will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with four children. She is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Nenita has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing materials.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
On November 8, 2013, Ma. Loida's business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a 5,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house.

With your help, Ma. Loida will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now, she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Marivic is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables for her food vending business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира несколько лет назад потеряла своего мужа. Она одна воспитывает свою дочь. Мунира очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она шьет национальные матрасы на заказ. Мунира имеет своих постоянных клиентов, так как она шьет красиво и аккуратно. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже более 3 лет. Мунира является единственной кормилицей своей семьи. Она упорно работает и старается развевать свой бизнес. Данное время она больна, и ей необходимо купить лекарства для своего лечения. Мунира запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munira lost her husband a few years ago, and she is now raising her daughter alone.  She is a very hardworking woman who sews traditional mattresses from orders she receives from her customers.  She is a skilled and meticulous seamstress and has some regular customers.  She has been in this business for more than three years.  She is now the only breadwinner for the family.  She works hard and always tries to develop her business.  However, Munira is currently sick and she needs to buy the medicines necessary for her treatment.  She is taking a loan of 600 somoni to buy medicines.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy the medicines she needs for her treatment.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
Guadalupe de 48 es un hombre muy trabajador, pues siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Él junto a sus hijos siembra granos básicos tales como maíz, frijol y maicillo. Y su esposa le apoya en las actividades del hogar. Don Guadalupe quiere sembrar maíz y frijol para satisfacer la necesidad diaria de su familia. Algunos de sus hijos e hijas trabajan fuera de casa para apoyarle económicamente.


Don Guadalupe se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad pues él apoyaba a su padre quien fue su tutor por mucho tiempo, junto a él aprendió técnicas para hacer más fácil las actividades y lograr que sus cultivos fueran productivos en la cosecha.


El dinero del crédito será invertido en la compra de insumos utilizados en producción agrícola, tales como los fertilizantes, foliares e insecticidas. Don Guadalupe necesita apoyo para que pueda comprar los insumos, ya que son necesarios para cultivar los granos básicos, pues de ahí su familia obtiene su alimentación.


En un futuro Don Guadalupe espera también sembrar otra variedad de cultivos, para ofrecerles a sus hijos una alimentación variada, y así poder ayudarles también en los gastos de sus estudios. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan salir adelante mediante el estudio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, who is 48 years old, is a very hard-working man, since he has always worked in agriculture. Together with his children, he plants basic foods such as corn, beans, and sorghum, and his wife supports him in the household activities. Don Guadalupe always wants to plant corn and beans to satisfy the daily needs of his family. Some of his sons and daughters work outside of the home in order to support him economically.

Don Guadalupe has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, since he helped his father, who was his teacher for a long time. Alongside him, he learned techniques to make his tasks easier and achieve productive crops at harvest time.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies used in agricultural production, such as fertilizers, foliar sprays, and insecticides. Don Guadalupe needs support so that he can buy the supplies, since they are necessary to grow the basic crops from which his family obtains their food.

In the future, Don Guadalupe hopes to also plant another variety of crops, in order to offer his children a varied diet and thus also be able to help them with their school expenses. His greatest dream is that his children can advance through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, foliar sprays, and insecticides

loans.name: Lolazhon

texts.ru: Лолажону 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Лолажон является основной кормилицей семьи. Она занимается скотоводством уже более 6 лет. Лолажон откармливает крупно - рогатого скота. Она имеет большой коровник у себя дома. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Лолажон продает коров на местном рынке и имеет постоянных клиентов благодаря хорошему состоянию коров. Она хочет дальше развевать свой бизнес. Лолажон запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lolazhon is 44 years old, married, and raising three children who are still minors.  She has been involved in animal husbandry (cattle fattening) for more than six years and is the family's main breadwinner.  She owns a large barn on her property and her husband helps her to run the business.

Lolazhon sells cows at the local market.  Thanks to the quality of her cattle, she has regular customers.  She would like to further develop her business and has therefore requested a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy some cattle.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelo es casado, vive con su señora en la ciudad de Asunción, trabaja como vendedor de motos en una conocida empresa.
Lo que aspira a futuro es terminar su carrera con honores y así poder ejercer su profesión que tanto le gusta, que es la de Administración de Empresas.
Aparte de estudiar es bombero voluntario, que ya actualmente le es complicado cumplir por falta de tiempo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelo is married and lives with his wife in the city of Asunción. He works as a motorcycle salesman for a recognized company.

Marcelo aspires to finish his degree with honors and make use of the field of study that he enjoys, which is Business Administration. In addition to pursuing his studies, Marcelo is a volunteer firefighter but he is currently having difficulty with fulfilling that commitment because he lacks the time.

Marcelo is requesting this loan so that he can pay his university fees. This will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Habibajon

texts.ru: Хабибачон разведенная женщина в возрасте 63 лет. Она живет с двумя сыновьями и невесткой в городе Куляб. Один сын работает на стройке в городе Душанбе, а второй сейчас находится в России на заработках. Хабибачон в течение 20 лет занимается швейным делом. Она шьет женские платья национального покроя. Это ремесло ей передано от матери. Сейчас Хабибачон принимает заказы на шитье вместе с невесткой. Чтобы продвинуть и расширить деятельность Хабибачон просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается закупить необходимые ткани для шитья. Этот кредит им очень важен.
texts.en: Habibajon is 63 years old and divorced.  She lives with her two sons and a daughter-in-law in the town of Kulob.  However, one of her sons is currently working on a construction site in the city of Dushanbe and the second has left for Russia to find some work.  Habibajon has been working as a seamstress for the past 20 years, making traditional Tajik dresses.  She learned her craft from her mother.  She and her daughter-in-law are now working from orders they receive from their customers.  In order to develop and expand her activity, Habibajon is asking for a loan.  She will use her loan to buy the fabrics she needs for sewing.  This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Paula Aidalina

texts.es:
Nagarote, municipio de León, vio partir a Paula, una mujer de 47 años, casada y con tres hijos independientes, quién dejó su lugar natal para buscar una mejor oportunidad laboral en la capital. Al llegar a Managua, usó sin dudar, los ahorros obtenidos como vendedora ambulante de cuajadas, queso y leche de su pueblo, para establecer su pulpería, la cual ya lleva 10 años de existir.  
Paula solo tuvo la oportunidad de llegar al segundo grado de la primaria, sin embargo, eso no ha obstaculizado su espíritu emprendedor y con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 15 años, han logrado salir adelante.  Siempre su pueblo natal está presente, por lo que sueña con regresar, poner su pulpería allá, más una venta de comida. Para ello, necesita del préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprar arroz, jabón, papel higiénico u otros productos para variar su mercaderia, de manera que pueda incrementar sus ingresos y terminar con los préstamos para invertir en su casa.
texts.en:
Nagarote, a municipality of León, saw Paula, a married woman of 47 with three independent children, depart. She left her place of birth to look for a better working opportunity in the capital. On arriving in Managua, she used without hesitation the savings obtained as an itinerant vendor of curdled cheese, cheese, and milk in her town in order to establish her grocery store, which has already been in existence for 10 years.

Paula only had the opportunity to reach the second grade of primary school. Nevertheless, this has not hindered her entrepreneurial spirit, and with the help of her husband, who has worked as a security guard for 15 years, they have managed to advance. Her home town is always present, because she dreams of going back to set up her grocery store there, in addition to selling food. To do that, she needs the loan to invest in her business, to buy rice, soap, toilet paper, and other products to vary her merchandise, in such a way that she can increase her income and finish with the loans in order to invest in her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, toilet paper, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 40 лет.  Она замужем, мать троих прекрасных детей.Муж Зулайхо находится на заработках но средств , которые он посылает семье недостаточны для питания, учебы детей и одежды. Поэтому Зулайхо помогает мужу она шьет дома национальные женские платья и тем самым приносит своей семье дополнительный доход. Кроме этого как и во всех сельских семьях в ее семье тоже выращивают скот.Это приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Зулайхо хочет приобрести еще одного теленка. Она надеется, что получив кредит  она сможет дать необходимое для развития и образования детей. Зулайхо обратилась в "Арванд" за кредитом. На сумму которую она запрашивает приобретет молодого теленка. При поддержки Кива этот заем не будет в тягость ее большой семье.
texts.en: Zulaiho is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three beautiful children.  Her husband is currently working abroad, but the money he sends to his family is not enough to buy food, clothes, and to pay for the children's school fees.  This is the reason why Zulaiho is helping her husband: she sews traditional dresses for women from home, an activity which represents an additional source of income for her family.  Like other families who live in the countryside, Zulaiho and her family also own some cattle, which is yet another source of income.  Zulaiho would now like to buy an extra calf.  She is hoping that, thanks to this loan, she'll be in a better position to raise and educate her children.  She has turned to MDO Arvand for this loan and will use her money to buy a young calf.  Thanks to Kiva's support, this loan will ease her family's hardship.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr: Monsieur Bakary est un promoteur qui évolue dans la commercialisation des noix de cola. Agé de 52 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Son enfant  le plus grand est âgé de 14 ans et le plus petit a 2ans. Il a une expérience de plus de 23 ans  et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des sacs de noix de cola qu’il vend dans le marché de la commune. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de  ses enfants. Il veut augmenter son stock de marchandises et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et leur construire une maison.
texts.en: Bakary is an entrepreneur who sells kola nuts.  He is 52 years old, married, and a father.  His oldest child is 14, the youngest is 2.  Bakary has been in this business for more than 23 years.  He is taking this loan to buy bags of kola nuts for resale at the local market.  He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses and of the children's tuition fees.  He wants to increase his stock of merchandise and his income in order to improve his family's living conditions and build a house for them.

loans.use: to buy bags of kola nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
