texts.es: la cliente de 27 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo en casa propia. la cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y poder seguir con sus siembras ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client is 27 years old. She and her husband live together in their own home. She has been a farmer for many years. She plants beans and corn, and from the sales of her harvests she is able to cover her household expenses. She is a responsible, honest and hard-working woman.

She is requesting a loan in order to improve her land (shown in the photograph) by purchasing supplies for her crops, such as: fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc. She is a requesting a loan because her earnings aren't enough to cover these expenses. She also hopes to be able to continue sewing her crops, and in this way make more money and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, composts, seeds and herbicides for her land.

loans.name: Blanca Lorena

texts.es: Blanca de 36 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, desde hace 10 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar ,ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos,  Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 years old. Her business is the sale of underwear for women and men. She has been in this business for the past ten years. She has many well-established customers, through whom she is able to maintain her business. The earnings she obtains from her sales cover some of her household expenses. She lives with her life partner and their children.

Blanca requests a loan which will help her purchase underwear in bulk. There is a great demand coming from many people for these items. If Blanca can get items at different price points and in different styles and colors, she will be able to attract more clients and thereby improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Djibrilou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Djibrilou  est un homme qui habite dans les environs du guichet. Il marié et père de famille, son enfant le plus grand est âgé de 15 ans et le plus petit vient d’avoir 3 mois. Il a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter du ciment et des fers pour construire sa maison qui est en stade de coulage. Etant commerçant de profession, il a une expérience de 18ans et commence sa journée à  8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il gère bien son commerce d’alimentation générale et les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir après la finition de son bâtiment, il souhaite ouvrir une autre boutique d’alimentation générale afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Djibrilou lives close to a local branch of the UIMCEC.  He is married and he has a family.  His oldest child is 15, his youngest is just three months old.  Djibrilou needs this loan to buy cement and iron rods to finish building his house which is still in the "casting" stage.

Djibrilou is a professional retailer.  He has been in this business for 18 years and works from 8AM until 6PM.  He has his own grocery shop and manages it very well.  He also takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses and of his children's school fees.  In the future, and once his house is finished, he would like to open another grocery shop in order to increase his income and diversify his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron rods to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling uno products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of uno products to sell.

Lucila has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business direct selling uno products for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Lucila aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of uno products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 23 years old and single.

Arlene's business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlene has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide herself with a safe shelter.

Arlene has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlene is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Liciria

texts.es: Licira una mujer de 54 años de edad que sufrió las consecuencia del desplazamiento forzoso, hace 8 meses llego a la ciudad de Medellín, pero como siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer guerrera, una luchadora de la vida logro montar un puesto de comidas rápidas con el que ha logrado superar su difícil condición como desplaza y llevar la comida de cada día a su hogar, hace poco se le presento una oportunidad de adquirir un negocio en el cual se distribuye bebidas y dulces para los estudiantes y licor en las noches para los vecinos y cualquier persona que se acerque a comprar, tiene en el momento los dos locales funcionando y su gran ventaja es que quedan en la vía principal en la que hay mayor tránsito de personas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas alcohólicas como cerveza y aguardiente para atender a los clientes de mayor edad y no centrar tanto su establecimiento en menores de edad su principal sueño es tener de nuevo su casa propia y olvidar todo lo vivido años atrás donde abandono todo por el conflicto armado
texts.en:
Licira, 54, suffered the situation of enforced displacement, arriving eight months ago to the city of Medellin.  However, she characterizes herself as a fighter in life and with a great effort she was able to set up a fast-food establishment.  Thanks to this, she was able to overcome the difficult situation she was in and found a way to take feed her household.  

A short while ago, she had the opportunity to buy a business which sells drinks and sweets to students during the day and liquor at night to the locals or anybody else who comes to buy.  At the moment she has two places up and running and she has the advantage of being located on the principal avenue where there are a lot of people passing. 

 She is asking for a loan to buy alcoholic drinks such as beer and spirits to cater for her older customers, rather than only being able to offer things to the younger people. 

 Her main aim is to have a new house and forget what happened to her in the past when she had to give up everything because of an armed conflict.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic drinks such as beer and spirits to attract locals to her establishment.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlene has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Arlene has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlene is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rafael Ángel

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre muy emprendedor e ingenioso, pues gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a los negocios y venta de diferentes productos.
Hoy en día tiene un tienda de abarrotes muy conocida y acreditada en el sector donde vive en la cual vende productos básicos de la canasta familiar además de verduras y productos de aseo, trabaja desde las 7:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm.
Él le da mucha importancia al valor que tiene la variedad y el buen servicio y es precisamente eso lo que ha hecho que su negocio marche sobre ruedas.
En estos momentos el solicita un crédito para surtir la parte de los cárnicos en su negocio ya que considera que es un producto de mucho consumo y el no alcanza a cubrir la demanda de carne.
Al aumentar el surtido de carne podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas de una manera considerable.
Es un hombre sencillo y carismático, siempre dispuesto a hacer hasta lo imposible por su esposa y sus hijos.
Sueña con tener un gran supermercado con autoservicio.
texts.en:
Rafael is an enterprising and ingenious man who has dedicated a large part of his life to buying and selling different products.

At the moment, he has a general store which is well-known and liked in the area where he lives.  He sells basic products for the family shopping basket such as vegetables and toiletries.  He works from 7.00 am until 10.00 pm.

He thinks that variety and good service are key elements and these are precisely what has made his business successful.  At this moment he is asking for a loan to stock his store with meat products as it is a product that people want and at the moment he can’t satisfy the demand.  By investing in the amount of meat on offer he can increase his sales considerably.

This charismatic man leads a simple life; always willing to do whatever it takes for his wife and children.  He dreams of having a large supermarket with self-service.

loans.use: to stock up on meat products in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for modern and thermally efficient cooking gas from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de sacrificios y buena voluntad ya que para poder sostenerse a sí mismo y a su familia, esta joven mujer ha tenido que abandonar sus estudios universitarios para trabajar.
Actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación y comercialización de obleas, alimentos muy populares en esta región.
Inicio su negocio hace 3 años aproximadamente, pero no fue un comienzo fácil, puesto que no contaba con el capital para trabajar y fue su padre quien le dio la mano y la impulso al mundo empresarial.
En estos momentos genera empleo a un joven y vende su producto  en las diferentes plazas de mercado de la ciudad.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una cortadora y algunos insumos para sus preparaciones.
Con esta maquina podrá agilizar su proceso de producción y cumplir con todos los pedidos que actualmente tiene. 
Esto impactara positivamente sus ventas y le permitirá tener mejor rentabilidad en su negocio, brindándole un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
Sueña con tener un gran negocio en el cual pueda vender distintos tipos de alimentos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a woman who has shown a lot of sacrifice and goodwill because in order to support herself and her family financially, this young woman had to give up her university studies to work.

At the moment she has a small business making and selling wafers; a very popular food in this region.

She started in this line of work about three years ago, but it wasn’t easy to begin with.  She did not have any money to start with and her father had to give her a hand and encourage her to enter the world of business.

At the moment she has a young worker in her employment and she sells her product in different markets in the city.

She needs a loan to buy a cutting machine and some supplies for the preparation of her product.  With this machine, she will be able to quicken up the production process and satisfy the customer demand that she now has.

This will have a positive impact on her sales, making her business more profitable and giving her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine and some supplies for her food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, bags and pots, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 59 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 11 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jiann

texts.en:
Jiann is 26 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future Jiann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 53 years old and widowed with three children.

Angeles and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Angeles is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Angeles has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Angeles can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell for her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. Lolita earns more income from buying and selling dry goods.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Leny Lilibeth

texts.en:
Leny Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen products to sell. Leny Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen products to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jennifer's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Jennifer is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jennifer has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Joecel

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Joecel works hard to support her family.

She earns a living with a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Joecel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Joecel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for thermally efficient energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a thermally efficient cooking gas package of Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Don Oscar de 56 años de edad, es un hombre luchador, ha dedicado su vida a la agricultura. Él junto a sus hijos cultiva  entre 14,000 y 21,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, en las que siembran maíz, frijol y maicillo. Junto a su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos salen a trabajar al pueblo, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 


Don Oscar se dedica a cultivar desde los 12 años de edad, pues él apoyaba a su padre en las labores diarias. Anteriormente, cultivaba hortalizas para el consumo del hogar y para comercializar, pero por falta de agua dejo de hacer esta actividad, hoy solo se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol.


El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de todos los insumos que se utilizan en la producción agrícola, como pago de mano de obra, arado de la tierra, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, los cuales son esenciales. Don Oscar los quiere comprar antes que inicie la época lluviosa y la época de siembra, ya que para entonces los precios son elevados. Por el momento Don Oscar no cuenta con el capital para invertir, por lo que necesita apoyo.

En un futuro Don Oscar desea poder cultivar nuevamente hortalizas, para obtener una fuente de ingresos más frecuente, ya que los granos básicos, son de un plazo mayor. Así también espera reparar y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar, 56, is a hard-working man who has dedicated all his life to agriculture.  Together with his children, he looks after between 14,000 and 21,000 square metres of land.  He sows corn, frijoles and sorghum.  His wife sells tamales and bread.  Their children are now grown up and two of them work in the town to help contribute to the household expenses.

Oscar has been growing crops since he was 12.  He started helping his father with his daily chores.  In the past, he grew vegetables for eating at home and selling, but the lack of water meant that he had to give this up and now he dedicates his time solely to growing corn and frijoles.

He will use the loan to invest in all the necessary agricultural resources such as labor costs, ploughing of the land, compost, pesticides and herbicides; all of which are essential.  Oscar wants to acquire all of these before the rainy season and the time for sowing because once this comes around, the prices go up.  At the moment he hasn’t got enough money to buy these things, so he needs help.

In the future, he would like to grow vegetables again so he as a more frequent source of income.  Grains take longer to grow.  He would also like to make repairs and improve his home.

loans.use: to pay for labor, ploughing of the land, compost, pesticides and herbicides; all to grow corn and frijoles beans.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gina has a business selling crabs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell.

Gina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 36 years old and married with two children.

Merlinda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Merlinda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Merlinda has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Merlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mary requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment for maintenance. She has been in this business for one year now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment for maintenance.

loans.name: Ermy

texts.en:
Ermy is 39 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ermy requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ermy has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ermy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Lolita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan ,which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Lolita is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Lolita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra  vive  con sus padres, ella es estudiante de medicina, y comenta que siempre fue su sueño poder ayudar a las personas, es por eso que está estudiando esta carrera.
Sus metas futuras es recibirse como profesional, trabajar en lo que es su profesión, y seguir estudiando y capacitarse para  seguir ayudando a sus padres y también a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad y también poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives with her parents and is a medical student. She says that she always dreamed of being able to help people, so this is why she is studying for this degree.

Her future goals include becoming a professional and working in her field of study. She also wants to continue her education and training so that she can keep helping her parents, as well as other people.

Alejandra is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her university fees and cover her living expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to pay her university fees and living expenses.

loans.name: Carmen Elvira

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer ya muy veterana de 52 años de edad madre de dos hijos que actualmente mantiene con un negocio en su hogar la cual es la venta de pequeños electrodomésticos, los cuales empezó a vender hace poco ante la urgencia de apoyar económicamente a sus dos hijos para que estos se conviertan en unos universitarios y puedan retribuir todos los esfuerzos hechos por Carmen, requiere un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y así exhibir sus productos a fuera de casa, lo que le generaría más clientela dado que muchos de sus clientes no se enteran de la totalidad de productos que vende ya que su negocio radica dentro de la casa e inicialmente sus clientes son amigos y familiares que la apoyan en esta bonita labor con sus hijos dándoles una mejor calidad de vida y asegurándose de llevar el pan de cada día a su familia
texts.en:
At the age of 52, Carmen is a very experienced mother of two children. She currently manages a business from her home where she sells small household appliances. Carmen started selling these goods out of urgency. She was financially supporting her two children who were about to enroll in the university so that they would be able to repay her for all of her efforts.

Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can buy a display cabinet for exhibiting her products from the outside of her house. This will generate more customers since many people are not aware of all the products that she sells from her house. At the beginning, her customers were friends and relatives who supported her in this line of work so that she could give her children a better quality of life and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet for exhibiting her products.

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Las Hermanas son de la ciudad de Lambaré, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y así ayudar también a sus familias.
Ana es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios yuyos, ya sea para mate, como también para terere. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada y luchadora, que por medio de su humilde trabajo ha dado y viene dando a su familia todo lo que ellos han necesitado.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios yuyos para poder seguir con la venta de los mismos, y de esa forma luchar por su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
“Las Hermanas” (The Sisters) is a group that is from the city of Lambaré. These women are self-sacrificing and have joined together with the goal of helping one another, as well as their families.

Ana is a member of this group who sells herbal remedies for making “mate” and “terere” (both are traditional herbal beverages). She is a dedicated and determined woman. Through her humble work, she has been able to provide her family with everything they need.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of herbal remedies so that she can continue her sales. This will enable her to strive on behalf of her family in the same manner as before.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres esta casado, no tiene hijos, vive en La Paz. En una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece. Andres sobrevive como chofer y su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio. Andres esta sacando un prestamo para la tienda que es administrada por la esposa con el dinero comprará aceite, gaseosas y abarrotes para ampliar la oferta Andres estara complacido de que le vuelvan a ayudar
texts.en:
Andres is married and has no children. He lives in La Paz and resides in a brick and cement house that belongs to him. Andres earns his living as a chauffeur and his wife has a neighborhood store. He is taking out a loan for the store that his wife manages. The money will be used to buy oil, sodas, and groceries in order to expand the inventory of the store.

Andres is pleased to have this assistance.

loans.use: to buy oil, sodas, and groceries.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es:
Sergia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera, ella estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es empleada  y también se dedica a ser docente de Horas Cátedras, y está cursando el quinto año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá cumplir su meta de ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y la sociedad.
texts.en:
Sergia is single and from the city of Curuguaty. She is studying and working at the same time. Sergia is employed and also devotes her time as a lecturer. She is studying in her fifth year toward a Bachelor of Science degree in Education.

Sergia is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her fees, which will enable her to achieve her goal of becoming a professional who is useful to other people and to society.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Dora Roxana

texts.es: Dora tiene 37 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 11 años de edad. Dora trabaja como cocinera en un comedor cercano a su localidad y es así como con mucho esfuerzo se  gana el pan de casa día y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Dora solicita este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para la hija para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillo, y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este apoyo para dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Dora is 37 years old and resides in her own home along with her 11-year-old daughter. She works as a cook at a diner near her town. With great effort, Dora is able to provide for the daily needs of her family and sustain her household.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a bedroom for her daughter. Dora needs materials such as cement, sand, iron, brick, and galvanized sheets. She hopes to receive this assistance so that she can begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a bedroom of her daughter.

loans.name: Mauring

texts.en:
Mauring is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle for her transport business.

Mauring has been in this business for five years. Mauring earns additional income from a business buying and selling charcoal.

Mauring has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Mira works very hard to provide for her family.

Mira's business and family home was destroyed by the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Mira has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mira has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mira is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa works in agriculture. She farms poultry and cattle.

Hoa is 41 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Nong Cong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter system.

In the future, Hoa hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter system.

loans.name: Kusimuka Kwemadzimai Group

texts.en:
Meet Memory. She is the beautiful lady in the centre with spectacles and a black scarf. She is a married mother of two who has been rearing poultry for the past 2 years. She is 42 years old and belongs to Kusimuka Kwemadzimai group (translated as women’s progress group). The group is based on church and neighbourhood ties and it has a rotating savings club, something that they have learnt from the Thrive training programme.   
Memory’s poultry business has been growing and a loan to her and her group will help her extend her fowl run to a bigger capacity and enable her to meet her growing demand. Memory and her group hope to grow their small businesses and earn more income to support their families since most of their husbands are not employed. These women represent an example to the community of how little can be much if it is combined with hard work and commitment.

loans.use: To extend her fowl run and rear more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Jehovah Jire Group

texts.en:
Portia is the chairlady of a group called Jehova Jireh. She is a 55 year old widow who rears broilers (chickens) at her home in Highfields, Harare. She has led this group through two loan cycles with Thrive and now the group seeks another loan.
Portia has benefited from the Thrive loans in many ways. She has managed to send her three children to school and is in the process of extending her house. As her children are growing, her small house can no longer accommodate her family. She has managed to procure building material such as bricks, cement, door and window frames. She needs more of these materials in order to finish building her house.
With a Kiva loan, Portia will be able to stagger her broilers in such a way that she will be selling 200 mature birds every three weeks, which will be a great boost in her business since at the moment she sells 200 birds every six weeks. The additional income will enable her to finish extending her house and give her children a better life.

loans.use: To increase the number of chickens that she raises and sells.

loans.name: Tiyamika Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 37 year old mother of 3. She is married to a self-employed motor mechanic. Dissatisfied by her role as housewife, Ruth attended school of dressmaking, cutting and designing in 2009. In 2010, she started her sewing business operating from a room she was offered at her parents’ house.
Ruth owns a domestic electrical sewing machine. She specialises in sewing seat covers and bed covers. Her main customers are cross border traders but she cannot meet all their needs due to working capital constraints.  She also loses a lot of time making frequent trips to go and buy materials as she cannot buy in bulk.
Realising the need for training and cultivating a savings culture, Ruth formed Tiyamika group together with her friends from church. This group is kept together by common religious faith and desire for financial stability as women.
With a loan from Thrive, Ruth intends to buy materials in bulk and enjoy discounts thereby increasing her profit margin. She hopes to grow her business by opening a shop in town and employ  assistants to enable her to meet her customers’ orders. She dreams of finishing building her house with the increased profits.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Divine Servers Group

texts.en:
Angela is a 36 year old woman who lives in Glenview, Harare in Zimbabwe. She is a tailor who sews bedding and other interior décor products. She sells these products locally. She has been doing this business for eleven years.
Angela has been experiencing financial difficulties due to the current unstable economic environment. As a result, she has been unable to meet demand from her customers, reducing her revenue and in turn, her profitability.
Angela’s husband passed away and she has been finding it difficult to take care of their three children as she is now their sole provider. With a Kiva loan, Angela will be able to supply her orders and improve her profitability. This will enable her to pay fees for her first born son who is in medical school as well as her two other children who are still in high school.
Angela and her friend, Margret live in the same area and attend the same church. They are both involved in youth enrichment projects run by the Anglican Church. They need a loan of USD800 in order to grow their businesses and better provide for their families.

loans.use: To buy stock for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Abbah Group

texts.en:
Claria, 56, is the chairperson of the Abbah group, which came into existence after she had encouraged her friends to form  a ROSCA. They then started attending business trainings offered at Thrive and this has since helped the group to manage their working capital through keeping financial records.
Claria is a married, hardworking and self motivated woman who started selling fruits and vegetables 13 years ago, before venturing into groceries about 4 years ago. At the moment, she is taking care of 2 children and her profits are complementing her husband`s income to pay for their bills and food for the family. Claria wishes to make a tuckshop structure which can hold her groceries as she can then be able to increase restocking levels. With a Kiva loan Claria can achieve her objectives and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tashaina Group

texts.en:
Liliosa is a 31 year old widow who stays in Glen View 1, Harare. Her husband died in 2010 and she has since assumed all the responsibilities, i.e paying school fees for her child, paying water bills as well as electricity bill and taking care of the mother. 
She is a cross border trader, selling adult clothing, shoes as well as baby wear and through her hard work she managed to open two flea markets tables in Avondale and the Central Business District, Harare.
Liliosa is a member of the Tashaina group. The group consists of ambitious and hardworking ladies who strive for their families. They continually attend business training offered at Thrive which has helped them to keep their businesses running despite hardships in the economy.
With the Kiva loan, Liliosa can help bring sustainability to her business and look after her mother and son.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and baby wear for resale.

loans.name: Vagoni Vebasa Group

texts.en:
Naume, aged 50, stays in Houghton Park, Harare. She has been in the business of rearing chickens for over 15 years. She has a secure fowl run at her place which can take up to 400 hundred birds. Naume has managed to develop her business over the past 15 years by building a secure fowl run which can protect birds from harsh weather conditions. Business has grown from only keeping broiler chickens to both broilers and layers.
Naume is a married homeowner who has managed to send her children to school and develop her house from the proceeds from selling the chickens. She has 2 school going dependants and her husband does fitting and turning. Naume and her group have benefited from the trainings offered at Thrive as they have developed new good ways of managing their businesses. Naume approached other members to conduct ROSCAs and this idea has help support the up keeping of other members families.  
With the Kiva loan can help her expand her fowl run and continue encouraging and giving other women in her community and church  to work hard and develop their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her fowl run and rear more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Rumuko Group

texts.en:
Chishamiso, aged 34, took her first loan with Thrive in June 2013 and after having sold second hand clothes for three months, she managed to get a passport and started procuring new clothes from South Africa and Botswana for resale. From the proceeds, she has managed to look after her husband who got sick in the last quarter of 2013 and paid fees for her three children, without forgetting to repay back the loan. Unfortunately, her husband then died in January 2014 and she has since inherited his business of sculpting tomb stones. 
Chishamiso`s sculpting business is located in Glen Norah, Harare, just a few meters from where she stays. She and a group of other women are the Rumuko group and they continually attend business training offered at Thrive which has helped them to keep their businesses running despite liquidity challenges faced. Chishamiso wants her proceeds to meet the fees for her child`s O level examinations and maintain a decent life for the family. A loan with Kiva can help Chishamiso resume cross border trading without foregoing the tomb stone business.

loans.use: Stone carving and cross border trading

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.en:
Caroline is a hardworking cross border trader based in Harare. She is the lady at the extreme right of picture. She has been in this business for the past 5 years and has managed to secure a residential stand on which she is already building a house.

She is a member of Adonai group and together they want to borrow $1950 through Thrive Microfinance. Caroline will use her portion of the loan to finance procurement of new stock that she will sell in the seasonal tobacco markets that she has access to in Harare.

She has previously accessed a loan from Thrive through which she has been developing her business in the past year; she and her group represent the ideal outcome for Thrive in terms of training uptake and retention. They have a serious savings club that they run and their group governance is very good.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Free Evangelicals Group

texts.en:
Luwiza is a 38 year old woman married to a self-employed Brick Layer. She has three dependent children.
Luwiza is into cross border trading business which she started in July 2013 after the husband was struggling to pay school fees for their children. She specialises in buying and selling clothes and blankets. Her main customers are farmers .She operates from a flea market at the Tobacco Auction Floors and from own house during the tobacco off season. She is still in the middle of building her house in the Kambuzuma high density suburbs of Harare
Luwiza says she benefited very much from the training offered by Thrive especially in the area of budgeting and saving. She and her group members go to the same church and stay in the same neighbourhood - these are aspects which have bound them together.
With the loan from Thrive, Luwiza hopes to increase her product range and generate more profits to enable her to continue paying her childrens' school fees and finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy clothes and household products for resale

loans.name: Border Life Group

texts.en:
Kudzai is a member of the Border Life Group. She is 32 years old and in the cross-border business, as are all her other group members. She travels every month to South Africa to procure footwear, clothing and bedding material. She has been doing this for seven years now.
Business has been moving well for the past six years but things have not turned out as anticipated in 2014. She had her goods stolen at the border on her last trip and her business has suffered since. Her debtors also haven’t helped her case since they are paying late or not at all.
A loan of $1500 from Kiva would help Kudzai and her friends in Border Life Group to reinforce their businesses. This would increase their profits and enable these women to provide for their families and achieve their objectives in life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and footwear fro resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy new and used clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Jackeline Janet

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de dos años en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 39 years old, lives in the district of Cayaltí, in a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Perú.

For more than two years, she has worked breeding and selling pigs at the back of her house. She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy balanced feed for animal growth. This will allow her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for pig fattening.

loans.name: Martha Nury

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer independiente y trabajadora, desde siempre ha trabajado para ganar sus propios ingresos.
Ella vive junto a su esposo y uno de sus tres hijos y entre los tres se ayudan para aportar en el hogar.
Ella ha tenido varios negocios, el último fue un SPA, que se vio obligada a cerrar por competencia desleal.
Actualmente inicio con un pequeño negocio de venta de perfumes de diferentes gamas para dama y caballero, lleva aproximadamente 5 meses con esta actividad y hasta ahora los resultados han sido alentadores.
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder comprar más surtido de perfumes de gama alta para satisfacer a sus clientes, que aunque son pocos, son constantes y esto hace que Martha se anime a progresar cada vez más. 
Su sueño es poder tener un gran almacén de perfumes de todo tipo en el cual pueda tener ingresos estables.
texts.en:
Martha is an independent and hardworking woman. She has always worked to generate her own income. She lives with her husband and one of her three children. They all help each other with the maintenance of their home.

Martha has had different businesses. The last one was a spa, but she was forced to close it due to disloyal competition. She recently started a new business. She sells different brands of perfumes for women and men. She has been doing this for approximately five months and so far she has got good results.

She hopes to be able to have a wider variety of perfumes, especially high-end brands, in order to satisfy her customers. She has few customers, but they are loyal, which encourages Martha to continue progressing.

Her dream is to have a large store where she can sell all kinds of perfumes and receive a steady income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes from high-end brands.

loans.name: Clendi Ruth

texts.es: Clendi de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene 10 años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Clendi es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Clendi, of 47 years old, lives at her own house along with her husband and her three children. She has a tortillería at her own house. She has had this business for over ten years, and she has a lot of clients thanks to her excellent service. She is very kind with the people that visit her; she always gives them a smile, and has a great ability making tortillas, so she serves her customers in a quick way. 

Clendi is highly dedicated to her work. For her, the most important battles in life are those that we fight day by day, in order to achieve our dreams. She is willing to make an effort to accomplish her objective, and that is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. It will allow her to buy corn in bulk, so she can maintain her production. She hopes that in this way, she will be able to give her family a financial security.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, 36, is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jovelyn's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Jovelyn is taking out a housing loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour for a house for her family.

Jovelyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour

loans.name: Eliu De Jesus

texts.es:
El estilo de vida ligero de las personas y la falta de tiempo por el constante ir y venir, fue lo que motivo a Eliu a iniciar una pequeña venta de comida rápida. Él tiene 37 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos. A diario, prepara deliciosas hamburguesas y exquisitos sándwiches, con el objetivo de deleitar el paladar de su clientela y obtener ganancias. Es un hombre emprendedor y carismático, ha mantenido su negocio durante 13 años, con el que ha superado diversos obstáculos.
Eliu solicita el crédito para aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere de pan, carne, lechuga, tomate, refrescos, entre otros. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, con el que planea lograr estabilidad económica, de manera que pueda brindarle un futuro prospero y grato a su familia, la educación de sus hijos es lo primordial. Un hombre con metas supera toda barrera, su sueño es acondicionar mejor su casa, para la mejor atención de la clientela, al mismo tiempo desea comprar una moto para hacer entregas a domicilio.
texts.en:
People's lifestyles and their lack of time because they are always coming and going is the reason Eliu started his own fast food business. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Every day, he prepares delicious hamburgers and exquisite sandwiches to delight the palate of his customers and earn profit. He is an enterprising and charismatic man and he has maintained his business for 13 years, overcoming different obstacles. 

Eliu is asking for the loan to increase his production capital. He needs bread, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, beverages and more.  He is putting his trust in the loan, and with it he plans on achieving financial stability so that he can offer his family a prosperous and bright future and an education for his children, which is the most important thing. A man with goals overcomes any barrier. His dream is to improve his home so he can better serve his customers. At the asme time, he wants to buy a motorcycle so he can do home deliveries.

loans.use: buy bread, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, beverages, and more.

loans.name: Wilson Manuel

texts.es:
A sus 41 años, Wilson aun se conserva como un hombre optimista y guerrero, un hombre que hace lo que sea por el sustento du su familia.
Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en Montería (Colombia); esta actividad la heredo de su padre quien le enseño el oficio para la vida.
Labora desde las 5:30 Am hasta las 2:00 Pm, en este tiempo recorre gran parte de la ciudad para distribuir el producto y no llegar a su casa con las manos vacías.
El conserva la ilusión de poder progresar por eso necesita comprar materia prima para su negocio, la cual compra al por mayor en las fincas cercanas.
Su mayor sueño es poder sacar a su familia adelante brindándole seguridad.
texts.en:
At his 41 years of age, Wilson still considers himself to be an optimistic and a fighter; a man that would do anything to support his family. Nowadays, he works selling dairy products in Montería (Colombia). He learned this activity from his father, who shared his knowledge with him so he could make a living. 

He works from 5:30 am to 2:00 pm. During this period of time, he visits a lot of places in the city to distribute the product, and also with the purpose of not going back home empty-handed. He maintains the idea of being able to improve. That is why he needs to buy raw materials for his business. He usually buys them in bulk, at nearby farms. 

His biggest dream is to get his family ahead by giving them stability.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for the sale.

loans.name: Năm

texts.en:
Năm, 43, is married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been in this business for more than 10 years.

Năm's main hardship in life is not having a clean water cistern and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Năm's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Năm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to help her family be healthy and happy and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Minh is 55 years old, and she is married with three children.  Minh lives in Nong Cong district in rural Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Minh faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygeinic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Minh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Bendelina

texts.en:
Bendelina, 43, lives with her husband Hendro, 51, and six children. Bendelina has been running a kiosk business for these past three years. The income earned from this business enables her to support her husband in covering their living expenses. 

Currently, Bendelina wants to improve her business by expanding the stock at her kiosk. She is hoping that the more items there are in her kiosk, the more income that can be generated. Therefore, Bendelina requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She will spend the loan on sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and has been in NWTF since 2012.  She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Virginia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two motorcycles with mechanical problems to repair them and sell them at a better place.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos ha tenido la oportunidad de progresar lentamente y a sus 30 años tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida.
El inicio siendo mensajero, luego paso a ser ayudante en un taller de mecánica y hoy en día se dedica en pleno a la mecánica y la fabricación de pequeñas herramientas para el trabajo.
El tiene un pequeño espacio cerca de casas donde realiza todos sus trabajos y desde allí consigue los recursos para subsistir.
El tiene la esperanza de poder tener un taller más grande y tener una producción de herramientas mucho más amplia. Por esta razón acude a un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima y así poder iniciar con su gran proyecto.
texts.en: Carlos has had the chance to make steady progress and now, at the age of 30, knows exactly what he wants to do for a living. He started out as a messenger, then became an assistant in a car repair workshop and he is now totally committed to working as a mechanic and making small tools for his work. he has a small workshop near some houses, where he does his work and earns his living. He hopes to be able to have a bigger workshop and to be able to manufacture a wider range of tools.  For this reason, he is applying for financial assistance to buy raw materials so that he can launch his big project.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making tools

loans.name: Edwin Reyes

texts.es:
Don Edwin de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, sus padres con los pocos ingresos que tenía lo mandaron a la escuela, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, con quien ha compartido muchos años juntos, sus dos hijas estudian, en la mañana le ayudan a los quehaceres a su madre y por la tarde van a la escuela, nadie más vive con ellos.
 

Él tiene una tienda en el centro de la comunidad, donde por hoy la tiene con poco producto, está interesado en un préstamo para surtirla, ya tiene más de 5 años de tenerla, la necesidad de tener ingresos al hogar le hizo tomar la decisión, también se dedica a la agricultura, no tenía otro negocio antes, el negocio lo tiene en la casa, por lo que no necesita transporte para movilizarse, también su esposa se dedica a la atención del negocio, la tienda está abierta de 6 am a 6 pm.
   

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar detergentes, pan, café, arroz, leche, frijoles, shampoo, etc., para ampliar más su negocio, por lo que comprara más productos para la venta, la mejora que el préstamo le traerá, será el poder dar un mejor servicio a los clientes, ya que por hoy hay personas que buscan diferentes productos y no tiene a la venta.

Su deseo es salir adelante con su esfuerzo y trabajo, contando con la bendición de Dios para que le preste salud y vida para continuar, las ganancias  de la tienda las utilizara en el pago de la cuota del préstamo y en la manutención de la casa.
texts.en: 39-year-old Edwin attended school until the age of 11, his parents using the small income they had to provide him with some education. His wife, with whom he has shared many years, takes care of the housework.  His two daughters go to school - hey help their mother with the housework in the morning and then go to school in the afternoon.  No one else lives with them.  Edwin has a shop in the town centre but, at the moment, he does not have many goods and so would like to get a loan to stock it up. He has been running his shop for over 5 years, but his need to have provide income for his home led him to decide to take up farming as well.  he had no other business before and he runs his shop from his home and so he needs transport for getting around. His wife also serves in the shop which is open from 6am to 6pm. He would use the loan he is applying for to buy detergent, bread, coffee, rice, milk, beans, shampoo, etc. to extend his shop by buying more goods to sell. The loan will benefit him by enabling him to serve his customers better, as there are people who are looking for different goods which he does not currently stock. His dream is to keep on making progress through effort and hard work and trusting in God to give him health and life to carry on.  He will use his income from the shop to repay the loan and maintain his home.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bread, coffee, rice, milk, beans, shampoo to further expand his business.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hương is 34 years old, and she is married with three children.  Hương lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district in rural Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having clean a water sytem and hygeinic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

loans.name: Sử

texts.en:
Sử works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Sử has been involved in this business for more than 10 years

Sử is 50 years old, and she is married with two children. Sử lives in Nong Cong district, in rural Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sử's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that Sử faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Sử hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan es un humilde hombre de campo muy dedicado a sus tierras y labores.
El se desenvuelve en el mundo agropecuario cosechando distintos tipos de alimentos que posteriormente vende, una parte la deja para su propio consumo ya que según él, la tierra le provee lo que necesita.
Estos oficios del campo los aprendió de su padre quien le regalo todas sus enseñanzas, y han sido sus consejos los que le han permitido mantenerse en el medio.
El necesita dinero para comprar insumos agropecuarios (riegos, abonos, pesticidas) y de esta forma recuperar un poco los cultivos que perdió en la ola invernal que azoto la región de Córdoba (Colombia) hace algunos meses.
Es un hombre trabajador, perseverante y muy luchador, cualidades que lo han hecho fuerte para soportar todas las adversidades.
texts.en:
Juan is a humble man from the country who is very dedicated to his land and his labor. He works in the farming and livestock business, harvesting two types of food that he later sells. He keeps a part of it for his own consumption, because according to him, the land provides what he needs.

He learned the farming trade from his father, who gifted him with all of his knowledge. It has been his advice that has allowed him to stay in this business.  He needs the money to buy agricultural materials (irrigation items, fertilizer, pesticide). This way, he can recover a little of his crops that he lost in the cold weather that hit the Córdoba (Colombia) region a few months ago. He is a hardworking, persevering man who is a fighter. This has made him strong to withstand all adversity.

loans.use: to replant after losing his crops to cool weather

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 42-year-old  woman who is married  to Orlens, 45, and has two children, Chairen, six, who is in second grade in elementary school, and Varel, who is four.

Mariana has a weaving business. She usually produces 20 regular shawls and one big shawl in a month for her regular customers. They usually buy the shawls to be sold at the art shop. 

In order to meet her customers' demands, Mariana has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000 to purchase yarn, fabric dye and  materials for her shawl weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase yarn, fabric dye and materials for her shawl weaving business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga works in agriculture farming, poultry, and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She is 32-years-old and married with two children.  Nga lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Chính

texts.en:
Chính works in agriculture farming, poultry, and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Chính is 48-years-old and she is married with two children.  She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chính's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that Chính faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Chính hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Lilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell for her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Xuyên

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyên has a retail business selling medicinal herbs.  Xuyên is 50 years old and she is married.  She has two children.
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2008, Xuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuyên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuyên has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Xuyên faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Xuyên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sơn has a retail business selling stationery items. Sơn is 56 years old.  She is married and has three children.
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Sơn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sơn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sơn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Sơn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks…to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Sơn hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet

loans.name: Hòe

texts.en:
Ms. Hoè works in agriculture, farming food.  Hoè is 47 years old and she is single, with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents

In 2009, Hoè joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoè has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoè has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hoè faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hoè hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 60 years old and married.  She has seven children.  Alma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Alma is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Alma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Alma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In future,she  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from nipa-roofing.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela fue toda su vida una humilde trabajadora, realizaba trabajos de aseo en casas de familia para levantar sus tres hijos.
En el momento que se separado del hombre que era su esposo, se vio obligada a tomar toda la responsabilidad del hogar, lo que la llevo realizar diferentes trabajos en algunos casos muy mal remunerados.
Hoy en día trabaja como independiente vendiendo ropa al por menor a sus amigos, familiares y conocidos; trabaja en extensos horarios para aportar con los gastos del hogar, y aunque sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan, ella siente la necesidad de ayudar.
Su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar por eso conserva la ilusión de recaudar fondos para hacerse con un inventario de mercancía y de este modo cumplir con los pedidos que actualmente tiene y no ha podido cubrir ya que sus clientes aumentan cada día mas.
Su sueño es poder tener vivienda propia donde poder vivir tranquila su vejez.
texts.en:
Maricela has been a humble worker all her life. She cleaned other people's homes in order to raise her three children. When she separated from her husband she had to assume all the responsibility for her household, making it necessary for her to take on a variety of jobs, some of which were very poorly paid. 

Currently she works independently, selling clothing at retail to her friends, family, and acquaintances. She works very long hours to earn enough money to cover her household expenses, and even though her children are older and are working, she feels compelled to help. Her biggest problem is the lack of working capital, so she hopes to raise funds so she can build an inventory of merchandise to satisfy the orders she already has and has not been able to cover, since she is getting more customers every day. 

Her dream is to have her own home where she can peacefully spend her golden years.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Yến has been involved in this business for three years.

Yến is 27 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Yến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a tank for a biodigester system.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a tank for a biodigester system

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, 55, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow, and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosalina dreams to expand her business and have a bigger stock of grocery items. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Norqueza

texts.en:
Norqueza is 59 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Norqueza is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norqueza has been farming coconut for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling root crops in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried coconut meat. Violeta is borrowing 11,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more root crops to sell.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Gina has been in this business for seven years. Gina earns more income from fish and food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 31 año de experiencia como confeccionista, , debido a que trabajaba en una empresa de confecciones donde aprendió el oficio y poco a poco lo llevó a introducirse d manera independiente en la modistería e inició estudios para perfeccionarlo.
