Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito de lunes a domingos, y su principal mercado son los padres de familia de colegios con quien sostiene relaciones comerciales de su productos , utilizado sus tres máquinas de coser. Carlos subcontrata operaciones como el bordado y  fileteo y esto no es muy bueno porque incrementa sus costos productivos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 maquinas 1 bordadora y una fileteadora. Sus metas de ahorro no se detienen por eso necesita generar los ingresos suficientes para pagar su pensión y esto es su principal meta empresarial.
texts.en:
Carlos has 31 years of experience making clothing, as he worked at a clothing company where he learned the trade. It gradually led him to become an independent dressmaker and he began to study to perfect his skills. 

He sells for cash and for credit and works from Monday through Sunday.  He has business relationships with local schools, using his three sewing machines, and his main customers are the parents of the school children. He outsources some of the work such as embroidery and edging, but this adds to his production costs. It is for this reason that he is approaching Credikiva for his first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy two machines - an embroiderer and an overlock sewing maching. 

There is no end to his savings goals; he must generate enough income to cover his pension and this is his primary business goal.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and an embroidery machine

loans.name: Demalyn

texts.en:
Demalyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business. She has been in NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Demalyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Demalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after super typhoon Haiyan.

loans.name: Khuri

texts.ru: Хури пенсионерка из города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 58 лет. Она в Курган-Тюбе живет вместе и с невесткой и внуком. Хури решила отремонтировать дом и привести в порядок домашние апартаменты. Хури давно мечтала сделать ремонт и собрала некоторое сбережения, но этой суммы не достаточно для ремонта. Хури просит кредит и обещает выплачивать в сроки, чтобы завершить ремонт дом.
texts.en: Khuri is a retired woman from Qurgan-Tube. She is 58 and lives with her daughter-in-law and her grandson. Khuri decided to renovate her house and get all of the rooms in order. She has dreamed of making these repairs for a long time and saved up some money, but it is not enough to cover the expenses. She asked for a loan to complete the repairs and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials and make repairs on her house

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắm has a service business shipping goods. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents

This is Thắm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thắm faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and a water filtration system.

With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and a water filtration system

loans.name: Điệu

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệu operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. Điệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is 34 years old, and she is married with three children. Điệu lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Điệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Điệu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Điệu faces in her life is low profit margins. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Điệu hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mrs. Nam has a retail business selling dry food. Nam has been involved in this business for three years.

Nam is 47 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

In 2013, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nam has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nam faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to buy a clean water machine.

With her business profit, Nam hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy a clean water machine

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh has a service business shipping goods. Vinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Vinh is 45 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Vinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Vinh faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy charcoal, vinegar, oil and gas needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more charcoal, vinegar, oil and gas needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mamerta hopes to buy a vehicle and dreams to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for charcoal, vinegar, oil and gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Hiểu

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiểu  works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She  is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Hiểu's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiểu  faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygeinic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filtration system.

With her business profit, Hiểu  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filtration systerm

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business.

Belen has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Rudelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rudelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Maria has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maria has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maria is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is married and works hard to support her family.She sells root crops in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Rebecca requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan. She restarted her fish selling business. 

Corazon requested a housing loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase building materials and pay for labor so she can build a house for her family. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Kristine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Kristine has been in this business for six years now and also earns additional income from food-vending.

In the future, Kristine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tính

texts.en:
Tính is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Tinh is not having a water tank and water filter. She requested her second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build water tank. With her business profit, Tính hopes to make enough money to provide for her children. She also hopes that her family is healthy and happy and her business does well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build water tank

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường has a business, farming poultry and cattle. Hường is 27 years old and she is married, with two children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hường's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hường has been involved in this business for eight years. 

The main hardship that Hường faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Hường hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Phú

texts.en:
Mrs. Phú works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Phú has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Phú is 47 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Phú joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phú has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water system.

With her business profit, Phú hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water system.

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến has a retail business selling medication. She has been involved in this business for five years. Yến is 28 years old and she is married with one child. Yến supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Yến faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family are obliged to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Letty successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Letty's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture, farming food. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives with her three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a water tank and a water filter. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Ngà

texts.en:
Ngà operates a food stall selling fish. Ngà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 41 years old and married with two children. Ngà lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Ngà faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and a clean water system.

In the future, Ngà hopes to buy a motorbike. She hopes her business will do well and hopes to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a clean water system

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia previously requested a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she used to buy siomai, buko, and other ingredients for her food stand. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Alicia requested another loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy siomai, buko, and other ingredients for her food stand. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs. 

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to have a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase siomai, buko, and other ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Leonora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lâm

texts.en:
Lâm works in agriculture, farming food. She is 49 years old and she is married, with four children. Lâm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lâm's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a water tank and a water filter. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water system.

With her business profit, Lâm hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water system.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Luzviminda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Luzviminda is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Luzviminda has been with NWTF since 2012 as part of her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a widow and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling coconut juice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her coconut juice business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her coconut juice business.

loans.name: Papala

texts.en:
Papala works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell for her business.

Papala has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan. She is requesting a housing loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase building materials and pay for labor so she can build a house for her family. Sheryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a restaurant in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, and spices to use in her business. Dolores has been in this line of work for 10 years, and supplements her income by buying and selling charcoal. She has sustained her business activities through her own hard work and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, and spices.

loans.name: José Cesar

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela de otra comunidad que la quedaba a unos 2 kilómetros de distancia, sus padres con los pocos ingresos que tenía lo mandaron a la escuela, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, con quien ha compartido muchos años juntos, sus tres  hijos estudian, en la mañana le ayudan a los quehaceres a su madre y por la tarde van a la escuela, nadie más vive con ellos.

Él es empleado de un sistema de agua potable, por ser responsable y honesto, la comunidad decidió emplearlo para que fuese él quien administrara el sistema de agua, tiene más de 5 años que está ejerciendo en ese cargo, se le dio la oportunidad de trabajar y la aprovecho, también se dedica a la agricultura, y tiene un estanque donde tiene peces para la venta, la distancia que recorre es de 4 km aproximadamente, por lo que su buen estado de salud se lo permite, solo él realiza la actividad, el horario de trabajo es de 3 am a 8 pm y de 4 pm a 6 pm.     

El préstamo lo solicita para la agricultura, los gasto que tendrá son para el pago de personas que le ayuden al trabajo, la ayuda será el tener un capital de trabajo disponible para trabajar.
 
Su deseo es salir adelante con su esfuerzo y trabajo, contando con la bendición de Dios para que le preste salud y vida para continuar, con el sueldo que recibe lo utilizara el pago de la cuota del préstamo y en la manutención de la casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old. He finished sixth grade at a school in another community that was about 2km away. His parents used the little they had to sent him to school.
His wife is a home maker and they've shared many years together. Their three children are in school. In the morning they help around the house and in the afternoon they go to school. No one else lives with them.

He is employed by a water treatment facility. As he is very responsible and honest, the community decided choose him to manage the facility, which he's been doing for more than 5 year. He was given this opportunity to work and he took it, but he is also a farmer and he has a pond where her keeps fish for sale. He walks a distance is about 4 km to sell his products. as long as his good health allows it. He works alone from 3am to 8pm.

He is requesting this loan to use in agriculture, he will hire people to help him out and will have some capital available to work.
 
His wish is to move forward with his effort and work, with God's blessing, he will live a long and healthy life. He will use his earnings to repay this loan and to support his home.

loans.use: He is requesting this loan to hire people to help him out in his farm.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 12ème prêt. Les 11 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’habits à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la 1ère femme  debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women who on average are 36 years old with four children. They live in extended traditional families in the Massablacoura quarter in the town of Bougouni.
They met through friendship, business and neighbourhood ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to do business better, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their 12th loan. The 11 previous loans have been repaid. This group of women sells clothing like Fatoumata who is the first person standing on the far left in the photo. With her loan she plans to purchase 10 units of wax print from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her merchandise at the market and from her home for cash and for credit to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40.000FCFA which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến has a service business, cutting hair. She is 26 years old and she is married, with one child. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Yến's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Yến has been involved in this business for three years.

The main hardship that Yến faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water system.

With her business profit, Yến hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water system.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 47 years old and married, with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for four years and also earns an income from fishing.

Melinda has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, eggs, and milk. She has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 65 años de edad vive junto con su familia; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 25 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía.  Carlos tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Carlos is 65 years old and lives with his family. Carlos works in farming, growing corn and beans. He has been doing this work for 25 years and has a lot of valuable experience that allows him to have the best harvests. Carlos' land is in an area with a lot of farming. He sells his goods in the surrounding area and has many regular customers who prefer his products as they are of good quality and sold at affordable prices; in addition the service is unbeatable. Carlos wants to to invest in farming supplies. He needs capital, however, and so is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy seeds, manure, insecticides. fertilisers, anti-disease chemicals, and tools, and to improve his land (shown in the photograph). Carlos has a good credit rating and is sure that he will be able to pay off his debt on time. He is also confident that he can offer his family they life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides. fertilisers, anti-disease chemicals, tools and more to improve his land.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is 25 years old and she is married, with one child. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a clean-water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean-water system. This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business so that her business will do well and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean-water system.

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Tình is 49 years old and she is married, with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tình faces in her life is not having a clean-water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and a clean-water system. This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, so that her business will do well and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean-water system.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel  tiene 65 años tiene dos, él se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Santos Dumont, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor Gabriel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción  de su vivienda ya que quiere brindar comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para el terminado de la construcción de su casa para lo cual le falto par algunos detalles,  el señor Gabriel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son continuar ampliando su actividad teniendo más clientes su negocio y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar su negocio, el señor Gabriel  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Gabriel is 65 years old. He makes a living selling food from a stall in the Santos Dumont area. This is Gabriel's first loan with the organisation. He will use it to buy building materials to do work on his house and make it more comfortable for his family. Gabriel is applying for this loan as he does not have enough cash to finish building his house, as a few small jobs still need to be done. Gabriel is facing challenges at his business, such as expanding it and gaining more customers. Gabriel wants to use his profits to expand his business. Gabriel is very hard-working and grateful for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên is 56 years old and she is married, with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Duyên faces in her life is not having a latrine; her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Duyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Duyên hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lịch

texts.en:
Lịch is 48 years old and she is married, with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Lịch has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lịch faces in her life is not having a latrine; her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Lịch's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lịch hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Moussa Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa est un promoteur qui évolue dans la commercialisation des habits de prêt à porter et des chaussures. Agé de 30 ans, il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de ses parents. Ayant une expérience de plus de 5ans, il demande de crédit d’un montant de 200.000F pour acheter et vendre des prêts à porter et des chaussures. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir Moussa voudrais augmenter son stock de marchandises et ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter . Il voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et  épargner un peu d’argent. Ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Moussa is a developer who is building up a business selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoes. He is 30 years old, single and has no children. He manages his parents' daily outgoings. With more than five years' experience, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing and shoes. He begins his day at eight o'clock in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening. In the future Moussa would like to increase his stock and open a ready-to-wear clothing shop. He would also like to increase his income and save a little money. By doing this he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale to his customers.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 49 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos. El posee una panadería en el cual elabora pan francés y pan dulce, posee mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender y los precios muy accesibles. Alfredo es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre esta en busca de darle lo mejor a su familia, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, latas, levaduras, manteca, etc. y mejora el horno que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos, el tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alfredo is 49 years old and lives with his partner and their four children. Alfredo has a bakery where he sells both sweet and savoury bread. He has many customers as he offers friendly service and affordable prices. Alfredo is very hard-working and always looking to give his family the best he can. As a result he is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral", which will allow him to buy flour in bulk, dough, yeast, butter and more. He also wants to make improvements to his oven (shown in the photo) in order to be able to continue his work. This is Alfredo's only source of income and he is hopeful that it will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk, dough, yeast and butter, and to improve his oven.

loans.name: Thoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 55 years old and she is married, with two children. Thoan lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thoan's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Thoan has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build toilet.

With her business profit, Thoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yone Damn

texts.es:
Yone es un joven de 27 años de edad, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante es por ello que trabaja muy duro cada día como empleado de un supermercado de la ciudad, desde hace 1 año y de esta manera puede solventar sus gastos y poder apoyar a su familia.

Yone esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, mejorar la habitación donde vida y comprar algunos enseres para su vivienda; de esta manera el podrá seguir esforzándose y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” tener un negocio propio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Yone is 27 years old and has a great desire to prosper. He works very hard every day at one of the city's supermarkets. He has been working there for a year now and, with this job, he is able to cover his costs and support his family.

Yone is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his home: he will improve his living room and buy household appliances. He will then be able to continue working and putting in the effort to make his big dream - of having his own business and improving his quality of life - a reality.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and to buy equipment.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is 42 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nam faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In 2012, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nam hopes to maintain  a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es:
Un armónico pedaleo de máquina de coser es el aviso a todos los vecinos de Anabel, que pueden llevar toda ropa que necesiten confeccionar, ella los recibirá con una cálida sonrisa y buena disposición. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace 16 años conoció el arte de la costura. Es una mujer emprendedora y excelente madre, su principal apoyo es su esposo, juntos velan por la educación de sus hijos, para asegurarles un futuro prospero. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales, así como telas, hilos y tijeras. Este es el segundo financiamiento que solicita a Kiva y MiCrédito, con quienes está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado, puesto que ha aumentando su capital de producción y obtenido más ganancias. Es una mujer con grandes ideales, planea establecer un taller de costura propio, al mismo tiempo comprar otra máquina de coser eléctrica. Su meta es seguir produciendo y trabajar con esmero y dedicación.
texts.en:
A rhythmic humming of the sewing machine tells all the neighbors that they can bring any clothing they need sewing done on. Anabell greets them with a warm smile and a good disposition. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. She learned the art of sewing 16 years ago. She is an enterprising woman and an excellent mother. Her principal support is her husband and together they look after the education of their children, making sure they have a good future.

Anabell is requesting a loan to buy materials like fabric, thread and scissors. This is the second loan she has asked for from Kiva and MiCredito and she is grateful for the support given her as she has increased her production capital and made more income. As a woman with big ideas she plans to establish her own sewing workshop and at the same time buy another sewing machine. Her goal is to continue to work and produce with care and dedication.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread and scissors.

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en:
Mayleen is 31 years old and married with four children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

Mayleen has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Mayleen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is 49 years old, married, and has two children. Phượng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall, selling crabs. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Phượng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Monsieur Khadim est un promoteur qui évolue dans la commercialisation des  articles électroniques. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont le plus grand a 10 ans et le plus petit 3ans. Agé de 35ans il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son commerce et quitte sa maison à 8h pour y revenir que vers les couts de 19h. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des matériels électroniques. Il veut aussi augmenter son stock de marchandises et souhaite à l’avenir ouvrir un autre magasin de vente de matériels électroniques
texts.en: Mr. Khadim is a businessman who sells electronic articles. He is married with three children, the oldest is 10 and the youngest three years old. He is 35 years old and he manages the daily family expenses and the school fees for his children. He has over ten years experience in his business. He leaves home at 0800 in the morning and returns home at about 1900 in the evening. He requests this loan to buy electronic articles for resale. He would also like to increase his stock of merchandise and in the future hopes to open another shop for selling electronic products.

loans.use: to purchase electronic articles for resale

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Thúy has been involved in this business for five years. With her business profit, she hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

Thiệu is 61 years old and she is single with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

In 2010, Thiệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thiệu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She has been involved in this business for five years.With her business profit, she hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling crabs. She has been involved in this business for one year.

She is 24 years old and she is single.  She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  In the future, she hopes to maintain  a successful business, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es: José es un hombre de  61 años de edad que se ejerció toda la vida a profesión de auxiliar de construcción, donde trabajo pro varios años y aprendió del oficio, al mismo tiempo iba ahorrando capital para la compra de una máquina de molar que le permitiera fabricar bloques usados en la construcción, aparte de esto también tiene un alquiler de lavadoras inicio con una y hoy en día tiene 15 lavadoras operando, su sed de crecer no termina y a pesar de su edad quiere progresar quiere convertir su negocio en una gran ferretería que comercialice  sus productos pro toda la ciudad para esto requiere un crédito para la compra de materiales como arena y triturado materia prima para fabricar los bloques con la ilusión de ofrecerles en diferentes puntos de la ciudad y que tengan buen apogeo por parte de sus clientes, lograr fidelizarlos y que estos lo recomiende para volver de su negocio un establecimiento requerido por todas las personas y así construir una gran casas donde puede vivir los largos años que le quedan de vida
texts.en:
José is a 61 year old man who has worked all his life as an assistant builder. He worked for several years to learn the trade and at the same time was saving money to buy a mixing machine to make cinder blocks used in construction. Besides this he also has a laundromat which he started with one machine and today has 15 machines.

His thirst to grow has not stopped despite his age. He wants to grow and transform his business into a large hardware store that sells his product to all the city. So he needs a loan to buy raw materials like sand and gravel with the goal of offering them for sale in various locations in the city. He hopes to get good support from his clients, win their loyalty and have this make his business a required establishment for all. Then he can build a big house where he can live the many years left in his life.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel to make cinder blocks.

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Ngoan is 33 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngoan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine; her family shares a neighbor’s latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Ngoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

texts.en:

This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a water tank. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Sơn hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

texts.en:
Lệ is 54 years old and single. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Lệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverage. Lệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for supporting her children’s education, and in covering their personal, household, and business expenses. She also has a printing business for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorna hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marfely

texts.en:
Marfely is 67 years old and widowed with one child.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Marfely has been farming coconut for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and crabs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. Marfely is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers for her coconut farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her coconut farming.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ella es casada, su esposo trabaja como seguridad en un banco, tienen 4 hijos. La 1ra estudio séptimo grado, la 2da estudia 1er grado de bachillerato en segundo, la 3ra estudia séptimo grado y el 4to estudia primer grado, con ella solo viven sus cuatro hijos y su esposo.
   
Gloria se dedica a vender en el cafetín de la escuela, lleva 7 meses de tener esta actividad, y lo fines de semana hace pan y tamales y los sale a vender. Antes solo era ama de casa, por iniciativa propia compraba pocas cosas para vender cerca de la escuela cuando fue aumentando sus ventas invirtió más en ello. Cada  día va aumentando sus ventas y es así como aprendió la actividad, antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar. El lugar donde vende esta a 15 minutos de su casa y se transporta a pie. Su esposo es quien le ayuda a comprar los productos para la venta y sus hijos le ayudan en lo que está a su alcance


Ella con el préstamo, comprara mercadería para su negocio específicamente churros, galletas, jugos, sodas. Así mismo, comprara 6 pliegos de lámina para arreglar el techo de su cocina porque se aproxima la época lluviosa y se moja demasiado, satisfacera la necesidad de comprar todo aun tiempo y con ello podrá ahorrar.


Ella sueña con ver  a sus  hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria, con las ganancias de su negocio ampliara mas sus ventas y dará  así una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a security guard in a bank and her four children. She studied up to Grade 3. Her children are in 1st year of secondary school, two in Grade 7 and one in Grade 1.

Gloria works selling in the school cafeteria. She has been doing this for 7 months. On weekends she makes bread and tamales which she sells. Previously she was just a housewife but on her own initiative she bought a few things to sell close to the school. As her sales grew she invested more money into it. That is how she started the business and her sales continue to grow. It is 15 minutes from her house and she walks there. Her husband helps her buy the goods and her children help her when they can.

With the loan Gloria will buy merchandise for her business, specifically churros, cookies, juices and pop. She will also buy 6 pieces of laminate to reapir the roof of her kitchen as the rainy season is approaching and everything gets wet. She will buy everything at once so she can save money.

Gloria dreams of seeing her children graduate from university. With the profits from her business she will increase her sales and be able to provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy churros, cookies, juice and pop. She also needs to buy laminate to repair her kitchen roof.

loans.name: Hotambek

texts.ru:
Хотамбек 32-летний скотовод из горного района Вахш. Он на протяжении 6 лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота и обеспечивает семью за счет прибыли с этой деятельности. Семья Хотамбека большая. Он, его жена и дочь живут в одном доме с его родителями, двумя братьями, невесткой и племянником. Отец и младший брат помогают Хотамбеку в выращивании коров и быков. Это у них семейный бизнес, который они продвигают совместно. 
Сейчас семья Хотамбека нуждается в кредите. Дело в том, что племянник Хотамбека учится в третьем курсе медицинского колледжа и в этом году его семья еще не оплатила за обучение. Им необходимо достать 1200 долларов США, но так как этой суммы у них на руках нету, поэтому Хотамбек обратился за кредитом. В его семье действует девиз "Один за всех и все за одного". Поэтому Хотамбек берет на себя обязательство, чтобы помочь племяннику оплатить за контракт. Он всецело надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Hotambek is a 32-year-old farmer from the mountainous Vakhsh region. For the past six years he has raised cattle as a means of providing for his family. Hotambek has a large family. He, his wife and his daughter live in the same house as his parents, his two brothers, his sister-in-law and his nephew. His father and younger brother help him raise the cows and the bulls. It is their family business and they work together. 

Now Hotambek's family needs a loan. His nephew is in his third year at the medical college, but the family has not paid the tuition for this year. They need $1,200 USD and since they do not have the money, Hotambek is applying for a loan. His family has the motto "all for one and one for all," so Hotambek is taking it upon himself to help pay for his nephew's tuition. He very much hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his nephew's tuition fees at the medical college

loans.name: Munkhdul

texts.en: Munkhdul is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a data cabling engineer at a private firm since 2011. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their son. He is requesting a loan of $850 (USD) to buy shingles, fiberglass, and foam for home renovation. His family lives on the fifth floor of an apartment heavily damaged by snow and rain over the years. After renovation, the apartment will no longer lose its heat through its roof so less energy will be used, in turn reducing coal usage and contributing to fighting air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment roof

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Duyên is 50 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Duyên faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Duyên’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 25 years old and married with two kids. She is a very patient and loving person. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. Merlita and her husband always wake up early in the morning to clean and feed their pigs. 

Merlita hopes that she can expand her business so that she can save enough money to build their own house.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura sus siembras son maíz y maicillo, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Oscar está solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y así poder obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar, 34 years old, has made a living for 10 years from agriculture. His crops are corn and sorghum. Additionally, he also works as a day laborer on a farm near his residence. With what he makes from his jobs, he is able to pay some of the expenses of his home. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. 

Oscar is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to purchase the necessary agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. He also wants to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph, to be able to continue with his crops and so be able to make a better income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Lịch

texts.en:
Lịch operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Lịch is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lịch joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lịch faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lịch hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university degree certificate

loans.name: Manuel Albito

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 51 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre que lucha por salir adelante para mejorar sus condiciones de  vida y la de su familia. La actividad principal de don Manuel es la siembra y venta de pilones de café, eligió esta labor porque le gusta y además de ello obtiene ingresos y ganancias, que le ayudan a mejorar la economía de su familia.
Ahora tiene ocho años de experiencia en esta área, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para compra de materiales que servirá para la siembra de café, de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ganancias.
Sueña con construir su vivienda y ampliar su negocio, para que en un futuro él y su familia vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 51-year-old man. He is single. Currently, he lives with his parents and siblings in the Sololá department. 

He is a man who struggles to come out ahead to improve his and his family’s living conditions. Manuel’s main activity is the sowing and sale of coffee. He chose this trade because he likes it, and aside from that, he makes an income and obtains profits that help him to improve the family’s economy.

He now has eight years of experience in this area, which is why he is requesting a loan of Q 10,000.00 to purchase materials that will be used for sowing coffee. In this way, he will be able to increase his profits.

He dreams of constructing his home and improving his business so that in the future he and his family can live better.

loans.use: to purchase materials that will be used for coffee sowing.

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên operates a food stall restaurant selling noodles. She is 37 years old and married with two children. Duyên supports two dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2013, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair a toilet.

With her business profits, Duyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair a toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan operates a food stall restaurant selling fish. She is 45 years old and married with two children. Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Bính

texts.en:
Mrs. Bính works in agriculture, farming food. She is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. This is Bính’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Bính has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that She faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Bính hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nery Isaias

texts.es: Nery de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años su principal siembra es el maíz  y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Nery está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar  con sus siembras y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nery is 30 years old. He lives with his three children and his wife in a house that he owns. He has worked in agriculture for four years; his principal crops are corn and beans. He sells his products in different markets that are found near his place of residence. With the profits that he makes, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. 

Nery is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land (shown in the photograph) so that he can continue with his farming and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng works in agriculture, farming food. She is 29 years old and married with two children. Hồng lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Hồng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr: Mr Koudjo âgé de 40ans a pour conjointe une revendeuse. Il a des enfants de 12 et 09ans qui sont scolarisés. Il est vulgarisateur depuis 2009 et a loué un garage pour servir ses clients. Afin de mieux satisfaire ses derniers, il fait son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des machines. Il espère ouvrir un grand garage, engager des employés et assurer une bonne scolarisation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Koudjo, who is 40 years old, is married to a saleswoman. He has children of 12 and nine years old who go to school. He has been an extension agent since 2009 and has rented a garage for his customers. In order to better satisfy his clients, he requests his second loan from Wages to purchase machines. He hopes to open a large garage, take on employees and ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a vulcanizing machine.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for his transportation business. He works hard and his income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Virgilio hopes to buy more jeepney units and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work. That is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Riimaa

texts.en: Mrs. Riimaa used her loan for building a house two years ago. She has divorced and lives with her youngest son. She has been selling clothes since 2000 and now owns two stalls. Her three daughters all got married and live separately. She is requesting a loan of 2,300 USD to buy clothes in large quantity from China at wholesale prices, so that she can run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. This clothes retail business is an important income generator for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for her business.

loans.name: Clievy

texts.en: Clievy is married with two children. She operates her own transportation service business while her husband works in a private institution to make a living. For two years she has earned well to support the family. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover the costs for renewal of transportation licenses. In the future, the couple wants to but another motorcycle for expansion of the business. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for renewal of transportation licenses.

loans.name: Pedro Rolando

texts.es:
Pedro Es un joven con muchs ganas de salir adelante, trabaja brindando mantenimiento de computadoras con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar sus gastos de estudio, ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas y de esta manera seguir adelante.

Pedro esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas e insumos para su negocio de reparación de computadoras y de esta manera poder mejorar la atención a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera poder seguir esforzándose para poder realizar su mas grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder tener un negocio mas grande”.
texts.en:
Peter is a young man with a desire to succeed. He works providing computer maintenance in order to have an income and especially to pay for his education expenses, as he is currently pursuing an Engineering Systems degree to get ahead. 

Pedro is grateful to the kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to buy tools and supplies for his computer repair business and thus improve customer service, increase his income, and continue trying to achieve his biggest dream: to finish his degree and to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture, farming food. She is 24 years old and married with one child. Minh lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Minh’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor’s latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Minh hopes to buy a motorbike, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa works in agriculture, farming food. She is 46 years old and she is married, with three children. Hoa lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai is 44 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. Mai operates a food stall/restaurant, selling rice noodle. Mai has been involved in this business for more than ten years. 

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Mai faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Lucas Toliman is an indigenous town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. The small rural community of San Juan is located nearby. Seven women have just formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan” meaning “The Hardworking Women of San Juan” and are about to start their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge! The ladies have an average age of 33 years and average three children per family.

Norma is a 26 year old member of the Trust Bank and has been selected as Treasurer. She married at a very young age and has three children who are enrolled in elementary school. Her husband is an agricultural worker. As Norma wanted to help meet the needs of her family and generate extra income, she decided to start a business. She makes delicious tamales which are quite popular in Guatemala and are made with rice and/or corn. Norma makes them several times each week. She approached Friendship Bridge for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of cooking materials as she wants to diversify and add more customers to her business. Norma was only able to attend school until the 4th grade and realizes the tremendous benefits of education. Her long-term desire is that her children graduate from high school, at the very least. She and her husband are committed to this goal and are working hard to achieve it. 

At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares pertinent and useful information with the ladies. Everyday topics include business administration including budgeting, marketing and sales, women’s and children’s rights, nutrition and health as well as self-esteem. It is the combination of microcredit and educational trainings that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus”. 

When KIVA investors make a loan to a client like Norma, they are supporting her empowerment and future success. This will trickle down to her family and her community. The women of “Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan” appreciate the opportunity to secure a loan and are grateful to KIVA investors. They are committed to repaying the loan fully and on time. We look forward to reporting on the success of Norma and the rest of the hardworking ladies of the Trust Bank!
texts.en:
San Lucas Toliman is an indigenous town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. The small rural community of San Juan is located nearby. Seven women have just formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan” meaning “The Hardworking Women of San Juan” and are about to start their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge! The ladies have an average age of 33 years and average three children per family.

Norma is a 26 year old member of the Trust Bank and has been selected as Treasurer. She married at a very young age and has three children who are enrolled in elementary school. Her husband is an agricultural worker. As Norma wanted to help meet the needs of her family and generate extra income, she decided to start a business.
