She makes delicious tamales which are quite popular in Guatemala and are made with rice and/or corn. Norma makes them several times each week. She approached Friendship Bridge for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of cooking materials as she wants to diversify and add more customers to her business. Norma was only able to attend school until the 4th grade and realizes the tremendous benefits of education. Her long-term desire is that her children graduate from high school, at the very least. She and her husband are committed to this goal and are working hard to achieve it. 

At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares pertinent and useful information with the ladies. Everyday topics include business administration including budgeting, marketing and sales, women’s and children’s rights, nutrition and health as well as self-esteem. It is the combination of microcredit and educational trainings that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus”. 

When KIVA investors make a loan to a client like Norma, they are supporting her empowerment and future success. This will trickle down to her family and her community. The women of “Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan” appreciate the opportunity to secure a loan and are grateful to KIVA investors. They are committed to repaying the loan fully and on time. We look forward to reporting on the success of Norma and the rest of the hardworking ladies of the Trust Bank!

loans.use: To purchase cooking materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ingredients needed in making steamed rice cakes. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients needed in making steamed rice cakes. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes that her business will last longer and she dreams to be freed from poverty. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, each fellowship group gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed in making steamed rice cakes

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Xuân has a retail business selling dry food. Xuân is 61 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family is always in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan also helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennifer dreams to have a grocery store someday and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, each fellowship group gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
José de 71 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es casado su esposa se dedica a la elaboración y comercio de pan  y tamales, tiene cuatro hijos, la 1ra trabaja en la capital del país, la segunda trabaja en la ciudad, la tercera no estudia ayuda en los oficios del hogar, y el 4to estudia Ing., civil.
   

   El Señor se dedica a trabajar como albañil , lleva 12 años de trabajar en esta actividad, al principio trabajaba solo como auxiliar,  luego con el paso del tiempo fue poniéndole más interés al trabajo hasta que un día decidió trabajar  ya como albañil calificado, otra actividad productiva es la agricultura. Cuando trabaja de albañil la distancia al trabajo es variable porque termina una obra en un lugar y sale para otra a lugares diferentes. Su esposa y sus hijos son los que colaboran indirectamente dándole la alimentación.

  
Con el financiamiento comprara todos los insumos para la siembra de los granos básicos, entre los cuales están los insecticidas, los herbicidas, por otra parte pagara mano de obra para que realicen las diferentes actividades. Será satisfecha la necesidad de comprar de una vez los insumos, con ello estará ahorrando.


El sueño es aumentar su producción agrícola, también ayudar a su hijo para que termine sus estudios y pueda graduarse y un día si Dios lo permite que trabaje y ayude a sus hermanas para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 71 years old. He has a third-grade education. He is married, and his wife works making and selling bread and tamales. He has four children; the first works in the country's capital, the second works in the city, the third doesn't go to school but rather helps with the housework, and the fourth is studying civil engineering.

José works as a mason; he has worked in this trade for 12 years. In the beginning, he only worked as an assistant. Then, with the passage of time, he became more and more interested in the work until one day he decided to work as a qualified mason. His other productive activity is agriculture. When he works as a builder, the distance to his work is variable, because he finishes a job in one place and then heads to another somewhere else. His wife and his children help him indirectly by giving him his meals.

With the loan, he will buy all the supplies for growing staple grains, including insecticides and herbicides. In addition, he will pay for manual labor to carry out different tasks. This will satisfy his need to buy his supplies all at once, which will save him money. 
  
José's dream is to increase his agricultural production and also to help his son so that he can finish his education, graduate, and one day, God willing, be able to work and help his sisters so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and herbicides, as well as to pay for manual labor to carry out different tasks.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 39-year-old married women, and she is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs maintenance for his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable pay for maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Gulshan has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.


With the help of this loan, Gulshan’s husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Gulshan also plans to make savings with the profits of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Gulshan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 59-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing cushions for the past several years to support her family. She sews beautiful cushions at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is an old man and her sons work in a factory but earn insufficient income to support the family.

She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she has requested a loan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloth and polyester. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use a portion of her revenue to provide better facilities for her children.

loans.use: to purchase threads, fancy cloth and polyester for sewing cushions at home.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has several years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fifth loan cycle but it will be the first loan with BRAC as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a daughter. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been making shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot experience in his profession. He sews leather and Rexene shoes by machine, and after that, he attaches the sole by stitching with his hands. In this way, he is getting an income for his family. He has been making shoes at home, but now he has established a shop to continue his business on a wider level. But he does not have enough money to buy the initial raw material for making more shoes. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy raw material for making shoes.

Rukhsana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make shoes

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 48-year-old lady who is living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her son is a turner by profession; he manufactures and renews spare parts for vehicle. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture spare parts for various vehicles. His lathe machine is now out of order due to continuously working and needs maintenance. He has spent his all savings to buy raw materials for manufacturing spare parts and does not have cash on hand to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Jamila has requested a loan for her son so that he can fix the lathe machine and can buy additional cutting tools. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her son can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for a lathe machine and to buy additional cutting tools.

loans.name: Janchivdorj

texts.en: Mr. Janchivdorj, 26 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a factory, which makes vacuum-insulated windows, since 2008. His wife is a saleswoman at a grocery store. He also breeds livestock and sells its meat and dairy products. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy planks. Using the planks, he will make fences around his home. Fenced land will protect from intruders.

loans.use: to build fences on his land

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is a 50-year-old, widowed mother of six children. She has owned her own bakery for 18 years. Her long experience has provided her with special talents in her domain. She faced some difficulties during establishing her business, since she had to raise her children and develop her business alone after her husband passed away. 

This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her last loan was requested was for her daughter to undergo a surgery. Her acquired loan will be invested in buying a car necessary for her business development.  It will help her in transporting business needs from the wholesale market to the bakery easily. As for the future, she hopes to open a wider bakery and develop her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for business development, and needed for transporting business needs from the wholesale market to her bakery.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 28 years old and married with three children. She is full of strength and determination for her dreams. Sometimes she encounters problems, such as the weather conditions, because she doesn't have her own shop where she can wait for her costumers. Jocelyn goes to the houses of her costumers to clean their nails. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP to buy a cuticle remover, nail cutter, nail color, and nipper for her business so that she can serve her clients well.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes that she can build her own stall.

loans.use: to buy a cuticle remover, nail cutter, nail color, and nipper for her business

loans.name: Haidie

texts.en:
Haidie has six children and plans on sending them to school up to their college level of education. Her greatest dream is for them to finish their college education and become professionals someday. She also wants to see them become successful individuals in the future.

Haidie and her husband are doing their best to give a better future to their children. Her husband is a farmer while she is managing their hog-raising business. 

She wants to borrow a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to grow the business and increase her income to fully support her children's needs in pursuing their educations.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am, age 29, lives in a small house in a village in the Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. She is married with two children, one of whom is ready for school and another who is too young. Rice farming and animal husbandry are the major sources of her income for her family. She has been working in these fields for more than 10 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Am has been a member of Hattha Kaksekar for four cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Am is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family

loans.name: Irma Del Transito

texts.es: Irma de 40 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son: maíz y frijol, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gatos que se les presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, Irma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old and for the past three years, she has worked in agriculture.  Every year, she plants the main basic grains of the region such as: corn and beans.  With the earnings that she generates from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they are able to cover their household expenses.  She lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their children.  

Irma is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, manure, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, etc., and to improve the land that can be seen in the picture.  This will allow her to generate more income and provide her family with their needs without limitations.

loans.use: purchase seeds, manure, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en: This is Laurita. She is married with one kid. She would like to apply for a loan to buy cooking oil, skin of pork and spices for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Laurita hopes to have another branch and dreams of living happily. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, pork skin and spices

loans.name: Ruqaiya

texts.en:
Ruqaiya is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing plastic accessories using an injection-molding machine for many years. He buys plastic crushing raw material from the market and puts it into the injection-molding machine. He manufactures the accessories, sells them in the market and generates enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood.

She is the mother of seven children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her fifth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic bottles so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Ruqaiya is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy plastic crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic bottles.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin has been operating his own retail store for more than five years and he earns well from this. With his generated revenue, he has been able to sustain his family's living. The couple have to work hard, with determination of having better income, to provide their children better educations in the near future. 

To improve sales, Arvin took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional inventory goods to resell. In the future, Arvin hopes to improve the general living conditions of the his family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory goods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to assist and maintain her crops.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 52-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a barbershop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Shehnaz needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her husband’s barbershop.  But due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her husband’s business, so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also help him to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family. For this financial assistance, Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more good instruments for her husband's barbershop.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer soltera de 40 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el Departamento de Sololá. 
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes y se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Esta actividad la ayuda a contribuir a la economía de su familia, porque tiene una fuerte demanda. Como también se dedica a la crianza de pollos y producción de banano.
Ahora doña Catarina está solicitando un préstamo de Q 9,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario, de esta manera ella podrá ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El sueño de doña Catarina es incrementar sus ganancias, para poder construir su vivienda y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 40 year old single woman.  Currently, she lives with her four children in Sololá.  She is a hardworking woman who fights for her family's wellbeing.  She states that she has a grocery store that is located a few meters from her home.  This business helps her to contribute to her family's finances because there is a high demand.  She also works raising chickens and growing bananas.  

Catarina is seeking a loan of Q. 9,000 to purchase products for daily use, which will allow her to offer better service to her customers.  Catarina's dream is to increase her earnings in order to build a home and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase groceries to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers for his internet cafe

loans.name: Toufica

texts.en:
Toufica is a 45-year-old, widowed mother of three children. She works hard to provide them necessary living standards since her husband passed away. She is a talented hairdresser and has learned this profession through her mother, who encouraged her to learn it. Her 24 years of experience provided her with special talents and skills, which encouraged her to establish her own beauty salon two years ago. At the beginning, she had to work hard to build a strong chain of customers. 

Through her currently acquired loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, Toufica seeks to buy gowns, dresses and new business needs, to start selling in her salon, to increase her income and develop her financial situation. 

Her future plan is to expand her business, through diversifying the products and services provided.

loans.use: to buy gowns, dresses, and new business needs, to increase her income and develop her financial situation

loans.name: The Spiritens Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Molly from Mutare. She is married with three children, two who are attending school.  Molly runs a retail business selling chains and cutter bars. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenge she faces is that of late payments by her clients. Molly has requested a loan of $500 to buy chains and cutter bars for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost business, and she expects to buy a car from the profits of the business. In the future, Molly plans to increase sales and diversify into a chips frying business. Molly is a member of The Spiritens Girls Group.

loans.use: to buy chains and cutter bars to sell.

loans.name: Lizette Maria

texts.es: Lizette es madre de dos hijos de las edades de 18 y 15 estudian la universidad y la escuela secundaria, para ella y su esposo es muy importante la buena educación de sus hijos, gracias a su empleo como psicóloga en un colegio privado mantiene los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita el crédito porque necesita mejorar el techo de su vivienda para garantizar un hogar seguro para la familia, mas ahora que viene el invierno, con el financiamiento comprara láminas de zinc, perlines y el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Lizette is the mother of two children who are 18 and 15 years old; they attend university and secondary school. A good education for their children is very important to her and her husband. Thanks to her job as a psychologist in a private school, she covers her household expenses. 

Lizette is requesting a loan because she needs to repair the roof of her house in order to guarantee a safe home for her family, especially now that winter is coming. With the loan, she will buy laminated metal sheeting and roof beams and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting and roof beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: 29 De Octubre  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el lugar la Sequita de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo de Crédito  29 de Octubre, este es un grupo de 12 mujeres y 1 hombre que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, este lugar está a pocos minutos del balneario de Crucita lugar de hermosas playas con una gran variedad en su gastronomía y lugares turísticos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sandra, tiene 34 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 7 años el cual estudia en escuela,  viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganar algo por su cuenta y con sus ganancias sacar adelante a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de azzorti (ropa, zapatos, bisutería, artículos para el hogar y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los  días de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica al comercio con el cual sale adelante y trata de darle lo mejor a su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos a ella y a sus compañeros del grupo. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
In Sequita, in the parish of Crucita in Poroviejo, the members of Grupo de Credito 29 de Octubre meet every 15 days. The group is made of 12 women and 1 man who participate in a wide variety of activities to improve their quality of life. Sequita is located just minutes away from the health resort in Crucita, a place with beautiful beaches and wide variety of gastronomy and tourist attractions. 
One of the members is Sandra. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has a 7 year old child who is in school and lives at home. 
Sandra is a hard working woman who always likes to do things on her own and with her earnings she tries to give her son opportunities to advance. She makes a living by selling azzorti products (clothing, shoes, jewelry, home goods and women's accessories). She works almost every day, two to three hours a day. She sells on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She has run her business for 5 years and has been able to get ahead and give a better life to her son. 
This loan is to be used to purchase clothing, shoes and jewelry. She has been a member of Grupo de Credito from the start and she likes being a member because of the help that the loans provide for her and her associates. Her dream is to give a better life to her son.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fleece material and waterproof material (baby wear) for her sewing business.

loans.name: Wave Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Naomi from Mutare. She is married with two children, both attending school. Naomi runs a poultry business producing chickens. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are that the previous months have been characterized by a liquidity crisis and the high competition in the poultry business. Naomi has requested a loan of $375 to buy more feed and increase the number of chickens that they are operating with. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to uplift the living standards of her family and support the business to remain profitable. In the future Naomi plans to own a bigger space where they can operate from at a larger scale. Naomi is a member of Wave Stars Group.

loans.use: to buy more feed and increase the number of chickens that they are producing

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Don Teodoro de 76 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, esta acompañado, su esposa de se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen tres hijos los cuales trabajan en la capital, con él solo viven dos nietos y su esposa.
   
Él Se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, como maíz, frijol por otra parte también trabaja sembrando y produciendo café. Desde hace 14 años es caficultor y maíz siembra desde hace 20 años sus padres fueron los responsables que él aprendiera esta actividad, ya que lo llevaban al trabajo desde pequeño, por el momento solo esta actividad productiva tiene, la distancia a donde tiene la finca de café es de 2 km y se conduce a pie para llegar a trabajar. Sus hijas son las que se encargan de comprarle los insumos agrícolas para que le aplique a los cultivos tanto de frijol y maíz así como también de café 
   


Don Teodoro dice que con el financiamiento cubrirá parte de un crédito que tiene en la institución y con el resto comprara 10 quintales de sulfato para fertilizar el café. Satisfacera la necesidad de poder comprar los insumos para sus cultivos ya que de otra forma se ve limitado a poderlos comprar.


Los sueños de Don Teodoro son  repoblar  toda la finca de café, sacar buena producción , así mismo comprar un terreno  que está cerca de su finca y aumentar así la producción, el préstamo ayudara a ampliarse  en la siembra de más plantas de café, con sus ganancias podrá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 76 years old and studied up until fourth grade.  He is married and his wife dedicates herself to household work.  They have three children who work in the capital.  Only two grandchildren and his wife live with him.  He works primarily growing basic grains such as corn and beans, but he also works planting and producing coffee.  For the past 14 years, he has produced coffee, and he has been growing corn for 20 years.  His parents were the ones who taught him this trade since they would take him to work from a young age.  At the moment, this is his only job. His coffee farm is 2 kilometers away, and he walks to work.  His daughters are the ones who purchase the agricultural supplies for him so that he can apply them to his bean, corn and coffee crops.  

Teodoro states that with the loan he will repay part of a previous loan that he has with the institution, and the rest will be used to purchase 10 barrels of sulfate to fertilize his coffee.  The loan will allow him to purchase the supplies that he needs for his crops because without it, he would not be able to purchase them.  Teodoro's dreams are to repopulate his whole farm with coffee, to yield a good harvest, and to purchase a plot that is close to his farm to increase his production.  The loan will help him to expand his coffee crops.  With his earnings he will be able to continue to work.

loans.use: repat part of a loan that he has with the institution and the rest will be used to purchase 10 barrels of sulfate to fertilize his coffee.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is the age of 42, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a mason, by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for 25 years. He is very expert in his art; he has manufactured a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. 

He uses tools, such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level, which have become out of order. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction work, but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy these tools. 

Therefore, Rifat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empowered to buy new tools for construction.
Rifat gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband, such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 35-year-old lady; she is living with her three daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband works in a small firm for low wages. She owns a small clothing business at home. She purchases clothes from the market for low prices and sells them for high prices in her community. The ladies of her town like her garments collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. Now the summer season is going on she wants to buy the clothes of the summer season to sell, but she does not have cash in hand due to household expenses.
  
Therefore, Samina has requested a Kiva loan so she can buy the clothes of summer season to cope with the demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy the summer season's clothing for reselling.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María, mujer de 59 años madre de 11 hijos. La señora María no asistió a una escuela, ella es viuda, vive con sus hijos menores, porque los mayores ya formaron su hogar y viven aparte. En la escuela tiene dos de sus hijos por los que se esfuerza para darles el estudio. Es una mujer de mucha experiencia en la siembra de semillas, lo aprendió de sus padres ya que por parte de ellos recibió una buena educación.
El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra de sandía y con ello obtener mejores ganancias.
El plan a futuro es seguir trabajando para ayudarles a sus hijos a salir adelante y así puedan tener una mejor educación.
texts.en:
María is a 59 year old woman and mother of 11 children. Señora María did not attend school and is a widow who lives with her young children, because the adult ones formed their own homes and live separately. She has two sons in school and strives to give them an education. She is a woman with a lot of experience planting seeds, which she learned from her parents.

María needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting watermelon and thereby obtaining higher profits. Her plan for the future is to continue working to help her children succeed and have a better education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting watermelon to obtain higher profits

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 54-year-old, married woman living with her four sons and three daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been pasting embroidery material over clothing pieces at home along with her daughters. She wants to buy a press machine for pasting raw material over clothing pieces, so she can increase production on a daily basis and can generate more income.

Currently, Safia has requested a Kiva loan to buy a press machine, so she can increase her sales. She is required to provide better living standards to her family. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a press machine for pasting embroidery material over clothing pieces

loans.name: Udai

texts.en:
Udai is a 23-year-old single man from Qabatiya, a small village near the city of Jenin. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Udai has had a carpentry business for three years. He has  good experience in this field. He wants to improve his business and take more orders. 
Udai took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more wood for his workshop.  Udai will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 21-year-old, single, young man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a simple house. Salem works as a fish hunter, with an unstable income; this is the only source of income for the family. Salem would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the family's needed stuff. 

Salem took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home. By taking this loan, Salem will be able to provide hot water for his family, using cheap power. 

Salem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 25-year-old, single, young man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a simple house. Mustafa works in selling fruits and vegetables in the local market, with an unstable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mustafa would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the family's needed stuff. 

Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home. By taking this loan, Mustafa will be able to provide hot water for his family using cheap power. 

Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy melons, papayas, oranges, milk, cocoa, etc.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 37-year-old married woman from Gaza City. She lives with her husband and two sons in a simple house. She works as an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income; this is the only source of income to the family. Salwa would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need. 

Salwa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water purification machine for the family home. By taking this loan, Salwa will be able to give her family pure and healthy water. 

Salwa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat continues the business of her relations. She has an agricultural business. Hikmat is 52 years old. She is married and a responsible mother of four children. She has been busy with agricultural business for more than 10 years. Hikmat feeds cows. Now, she has four cows. Additionally she grows potatoes. Hikmat has 1.5 hectares of land. She is going to plant more and get a good harvest but she does not have enough money to buy potato seeds. Also, she is going to buy two young cows. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy potato seeds and two young cows. From the profit she is going to improve her living condition. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and two young cows

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a buy-and-sell root crops business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional root crops to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional root crops to sell

loans.name: Ruby Ana

texts.en:
Ruby Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as can goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Ruby Ana has been in this business for 3 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ruby Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as can goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Maryfel

texts.en: Maryfel is 30 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. Maryfel has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fishing. Maryfel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Seonilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Seonilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish and food vending. Seonilyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Seonilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Genevilla

texts.en: Genevilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. Genevilla has been in this business for four years. She also earn income from pig fattening. Genevilla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 54-year-old lady. She lives with her four daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her daughters stitch clothing for the people of her community and use the income received to support the entire family. They are facing problems of a lot of load shedding in their area and want to buy a power generator for immediate backup to fulfill the demand.

However, due to lack of savings and funds, her daughters are unable to meet the daily demands of customers. For this reason, Parveen has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

She intends to use this loan amount to buy a power generator, repair motor, and to be able to buy additional stock of threads, spools, and needles to create a means of increasing revenue so she may generate a healthier source of income.

Parveen hopes that this loan will prove to be positive and beneficial for her family and will be the cause for getting more income. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a power generator, repair motor, and buy additional threads, spools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy is a 34-year-old mother of three children. Her husband is a soldier. They have always worked together for the well being of their children, who they strive to provide with a good education and a better living. Maguy has worked a hairdresser from her house for eight years. She is well known in her region for her special talents and prices.

This is Maguy’s third loan cycle from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua. Her previous loan helped her to make necessary maintenance to her new house, which she moved into, and to buy new tools for her business. Today, her acquired loan will be invested in developing her business, through buying special summer beauty products like hair protection, and perfumes, which she will sell to her customers. This will help to increase her income.  She hopes to expand and develop her business through opening her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy special summer beauty products like hair protection, and perfumes, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gaio

texts.en:
Gaio is a 32-year-old civil servant and is married to Elda, a 24 year old housewife. They have 3 children: Geofania is 4 years old, Gabriela is 3 years old, and Gerald is 1 year old. Geofania and Gabriela attend kindergarten. 

Gaio recently bought a new house and has been living there since last February. The house consists of a living room and two bedrooms. The house is quite small for his family and he intends to extend his house gradually. In addition, his family cannot access water provided by the Municipal Waterworks because his residence is quite far from the urban area. Instead, he  purchases 5,000 liters of water from the water tank.  

Therefore, he has requested  6,000,000 IDR from TLM to build a storage container next to his house for 5,000 liters of water. The loan will be spent on building materials such as cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: A woman who is always in search of a new source of income needs your financial support because she wants to develop her business deal. She is 31 years old. Gulbahor is married and bringing up three children. Her children are 11, 6, and 3 years old. Five years ago, Gulbahor began her own business deal. She sells women's clothes in a local market. Gulbahor buys goods in Uzbekistan and sells them in Tajikistan. She manages her business alone and runs her business well. She always tries to offer her customers high-quality clothes. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy women's clothes for the new summer season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new summer season

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a 29-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and two kids, a boy and a girl, in a simple house. Fawzi works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Fawzi  would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need.
 
Fawzi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home. By taking this loan, Fawzi will be able to provide hot water for his family using cheap power. 

Fawzi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy bananas to sell for her business. May has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear and blankets.

loans.name: Action Group

texts.en:
Constance is the leader of the Action group. She is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children who are 30, 25, 20 and 14 years old. Two of the children attend school.

She has a poultry business under Chipinge branch in Zimbabwe.She has run this business for 6 years and sells to the local market.  This is her only source of income. She says that the main challenge to her business is failing to satisfy the market.

Constance requested this loan of $300 through MicroKing to purchase additional chicken feed and chicks to raise.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her raise and sell more chicks.

In the future,she would like to increase her number of chickens and add more fowl runs.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 28-year-old woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her financial condition is not good.  Her husband drives a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of motorbike). This rickshaw is  driven over local roads for small distances. The polyester body does not hold up well on the bumby roads. The rickshaw’s body needs to be replaced because it’s rattles when driven. This is the reason her husband wants to buy new body for the Moto Rickshaw.

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan for her husband to buy the rickshaw body.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled rickshaw.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta 4to grado, por sus limitantes económicas no pudo continuar, es casada, su esposo es quien mas trabaja en la agricultura sembrado granos básicos. Tienen 2 hijos, la primera estudio bachillerato  y el segundo no estudia, con ella solo vive su esposo sus dos hijos y dos nietos.
   

   La señora se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos junto a su esposo e hijo,  llevan ya 18 años de ser agricultores, sus padres tan poco no tenían otra fuente de ingresos más que la agricultura, ella salía a dejarle almuerzo a su padre y se fijaba cada vez más cuales eran las actividades que realizaba, fue así como aprendió esta actividad, siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad, el lugar donde trabajan le queda a 15 minutos de su casa y se transportan a pie. los involucrados son su esposo y su hijo quienes realizan la mayoría de las actividades agrícolas.

  
Con el financiamiento comprara todos los insumos para la siembra de los granos básicos, entre los cuales están. Tres quintales de fórmula, cuatro quintales de sulfato, los insecticiditas y herbicidas, el crédito ayudara a comprar lo necesario ya que en otros años lo ha podido sembrar la misma cantidad que pretende sembrar hoy todo por la falta de una oportunidad.


El sueño de Rosa es obtener una buena cosecha si es posible vender al final para sacar ingresos que le permitan seguir trabajando para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. También pretende mejorar parte de su vivienda cambiándole en techo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and has a fourth grade education.  Due to financial limitations, she was not able to continue attending school.  She is married, and her husband works with her in agriculture, growing basic grains.  They have two children.  The eldest graduated from high school and the youngest does not attend school.  Her husband, their two children and two grandchildren live with them.  Rosa works growing basic grains with her husband and son.  They have been farmers for 18 years.  Her parents also did not have another source of income besides agriculture.  She used to bring lunch to her father and would pay attention to the work that he was doing, which is how she learned the trade and since then, she has been devoted to this work.  The place where they work is 15 minutes away from their home, and they walk there.  She works with her husband and son who do the majority of the agricultural work.  

With the loan, she will purchase all of the supplies needed to plant the basic grains, which includes: three barrels of formula, four barrels of sulfate, insecticides and herbicides.  The loan will help them to purchase the necessary supplies since in the past, they have not been able to plant as much as they plan on planting now due to a lack of opportunity.  Rosa's dream is to have a good harvest and be able to sell it to earn an income that will allow her to continue working to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She also plans on repairing part of her home by changing the roof.

loans.use: purchase three barrels of formula, four barrels of sulfate, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Don Pascual es un hombre casado de 51 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que es piloto de un mototaxi, eligió esta labor porque un amigo le enseño a manejar, ahora el obtiene un ingreso que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
En esta actividad ya lleva dos años, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de un terreno, ya que desea construir su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que actualmente tiene.
El sueño de don Pascual es comprar dos mototaxis para incrementar su ingreso y mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Pascual is a 51 year old married man.  He lives with his two children in Sololá.  He is a hardworking man who fights to get his family ahead.  He states that he is a mototaxi driver, a career which he chose because a friend taught him how to drive.  Now he earns an income that helps him cover his family's expenses.  He has two years of experience in this job.

He is seeking a loan of Q 5,000 to purchase a plot of land because he wishes to build his home so that he can improve his family's living conditions.  He will repay the loan with the job that he currently has.  Pascual's dream is to purchase two mototaxis to increase his income and improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land because he wishes to build his home.

loans.name: Otelia

texts.en:
An $800 loan is being offered to Otelia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involved with this business since 2002. 

Otelia feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as eggs, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, breads, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, salt, and shampoo

Running a business has made Otelia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, breads, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, salt, and shampoo

loans.name: Asfa

texts.en:
Asfa is a 23-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. 

He welds motorbike spare parts and doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding equipment has become out-of-order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy new welding equipment, but he does not have the money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Asfa has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband will be able to buy welding equipment and additional iron rods for manufacturing. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment and additional iron rods for manufacturing

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 25-year-old single man from the city of Gaza. He lives with his family in a simple house. Mahmoud is employed in a local firm where he earns a low income, which is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed items.
 
Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a water purification system for the family home. Mahmoud will be able to give his family pure and healthy water.

loans.use: to buy a water purification system for the family home.

loans.name: Taskira

texts.en:
Taskira is a woman who has seen a lot of difficulties in her life. She is widowed and the only breadwinner for her three children. She began her business selling women's clothes15 years ago because she needed money. Taskira sells in a local market and has regular customers. She has great experience in this field and her skills and experience help her to develop her business. Her children help with managing the business. This business is the family's only source of income, so they have poor living conditions. 

Taskira must buy women's clothes for the new season, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy women's clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Victoria is in her early 40s and is a widow with two children. One goes to school and the other one is an adult.  She has run a general store for six years and works from 6:00am to 10:00pm daily to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Victoria's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase inventory for the shop.  She dreams of making her shop into a very big and international shop.  

Victoria will share this loan with her loan group "TRUST"  three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sand, cement, iron, sheet metal and pay for labor.

loans.name: Brandon Osiel

texts.es:
Brandon es un joven de 22 años de edad, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque porque quiere ser el orgullo de su familia y poder apoyarlos; a Brandon le gusta mucho ña música, por ello trabaja en varias orquestas desde hace 3 años, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que el se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de música de su ciudad y va por el cuarto año; el cree que le va bien porque ama lo que hace, para el la música es su fuente de inspiración y de lucha cada día.

Brandon esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá tomar un taller de música en el conservatorio de música de la ciudad de Lima y de esta manera poder seguir preparándose para poder mejorar en su carrera y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tocar para los mejores conservatorios del mundo”.
texts.en:
Brandon, 22, is a young man with a strong will to get ahead. He wants his family to be proud of him and to be able to help them. Brandon loves music, so he has been working with different music bands since he was three. This has helped him to pay for his studies. He studies at the local music school and he is in the fourth year of his studies. He believes he does well because he loves what he does. For him, music is a source of inspiration to fight every day.

Brandon appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him, because thanks to that he will be able to participate in a workshop organized by the conservatory of Lima. He will be able to continue with his music carrier and make his dream come true: “to play for the best conservatories in the world.”

loans.use: to pay the fees of a music workshop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 22 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Zenaida has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Zenaida has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Zenaida is committed to rebuild her devastated life and she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Roselie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Roselie has been raising ducks for seven years and also earns income from rice farming and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Richard. He is a farmer who lives in the Litein area of Kenya on a small piece of land. He has been working on the land for the last 17 years! To afford a decent living for his four children, Richard sells milk and tea produced on his farm. To make extra money, he engages in other small personal businesses.

Like many farmers in the region, Richard finds cow drenching quite enjoyable. His biggest challenge, however, is insecticides. Most of Richard's income goes to the high family-related expenses. 

Richard is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. The shed will be easy to clean for hygiene purposes. Improving his animals' hygiene will avoid infections and poor health. Richard believes healthy animals are more productive thus his dairy activity will be more profitable. 

Your loan contribution will help Richard's family make more income and enjoy fresh milk as part of their daily diet.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is married with six school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bendera has operated a fruit and vegetable business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 52-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law in the Chiatura district. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension, and her husband gets orders and works as an artisan. 

The income of the family is not enough to cover everyday expenses. Nargiz decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to start a trading business. 

Nargiz will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then will resell at a higher prices to generate profit. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family. 

Nargiz awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 9° grado esta felizmente casada y es responsable de cuidar a sus siete hijos de edades entre 5 a 20 años, su esposo solamente se dedica a la agricultura y algunos trabajos de jornalero.

 María le gusta mucho el trabajo en el campo y le ayuda a su esposo a realizar labores agricolas y ademas en su tiempo libre hace muñecos de barro para comercializarlos en la epoca navideña ya tiene 15 años de dicarse a este oficio.

El préstamo lo utilizara par comprar sulfato de amonio y herbicidas insumos que necesita para prerparar la tierra donde cultiva el maíz.
su sueño mas grande es ver a sus hijos con trabajo para que puedan velar por si mismos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and has a ninth grade education.  She is happily married and is responsible for the care of her seven children who are between the ages of 5 and 20.  Her husband works in agriculture and sometimes as a day laborer.  María enjoys working in the fields and helps her husband with his agricultural work.  In her free time, she also makes clay dolls to sell during the christmas season.  She has 15 years of experience making these dolls.

The loan will be used to purchase ammonium sulfate and herbicides, supplies that she needs to prepare the land where she grows corn.  Her biggest dreams are to see her children with jobs so that they can take care of themselves, and to repair her home.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies like ammonium sulfate and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides and foliar spray for planting watermelon, as that is what’s grown in the area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino de 69 años de edad, padre de 6 hijos, esta casado, él no asistió a la escuela, sus hijos lastimosamente no viven con él por motivos personales, él trabaja en la agricultura trabajo que aprendió de su padre desde que era niño, él no depende de nadie solamente de su trabajo que emprende día con día, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y foliares y con la cosecha poder obtener dinero y mejores condiciones de vida.

A futuro sueña cultivar mas tierra para así obtener mas y mejores cosechas para sacar dinero del cultivo y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 69 is married and the father of six children. He did not go to school. His children do not live with him, unfortunately, due to personal reasons. He works in agriculture, something he learned from his father when he was a boy. He is independent and works every day for his sustenance.

Marcelino will use this loan to buy seed, compost, herbicides, insecticides and leaf fertilizers. He hopes to received good money for his harvest and improve his living conditions. In the future, he dreams of expanding his plantations in order to harvest more and better produce. This would leave him more money and would help him give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides and leaf fertilizers.

loans.name: Rifat's Group

texts.en:
Rifat is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a 2 children. Her husband is a professional rickshaw driver. For many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly because he is unable to generate capital to repair the vehicle. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

Rifat is the group leader and Robina and Zulfiqar  are members.  Due to the lack of money, it is difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Rifat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband pay to repair the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rifat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintaine her husband's Rickshaw.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a 33-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Noreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He is a cobbler and an expert in his profession. He has been making shoes for many years; this is the reason he has a lot of experience with his profession. He sews leather and Rexine shoes by machine and attaches the sole through stitching by hand. 

In this way, he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home and has now established a shop to continue his business on a wider level. He does not have cash in hand to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, Noreen has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy raw materials such as leather, Rexine, and glue for making shoes. 

Noreen thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe making.

loans.name: Vanessa Isadora

texts.es: Doña Vanessa, tiene bajo su cargo un un hijo al que apoya en sus estudios, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzado de manera ambulante, por encargo y en su casa de habitación, de esta manera  Vanessa se gana la vida, y ha podido hacerle mejoras a su vivienda poco a poco, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para invertir en la instalación de servicio higiénico y comprar tierra para nivelar su patio, ya que esta no tiene buenas condiciones sanitarias.
texts.en:
Vanessa has one child under her care, and she supports his education.  She sells clothes, cosmetics, and shoes in an itinerant manner.  She also sells by order at her house.  This is the way that Vanessa earns a living.  

She has been able to make improvements to her house little by little.  She is now requesting the loan to invest in the installation a toilet and to buy dirt to level her patio.  As it is now, the sanitary conditions are not good.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, cement blocks, cement, sand, iron, pipes, and dirt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement, sand, iron, and beams.

loans.name: Jane Christy

texts.en:
Jane Christy is 30 years old and single. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and home was wiped out. 

Jane Christy is taking out a housing loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. With your help, Jane Christy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 61 años de edad, se a dedicado a la agrucultura desde los doce años solamente logro sacar 3° grado por cuestiones economicas vive con su esposa y sus siete hijos de los cuales dos le ayudan a realizar los labores agricolas.
 Miguel antes se dedicaba a las obras publicas pero tiempo despues se dedico solamente a los labores agricolas.
con el prestamo comprara los insumos para la siembra de maiz que ya esta cerca, aprovechando las primeras lluvias, los materiales que compraria son sulfato de amonió y herbicidas entre otros.
El sueño de  Miguel es que sus hijos tengan educación y que cada uno de ellos obtenga un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Miguel is 61 years old and has worked in agriculture since the age of 12.  He only reached the third grade due to his financial situation.  He lives with his wife and their seven children of which two help him with his farm work.  Miguel used to work in public works, but after some time he dedicated himself solely to agricultural work.

With the loan, he will purchase supplies to plant corn, as the first rains will be coming soon and he wants to take advantage of them.  The supplies that he will purchase are ammonium sulfate and herbicides, among others.  Miguel's dream is for his children to have an education and for each of them to have a dignified job.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to plant basic grains such as ammonium sulfate and herbicides.
